loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 27. She is married and has three children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in business for the past three years. With this loan, she wants to buy more bananas and cassava for sale. The profits from this business will be used for buying a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Liliane

texts.en: Liliane is aged 44; she is married with three children, all of whom go to school. She owns a grocery store and has been running this business for the past two years. She would like to buy more grocery items to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Floricita

texts.en:
Floricita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making copra in the Philippines. She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more coconuts for her copra business.

Floricita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Floricita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts for making copra

loans.name: Ma. Magdalina

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalina is a 45-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has eight children. The oldest is 24 years old while the youngest is nine months old. Most of her children are currently studying in school.

She is in the fishing business and has also been operating a sari-sari, or variety store, as her second business for 15 years now. She has monthly earnings of 10,000 PHP which help her support all her children's schooling and the needs of her family. 

Ma. Magdalina is requesting a loan to buy items like canned goods, salt, noodles, toiletries, sugar, milk and food snacks. With this loan she will be able to buy merchandise for her store and attract the attention of the customers in her community.

In the future, Ma. Magdalina hopes to expand her business and to increase profits.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, salt, noodles, toiletries, sugar, milk and food snacks

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es: Clara con su anterior credikiva compró lavadoras y con ello aumentó sus ingresos, ella con su financiamiento se benefició mucho porque remplazó las antiguas máquinas que ya estaban obsoletas y con ello pudo prestar un excelente servicio. Ella dice a sus financiadores de Kiva que “gracias por la ayuda recibida, porque así puede cumplir con los objetivos que se ha trazado. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará 2 lavadoras más y aumentará su potencial de servicios para dar respuesta a la demanda creciente que la ayudará a cumplir su propósito de prosperidad.
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Clara bought washing machines and this increased her income.  She greatly benefited from the loan because she replaced the older machines that were already obsolete and was able to provide excellent service.  She says thank you to the Kiva lenders for the help she received because this is how she can complete the goals that she has set.  

Right now Clara is applying for a new Kiva loan to buy two more washing machines and increase her service potential to meet the growing demand, which will help her to complete her goal of reaching prosperity.

loans.use: to buy two washing machines.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 24 years old. She is married to a home-builder and has one child, age 2. She sells different items in her store. 

With the loan, Alphonsine will buy more rice, lotion and cooking oil for sale. She will save the profits from the business to increase her savings. 

Alphonsine was very excited to pose for the photo.

loans.use: To buy more rice, lotions and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Jozhef

texts.ru:
Йожеф – из Берегово. Ему 21 год. Он с молодости работает, зарабатывая средства для содержания себя и своих родителей. На данный момент он работает на фирме по производству швейной продукции. 
Сумма в 6 000 гривен понадобилась Йожефу для того, чтобы оформить права на вождение машины. Йожеф никогда не висел на шее родителей, не ждал, что родители приобретут для него автомобиль. Он сам накопил денег и купил машину. Теперь вот он хотел бы оформить права и чтобыне пришлось снова ждать, пока получится скопить денег, решил взять для этого кредит. Появление автомобиля поможет Йожефу и его семье решить разные транспортные вопросы, ведь сразу станет легче добираться до города из села.
texts.en: Yosef, 21, is from Beregovo. He has worked since boyhood, earning money to support himself and his parent. Currently he works at a company that makes clothes. Yosef needs 6000 hrivnas for a driver's license. Yosef has never wanted to live off of his parents, and never expected that they would get him a car. He saved his own money and bught the car himself. Now he would like to get a driver's license but has to wait again until he gets enough money. So he has decided to take out a loan. Having a car will enable Yosef and his family to solve all kinds of transportation problems, since right away it will become a lot easier to get to the city from the village.

loans.use: to get a driver's license

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Josephine is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more items like blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing to sell in her ready-to-wear clothing business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a single mother of five children, two of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

For the past 20 years, Harriet has operated a business selling vegetables. She sells to all categories of people but only on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of carrots, tomatoes, green onions and eggplants. She works at the market six days a week and sells retail only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

Harriet aspires to become a wholesaler and also to start growing her own vegetables. She resides in a rented house where the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include her children's school fees, rent and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more carrots, tomatoes, green onions and eggplants.

loans.name: Viviane

texts.en: Viviane is 52 years old. She sells pharmaceutical products. With the loan, she will buy more items for sale. With the profits she earns from the business, she will pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more pharmaceutical items for sale in the pharmacy.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en: Jean Pierre is 32 years old. He is single and sells rice and potatoes. He has been involved with this business for two years. With this loan he wants to buy maize flour and rice to sell. He would like to use the profits to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy maize flour and rice to sell

loans.name: Sixta

texts.es: Sixta es madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 19 a 27 años. Ella diariamente de lunes a viernes, sale de su casa a las 7 de la mañana y se instala, en la puerta de una empresa importante para ofrecerles a sus empleados deditos, de queso, empanadas, sanduches, jugos naturales, arepas y todos los alimentos que usualmente le compran sus clientes para el desayuno. Su idea de negocio comenzó en su sobrino quien tenía este negocio, pero encontró un empleo formal y se lo propuso a Sixta que lo tomó hace 4 años  y hasta el momento le ha ido muy bien.  Sixta almacena sus productos en una canasta plástica, en la que los transporta   para ser vendidos a empleados, mediante un crédito corto de 15 días,  mientras a ellos reciben el pago del salario quincenal. Otros clientes también le compran de contado, pero usualmente su fortaleza está en poder  financiar su cartera de créditos. Sixta además tiene otro punto de ventas  que atiende toda la semana, y está ubicado muy cerca a su casa donde ofrece los  productos derivados de la harina de trigo. En la actualidad está aplicando un credikiva, primero financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará frutas, verduras, harina de trigo en mayor volumen,  para aumentar su producción pues su clientela ha crecido y requiere tener mucha mas oferta de diversos productos de consumo alimenticio. Su meta es tener mas capital de trabajo con la cual comprar en mayor volumen, para obtener descuentos, esto es justamente lo que hará con su credikiva y con ello espera tener un mayor éxito en sus utilidades porque su sueño es hacer en su casa una segunda planta y mejorar sus instalaciones físicas.
texts.en: Sixta is the mother of 3 children, between 19 and 27 years old. Every day from Monday through Friday, she leaves her house at 7 in the morning and sets up in the doorway of an important business to offer its employees cheese sticks, empanadas, sandwiches, natural juices, arepas, and all kinds of food that her customers usually buy for breakfast. The idea for the business was born because her nephew had this business, but he found a regular job and offered it to Sixta. She took it over 4 years ago and so far it has gone well for her. Sixta stores her products in a plastic basket that she uses to transport them to sell to the workers with a short term credit of two weeks, when they get their paychecks. Other customers also pay her up front, but usually her strength is being able to sell on credit. Sixta also has another sales point where she works all week. It is located very close to her house and there she sells products made from wheat flour. Right now, she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan she has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy fruit, vegetables, and flour in larger quantities to increase her production for her customers, because her clientele has grown and she needs to offer more diverse products for consumption. Her goal is to have more working capital to be able to buy in larger quantities in order to obtain discounts. This is just what she will do with her Kiva loan. With it, she hopes to have more success with her profits because her dream is to put a second floor on her house and improve its facilities.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, and flour in larger quantities.

loans.name: Marcet

texts.en:
Marcet is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine business in the Philippines. Marcet is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more empty gallon cans for her coconut wine business.

Marcet has sustained her business activities through six previous loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more empty gallon cans for her coconut wine.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian es casado y tiene un hijo y está en etapa escolar en un colegio estatal, viven en casa de sus suegros, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Rio La Portada  de la ciudad de El Alto.

El estudió hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente trabaja en un taller de tejidos juntamente con su esposa.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar materia prima (lana) y una máquina de tejer, para elaborar busos de lana  para niños.

El sueño de Cristian es tener una microempresa  de tejidos y que sus productos se comercialicen a nivel nacional.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Cristian is married and has one child, who is school age and attends a state school.  They live in his mother and father-in-law’s house.  It is located in the Rio La Portada area of the city of El Alto.

He went to school until high school.  He currently works together with his wife in a knitwear workshop.

He needs the loan to buy raw material (wool) and a knitting machine in order to make woolen sweatshirts for children.

Cristian’s dream is to have a small knitting business and for his products to be sold on a national level.

It is the first time he has requested a loan with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy wool and a knitting machine in order to make woolen sweatshirts for children.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman from San Miguel, Bohol and is the mother of a seven year old daughter. She is engaged in farming and grows rice. She has been growing rice for 7 years.

She earns 3,000 PHP a month through farming. Her husband is a construction worker and helps finance the family's daily expenses. Nancy requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay laborers' wages. In the future, Nancy would like to invest in other ventures to support her family and save for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay laborers' wages

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil is 51 years old and lives in the Aspindza district with his wife. The only source for the family is the small monthly income earned by Vasil working as a welder locally. He has welding equipment and welds cars. 

He has decided to expand his welding business to supplement his income but he does not qualify under income requirements. Vasil is requesting a loan under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This loan program envisions providing start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the rural poor who do not have access to many credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. Vasil will use his loan to purchase new welding equipment which is more modern and powerful. He will have more customers and provide services to his local community members, and hopes to increase the monthly income of the family. His new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase modern and powerful welding equipment

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a 40-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has eight children. The eldest is 19 years old and the youngest is 4 years old. She has been engaged in a fishing business for 15 years now together with her husband. This is the source of her income.

Merlita is requesting a loan to buy an additional fishing net, fish hooks and floaters. Through this loan, she will be able to catch more fish and sell it to people in her community.

In the future, Merlita hopes to expand her business and gain more profit. She also hoping for the better future of her children.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net, fish hooks and floaters.

loans.name: Djiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguitougou, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 27 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de chaussures, des ustensiles de cuisine, des produits cosmétiques, des condiments, des habillements, des tubercules et du charbon de bois.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Djiguitougou sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente FATOUMATA, troisième personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter des denrées alimentaires (tubercules, banane plantain, viande et condiments) au marché de Fana  destinés pour la préparation et la vente des plats alimentaires au bord du goudron reliant Ségou à Bamako.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de restauration.
texts.en:
The Djiguitougou group is made up exclusively of married women having an average age of 27 years, and an average of three children each. They all live in large, traditional families in the town of Fana, in the region of Koulikoro (second-biggest administrative region in the Republic of Mali).

The women are either relatives, neighbors, or friends to one another. They prepare and sell food dishes, and they buy and sell shoes, kitchen utensils, cosmetic products, condiments, clothing, yams, and charcoal.
 
The women of the Djiguitougou group are on their second group loan.

FATOUMATA is the third person from the left in the photo. She plans to buy foodstuffs (yams, plantains, meat, and condiments) at the market in Fana, then use the foodstuffs to prepare and sell dishes alongside the road that connects Ségou and Bamako.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA, part of which she will use to cover the needs of her family. She will also reinvest a portion of the profits in her business of selling prepared dishes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items like rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es: Lorena de 49 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos-Su día a día transcurre desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche vendiendo el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras, negocio que inició desde hace 5 años, después de haber quedado desempleada y decidir generar   ingresos por  cuenta propia. Sus ventas las realiza de contado entre los vecinos de su barrio que acuden a recibir el servicio para lavar la ropa de maneras efectivas y resguardadas del candente sol del Caribe Colombiano.Lorena con su amabilidad y buen servicio atrae a muchos clientes, pero últimamente muchos de estos se quedan sin recibir el servicio porque la demanda en superior a sus posibilidades de respuesta. Esto es justamente lo que hará con su credikiva, con el cual comprará maquinas de lavar, para responder a su mercado y de esta manera generar mas ingresos. Este es su primer financiamiento al que aplica con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual planea aumentar poco a poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lorena is a 49-year old woman who lives in the town of Soledad with her husband and three children. She works from 7am to 7pm selling washing machine rentals, a business that she started 5 years ago when, after becoming unemployed, she decided to generate income on her own. Her clients are neighbors that want to wash their clothes effectively and away from the hot sun of the Colombian Caribbean. 

Lorena's friendliness and good service quality attract many clients. However, many of them have not been able to receive the service lately because demand exceeds capacity. She plans to use the requested Kiva loan to buy washing machines to respond to demand and therefore generate more income. This will be her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she expects it to help improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy washing machines.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Otgonbayar is 30 years old. He lives with his wife and two sons in a newly built small house in the Bulgan province of Mongolia. His wife, Uyanga, works at a local school as an assistant teacher. His son Dolgoon, age 10, goes to a local school, and his son Bilguun, age 2, goes to a local kindergarten.

He has been working at a construction site as an assistant worker since 2002 and has just started a taxi service business in town. He is now requesting 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase insulation material and vacuum windows in order to stay warm during the winters of Mongolia. He is a hardworking, neat and diligent person.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material and vacuum windows in order to stay warm during the winters of Mongolia.

loans.name: Benjamin Rafael

texts.es: Benjamín es un hombre casado y padre de 6 hijos adultos, que vive con su cónyueg en el municipio de Sabanagrande. Él es muy dedicado a la tierra y a la cría de especies menores. Aun recuerda como hace 16 años un viejo amigo le dejó cuidando una finca y aprendió a trabajar en la ganadería. Hoy siembra plantas y las vende en su vivero ubicado en el municipio donde obtuvo su experiencia hace mucho tiempo. En la actualidad tiene muchas metas, pero la principal es la de crecimiento de su negocio, porque planea mas adelante, hacer remodelaciones a su vivienda para sentirse más confortable. Este es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y es un credikiva, con el cual comprará plantas y raíces,  para cultivar vegetales, aumentar su potencial de ventas y crear su historial creditico,  pues le ha sido difícil conseguir un buen financiamiento sin él. Esta es la razón de su credikiva, con el cual superará la dificultad de acceso a fuentes de financiación y aumentará sus posibilidades de venta con una mayor oferta de plantas.
texts.en:
Benjamin is a married man and father of six adult children who lives with his wife in the town of Sabanagrande.  He is very dedicated to the land and to raising small farm animals.  He still remembers how 16 years ago an old friend left him in charge of caring for a farm and he learned how to work with the livestock.  Today he cultivates plants and sells them in his nursery located in the town where he gained his experience many years ago.  He has many goals, but the main one is to grow his business because he plans to later make renovations to his home in order to be more comfortable.  

This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and it is a Kiva loan.  With it he will buy plants and roots to grow vegetables, increase his sales potential, and grow his credit history since it has been difficult to obtain good financing without it. This is the reason behind his Kiva loan, with which he will overcome the difficult access to funding sources and he will increase his sales opportunities with a better offering of plants.

loans.use: to buy plants and roots to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Nuri 3 Group

texts.en:
Supi lives with her husband, Supardi, who works as a construction laborer in Jatinegara Village in the east of Jakarta. She is 56 years old and has three children, but they already work. Currently, she is doing her business, which is selling children's snacks in front of her house such as ice, fried snacks and other children's snacks. She has already run this business for more than 10 years. 

She is requesting this loan to increase her capital. She will use this loan to buy oil, sugar and children's snacks. 

Some of the other members are engaged in businesses such as the sale of belts, household furniture and clothes on credit, and a grocery store.

Supi has plans to expand her business and add goods to her business.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar and children's snacks.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is aged 32. She is married with three children; they all go to schools. She sells sorghum and cassava. She wants the loan to buy more sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build her house.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 55 years old and married with five children. Ninfa works very hard to provide for them.

Ninfa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Ninfa has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, rice, feeds and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Ninfa would like to save enough money to build a piggery.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is a 42-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has three children. The oldest child is 22, while youngest is 6. 

She operates a retail store. She sells commodities like biscuits, canned goods, soaps and condiments. Meriam requested a loan of 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional merchandise to sell like soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, soaps and garments. 

Meriam would like to invest in other business ventures to augment her income to support her family's basic needs, including the quality education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell like soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, soaps and garments.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona is from Yeghvard village of Kotayk region. She studies economics at the University. Sona is 21 years old and lives with her parents and brother. 

Sona's father is a taxi driver and is the only breadwinner in the family. It is very difficult for him to cover the family's basic costs and save money for Sona's education. So, Sona has requested this loan to pay for her university tuition. The loan is very important for Sona to complete her education, find a well-paying job, and help her parents to sustain their family.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Thimon

texts.en:
Thimon is a 45-year-old businesswoman who lives in Nimule. She is married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 11. All of them go to school.

Thimon sells fruits and vegetables and has been in business for four years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan Limited through other clients. She is taking a loan of SSP 1500 to purchase tomatoes, matooke, avocados, and many other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years, Thimon would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Thimon says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan Limited, through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items for her business, like eggs, matooke, and avocados.

loans.name: Chadhia

texts.en:
Chadhia is single. She sells soft drinks and alcoholic drinks. She has spent four years in the business of running a bar. 

With the loan, she wants to add more sodas and local brews made in Rwanda to sell in her bar. She plans to provide food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more sodas and local brews for sale.

loans.name: Ronerie

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ronerie works hard to support her family. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a general store. 

Ronerie is borrowing PHP 29,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ronerie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina works hard to support her family. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Dina requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. Dina has been in this business for three years now and also earns additional income from fruit vending.

In the future, Dina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 50-year-old farmer in Nkubu county, in Kenya, where he lives with his wife and six children. Only four of the children are still schooling. Simon has been in farming for the past ten years, producing milk and vegetables which he sells at the local market.

He is requesting a KES 60,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase materials for constructing a zero-grazing unit and to buy a chaff cutter which will help in getting more milk produce. Simon will earn extra income from selling the milk. This will help him uplift his living standards and pay for his children's schooling. He aspires to buy a one-acre piece of land in the next five years.

Lack of readily available market for his products, pests, and diseases are his major challenges in farming. He is thankful to Juhudi Kilimo for giving him the loan.

loans.use: to buy materials for constructing a zero- grazing unit and a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto está muy satisfecho con su anterior credikiva, él compró 3 lavadoras y fortaleció su negocio, le diéo este crédito mas oportunidades de compra en efectivo y ayudó a que prestara un excelente servicio a su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a unc redikiva con el cual comprará 3 lavadoras mas, porque la demanda ha crecido y adicionalmente incursionará en accesorios para celulares que es un mercado al que poco a poco ha ido abordando y es muy rentable. El envia el siguiente mensaje a los finaciadores: " Muchas gracias  por darme la oportunidad de adquirir experiencia crediticia y por ayudar a prosperar mi negocio".
texts.en:
Alberto is extremely satisfied with his previous Kiva loan. He was able to buy three washing machines and strengthen his business. The loan gave him more opportunities to buy with cash and helped him to provide excellent service to his customers.

He is currently applying for another Kiva loan so that he can buy three more washing machines since demand has grown. Alberto would also like to further his venture in mobile phone accessories. He has gradually entered this market since it is very profitable.

Alberto sends the following message to the Kiva lenders: “Many thanks for giving me the opportunity to acquire credit experience and for helping me to prosper in my business.”

loans.use: to buy washing machines and mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 28 years of age and operates a retail shop of daily household use items in a busy trading centre. He has 3 children and 3 dependents.

Evans is a retailer. He has taken a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to help him boost his business by buying more items for the retail shop. With the profits from the business, he will take care of his children as well as his dependents.

His major challenges are:
- Limited capital
- Inflation
- Competition from other retailers.

In the picture is Evans with his wife in the front of their house.

loans.use: to buy items for his retail shop

loans.name: Sango Group

texts.en:
Margaret's group has 10 farmers and is located in Bungoma South District. Margaret is pictured on the right of Sango Group with her hand raised. Margaret is pictured amongst the 4 men and 6 women of her group. She will receive input loans capable of helping her plant ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize.

Margaret first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Margaret joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send her children to school.

Margaret reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 8 bags of maize per ½ acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 11 bags per ½ acre!

She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to save for the future and invest in a new cow. Margaret’s group members will each receive input loans for ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season.  In total they will receive inputs for 5 acres of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a 26 year old with 2 young children ages 3 and 1 years old respectively. She is from Trinidad, Bohol.

She operates a retail store. She sells items like sugar, coffee, seasonings and soaps. Marivic requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more items to sell like soft drinks, noodles, soaps, and beverages. In the future, Marivic would like to invest in other business ventures to save for the schooling of her children for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soft drinks, noodles, soaps and beverages

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is a 34-year-old from San Miguel, Bohol. She has four children. Her oldest child is 8 years old and her youngest child is 2 years old. Mary Jean has been engaged in the rice field business for two years now. She earns 2,000 PHP per month. Aside from the rice field, she also has a small garden where she plants and raises vegetables. This is the source of her income.

Mary Jean is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm and garden. With this loan, she will be able to raise good and healthy crops and vegetables. In the future, Mary Jean hopes to expand her business and to be successful in her planting business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm and garden

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 42 years old, married, with two children, one of whom is in school. Mary Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Jane runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more grocery items to sell.

She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, shampoo, rice, and other groceries. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is a single mother of seven children and four of her children go to school. She does not take care of any additional family members. Robinah has a business of selling charcoal and generates additional income through selling pancakes and tomatoes. She has been in this business for 13 years and sells on a retail basis only seven days a week at the market. 

Robinah has applied for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy a delivery van to ease transportation. Robinah resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 40-year-old farmer in Nkubu county in Kenya, where he lives with his wife and two children. Only one of his children has started schooling. David has been in farming for over twenty years, producing horticultural crops and cereals, which he sells at the local market.  He would like to venture into pig keeping.

David is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase pigs. From selling the pork products, he will earn extra income to raise his living standards and he will use some of the money to pay for his children's schooling. David aspires to have one thousand pigs to boost his business in the next five years. Lack of enough animal feeds and poor markets are his major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase pigs for pork

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Since Jane's previous loan, she has been able to open a vegetable stall selling at the market. She has shown great enthusiasm and an urge to move forward. 

Jane is asking for a new loan to invest in her vegetable stall and to make some improvements to her cafe. She intends to buy more fruits and vegetables and also to purchase some utensils for her cafe. She is sure that through this investment her income will increase tremendously. Jane is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables and also to purchase some utensils for her cafe.

loans.name: Mable

texts.en:
Mable is a hardworking 23-year-old woman living in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda. A single mother of two children, one of whom is in school, Mable has been working diligently to manage her tomato stall, which she has operated for the past three years.

To help expand her business, Mable has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more tomatoes for the business. The additional profits generated will help both in paying her child's school fees and meeting her family's basic needs. She hopes that in the future she will be able to take good care of her children.

Mable is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes for the business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita, a 62-year-old single woman from Bien Unido, Bohol, has been in the fish-vending business for 10 years, earning about 13,500 PHP each month. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more fresh fish to meet the needs of her customers.

In the future, Margarita would like to invest in another business venture to have a sustainable livelihood and save for old age.

loans.use: to buy more fresh  fish to sell.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is a very dedicated woman who always looks for opportunities to get ahead. She has been, however, depressed since she lost her goods after thieves broke into her general store and swept away almost everything. However, she does not despair since as an entrepreneur, she has to pass through various challenges. It is for this reason that she is asking for another loan so as to restock her store with merchandise. She will buy basic grains, foodstuffs, and cleaning products, among other essential goods. She is grateful for the support offered.

loans.use: buy basic grains, foodstuffs, and cleaning products, among other essential goods.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 42-year-old businessman who live in Juba. He is married with three children between the ages of four and ten. All of them go to school. Stephen runs a home product sales business, which he has operated for six years. He has no employees other than himself. 

Stephen heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 1,500 SSP to purchase more saucepans, thermoflash, and many other items. This business is his only source of income.

In 5 years, Stephen would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs.

Stephen says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: for buying more inventory like sourcepan, thermoflash, glass plates and other items

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin, a 30-year-old married father of four children ranging in age from two years to nine years, describes himself as jovial and determined. He has been providing motorcycle transportation services for three years, his business located within a busy shopping centre and his primary customers local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices for fuel.

Benjamin will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His goal is to expand his business within five years, and he hopes in the future to improve the living standard of his family. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Ashford

texts.en:
Ashford is aged forty, a farmer in Nkubu county in Kenya, where he lives with his wife and three children who are all schooling. He has been in farming for over twenty-five years, producing horticultural crops and cereals. He would like to venture into dairy goat farming.

He is requesting a 20,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase dairy goats whose milk he will sell and earn extra income to help in uplifting his living standards and pay for his children's schooling. He aspires to be the leading goat's milk provider in his area in the next five years.

Lack of enough animal feed, animal diseases and poor climate are his major challenges in farming.

Ashford is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for its faster way of processing loans.

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats

loans.name: Enhtor

texts.en:
Enhtor is 45 years old. He lives with his wife and two daughters in a rental apartment in the Nalaih district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. 

His wife, Enhchimeg, age 30, has been unemployed since she gave birth to their younger daughter, Enhjin, age 5. Enhchimeg is now planning to start a taxi service business. Enhtor's older daughter Mart, age 8, goes to local primary school. Enhtor has been running a transportation service business in town, as well as back and forth to a mining site and town, during the summer. 

Enhtor is now requesting MNT 2,700,000 to purchase an eco-friendly, electric and gas-consuming car for his wife to start her taxi service business in town. He and his wife are open-minded, friendly, and responsible people.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly, electric and gas-consuming car for his wife to start her taxi service business in town.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity, age 32, is a farmer in Nkubu county in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and their two children. Both the children are enrolled in school. Purity has been engaged in farming for the past six years. Her farm produces milk, bananas, coffee, maize, and beans, which she sells at the market in her local area. Dry spells, pests and diseases are her major challenges in farming. She runs a cereals shop as an additional source of income.
 
She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase materials for constructing a zero grazing unit, which will help her achieve more milk production from her dairy cows. This investment will improve her family's standard of living and allow Purity to pay for her children's schooling. 

Her goal in five years is for her dairy farm to produce one hundred litres of milk per day.

She is thankful to Juhudi Kilimo for helping her to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase materials for constructing a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Doña Alejandrina, tiene 54 años de edad, esta casada con su esposo con quien tienen tres hijos, los tres son independientes, ella vive en una colonia que pertenece al municipio de Choloma, Cortes.
Doña Alejandrina es una señora trabajadora, que lleva aproximadamente 20 años de tener su propio negocio, elabora y vende pan casero como quesadillas, rosquillas, empanadas y tustacas.  Además hace tamales por encargo y confección de prendas cuando le solicitan. Doña Alejandrina reinvierte sus ganancias para mantener estable su negocio. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar materia prima como harinas, manteca, azúcar, levadura, huevos, leche para hacer pan. Con esta inversión va cumplir con un pedido grande que le han hecho sus clientes. Tiene como meta obtener ingresos para terminar de pagar su casa y seguir creciendo con el negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Alejandrina is 54 years old, married, and has three children who are independent. She lives in a neighborhood in the town of Choloma, Cortes.

Doña Alejandrina is a hardworking woman who has managed her own business for approximately 20 years. She prepares and sells baked goods such as cakes, donuts, empanadas, and cookies. Alejandrina also makes tamales by order and sews garments whenever she is asked. She reinvests her earnings so that she can maintain a stable business.

Doña Alejandrina has decided to request a loan of 10,000 HNL so that she can buy ingredients such as flour, shortening, sugar, yeast, eggs, and milk for making bread. With this investment, she will be able to complete a large order that has been submitted by her customers. Her goal is to generate income for completing the payment of her house and for continuing to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, shortening, sugar, yeast, eggs, and milk for making bread.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude  is married with two children and both her children go to school. She has a business selling green bananas and has been in this business for four years.  She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She works at the market seven days a week. 

Gertrude's major business challenges include seasonality and ever increasing prices of green bananas. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Benric Cbd Foundation Group

texts.en:
Zaidah (pictured with her hand raised) is a member of this group. She is a farmer, primarily raising and harvesting maize and beans. However, Zaidah is challenged by the uneven and changing weather and the fact that she has limited capital to invest in agriculture, as well as the poor transport network to the markets. In addition to farming, she operates a clinic in her village which she started to boost the income of the family. She is a single mother with three children, all of whom attend school. She has five dependents, including her elderly mother.
 
Zaidah is requesting a loan in the amount of UGX 500,000 to add into her agricultural efforts this season so that she can realize a good return from her harvest at the end of the season. This will put her in position to meet the educational costs of her children and to supply their other basic needs. 

Her dream is eventually to have a permanent residential house and to ensure her children's education through higher institutions of learning.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and hire labor

loans.name: Agneta

texts.en:
Agneta is 36 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a small house in the Coast province of Kenya. Her husband works as a businessman. All of their children attend school.

Agneta is a hardworking, responsible and welcoming woman. She has been running a business selling fruits and vegetables for several years. She sells at the market and she has very many regular customers who prefer her because she sells fresh products.

She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase large amounts of fruits and vegetables such as bananas, potatoes, onions, tomatoes, kale, cabbages, etc.

In future, Agneta wishes to open a kiosk to stock groceries.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of fruits and vegetables such as bananas, potatoes, onions, tomatoes, kale, cabbages, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is aged forty, a farmer in Nkubu county in Kenya, where she lives with her two children who are both schooling. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years producing milk and vegetables which she sells at the local market in her area. She operates a retail shop as an additional source of income.

She is requesting a 40,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase water tanks for irrigating her crops which will give her better yields even when there is no rainfall. This will help uplift her living standards and also pay for her children's schooling. She aspires to have bought an extra piece of land in the next five years.

Drought, pests and diseases are her major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase water tanks for irrigation

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es: Doña María tiene 62 años de edad, casada, vive con su esposo en una colonia que pertenece al municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella realiza su propia actividad de negocio, lleva 25 años de dedicarse al comercio, vende toda clase de mercadería en general, actualmente vende cameras, cortinas, sandalias, lociones, tintes para cabellos y otros que le solicitan. Vende en su casa y de manera ambulante. Su negocio es estable ya tiene sus propios clientes. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 5,500 lempiras para aprovechar la época escolar, va invertir en la compra de útiles escolares y uniformes para niños. Su plan es mantener siempre surtido y lo que el cliente pide.
texts.en: María, 62, is married living with her husband in a neighborhood that belongs to the municipality of Choloma, Cortes.  She has her own business.  She’s been a merchant for 25 years selling all sorts of general merchandise.  Currently, she’s selling cameras, curtains, sandals, lotions, hair dyes and other items that are requested.  She sells at home and also from place to place.  Her business is stable and she already has her own customers.  She’s asking for a 5,500 Lempira loan to take advantage of the school term.  She will buy school supplies and uniforms for children.  Her plan is to always be well-stocked with what customers request.

loans.use: to buy uniforms and school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en:
Mr. Nergui is 29 years old and lives with his wife in a 'ger' in Nalaih district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Solongo runs their tourist camp business during the summer. This borrower has been running a tourist camp with four 'ger's in Nalaih district territory during the summer. They provide horseback riding and transportation to tourists visiting in summer. It is seasonal business and they also produce organic dairy products and sell to both locals and visitors. 

Mr. Nergui is now requesting 1,700,000 MNT to purchase a second-hand eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car to provide transportation to tourists during the summer. He and his wife both are enthusiastic and open-minded people.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car to provide transportation service to tourists during summer

loans.name: Linet

texts.en: The desire to get ahead is one of Linet's dreams. She is a very hardworking woman who has been operating a vegetable stall for some time. Thanks to her efforts and determination; her business is doing very well. Her aim is to see it grow even more. Linet says that her previous loan was of great help since it enabled her to fund her general store and at the same time open this vegetable stall business. With the current loan, she wants to improve her business by stocking it with with more fruits and vegetables like cabbages, onions, kale, and tomatoes, among others.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables like cabbages, onions, kale, and tomatoes, among others.

loans.name: Guido Daniel

texts.es: Guido en su taller de embobinado está satisfecho, porque con su anterior credikiva compró alambres de cobre en mayor cantidad y de embobinado. Sus ingresos han sido mayores y ha progresado, porque ha mejorada lo calidad de vida de su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará mucho mas alambre para embobinar, porque es el producto que mas rota y le deja mayores ganancias. Guido envía un mensaje de Agradecimiento a sus financiadores y dice que su anterior crédito le ha dado fuerzas para seguir adelante y este estimulo es muy importante para el progreso de su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Guido is pleased with his previous Kiva loan because he was able to buy copper wire in large quantities for his repair shop. He has progressed and generated more income, so he has been able to improve his family’s quality of life.

At the moment, Guido is applying for a new Kiva loan so that he can buy more wire for recoiling. Since this material wears out often, he is able to generate more income.

Guido expresses his appreciation to the Kiva lenders and would like to tell them that his previous loan gave him the strength to move forward. It also provided an important stimulus to make progress in his life and with this family.

loans.use: to buy more copper wire.

loans.name: Maggie

texts.en:
Maggie is married, with three children. All her children go to school. She also looks after additional family members (sister and mother).  She has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for three years. 

She has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil. Her major business challenges include defaulters, seasonality, and the ever-increasing price of commodities in Uganda. 

Maggie is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land, to build her own house. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy for her retail shop, more boxes of salt, cooking oil, and bags of sugar.

loans.name: Andua Joseph

texts.en:
Andrua, age 40, runs a clothing store. He has been engaged in this business for six years. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs. He operates his business on his own, with no additional employees. Andrua lives in Juba with his wife and three children, who are between the ages of four and 10 years old. All three children attend school.

Andrua learned about Finance Sudan through promotions by its loan officers. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 SSP in order to purchase a greater variety of clothes to offer for sale.

In five years, Andrua would like to expand his business and open other branches.
 
Andrua says he is happy for the loans offered by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Videris

texts.en:
Videris, age 40 and married, operates a grocery store business where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this venture for four years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are local residents, hotels, schools, butcher shops, etc. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of vegetables. She describes herself as determined and optimistic.

Videris will use her Kes 20,000 loan funds to buy fruits and vegetables to offer for sale. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. Her business goal is to run multiple grocery stores within five years.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Kaloleni, Kenya. She is widowed and has eight children. To making a living, she owns and operates a chicken-raising business. Lucy has been involved in this business for more than six years. 

She joined Yehu to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucy wants to buy chicken feed and medicine, which is why she is asking for a loan from Kiva through Yehu.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and medicine

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz, age 28, is a tractor driver who lives in the village of Dighomi with his parents, wife, and child. The monthly income he earns is the primary source of income for his family. His father works as an artisan and gets a small monthly salary as well.

As the existing income is not enough for a five-member family, Tamaz has decided to start up a new business, but he does not qualify under existing income requirements. Tamaz is requesting a loan under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This loan program envisions providing start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to many credit products, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Tamaz will use his loan funds to purchase an asphalt paving machine so that he can earn additional income by laying asphalt on roadways. Tamaz hopes to increase the monthly income of the family with this new business initiative. He is confident that his investment will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase an asphalt paving machine

loans.name: Molly

texts.en:
Molly joined UGAFODE Microfinance Limited in 2000 when she was working in mobile markets. She got a loan and was able to expand her business, earn more income, and start trading in cattle. She now deals in the cattle trade and cattle fattening which has enabled her to educate her children and support her family.

Molly took this loan to maintain her farm by treating the animals, in turn, increasing milk production. She thanks UGAFODE Microfinance Limited for the financial help, which has enabled her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy animal drugs and sprays.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 50-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 13 years to 27 years. He describes himself to be an honest, faithful, and determined man. He operates a restaurant where he sells food, tea, sodas, snacks, etc. His business is located within a high-traffic environment, and his primary customers are business people from nearby estates. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a shortage of ingredients for preparing meals to sell. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy ingredients. His business goal is to run a big hotel within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for preparing meals to sell

loans.name: Mansa

texts.en:
Mansa started up an ice cream sales business four years ago and has been actively engaged in her business ever since. She and her husband, who is a carpenter, live in Effia Kumah near Takoradi. She received no formal education. Mansa uses her income to support her husband in paying for their general expenses. 

Mansa will use the loan to purchase a greater quantity of ice cream to offer for sale. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Mansa plans to grow her ice cream trade further.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of ice cream to offer for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 38, operates a restaurant where she sells food, tea, soda, and snacks. Her business is located within a potential business environment  and her primary customers are businesspeople from nearby estates. She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortage of food ingredients for preparing meals to offer for sale in her facility. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. 

Elizabeth and her husband have three children.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy food ingredients for her restaurant. Her five-year business goal is to run a large hotel, where she hopes to employ 10 assistants. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She has successfully repaid her previous loan in the amount of Kes 20,000.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret sells jewelry in Effia Kumah near Takoradi. Margaret has received schooling through a junior high school level.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a teacher. Margaret has been selling jewelry for five years now. She is responsible for helping to support her husband with the family’s general expenses and paying her children's school fees. Margaret will use this loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of jewelry to resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to increase her capital base and build a jewelry shop.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of jewelry to resell.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es: Rosalba compró lona, hilos, pegantes y demás materiales,  con los que elaboró muchos bolsos que vendió. Su crédito la benefició, porque incrementó sus ventas y obtuvo mayores utilidades que fortalecieron su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará bolsos elaborados para tener mayor variedad de lo que produce y lo que compra para vender, esto le da una diversidad en su oferta, apuntándole a tener un éxito con su credikiva. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Gracias por apoyar a las microempresas colombianas para salir adelante con sus objetivos propuestos”.
texts.en:
Rosalba bought canvas, thread, adhesive, and other supplies for making more bags to sell. Her loan was beneficial because she was able to increase her sales and generate more profits to strengthen her business.

At the moment, Rosalba is applying for another Kiva loan so that she can buy manufactured bags to offer and sell. This will give her a variety of goods that is greater than if she produced the bags herself. She aims to be successful with this Kiva loan.

Rosalba sends the following message to the Kiva lenders: “Thank you for supporting Colombian micro-entrepreneurs so that they can move forward with the goals they have set.”

loans.use: to buy manufactured bags.

loans.name: Jovans

texts.en:
Jovans is married, with six children. Only five of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for ten years, selling to all types of people, but on retail basis. She generates additional income through selling banana clusters and tomatoes. She works at the market seven days out of very week.  

Jovans has applied for a loan of UGX 400,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT-SACCO) to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. 

Jovans is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарходу 23 года. Он живет вместе с родителями в городе Истаравшан. Фарход работает автоэлектриком уже 5 лет. В его работе помогает ему брат. В свободное от работы время он также занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Фархода с юного возраста интересовала деятельность автоэлектрика и сейчас он является знатоком своего дела. Чтобы улучшить процесс своей работы, Фарход берет кредит на сумму 3000 долларов для приобретения аппарата диагностики машины.
texts.en: Farhod is 23 years old.  He lives with his parents in the city of Istaravshan.  Farhod has been working as an auto-electrician for 5 years now.  His brother helps him in his work.  In his free time he also provides taxi services.  Farhod has been interested in being an auto-electrician from a young age and now he is an expert in this specialty.  In order to improve his work flow, Farhod is taking out a 3000 dollar loan to purchase a car diagnostics tool.

loans.use: to buy a car diagnostics tool

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a married man. He has four children ranging in age from 4 to 11 years old. He describes himself as courageous and caring. 

Michael operates a retail shop where he sells household items such as sugar, tea leaves, rice, sweets, soda, etc. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located within a potential business area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving his business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy household items to resell. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He is also a small-scale farmer and he sells farm products .

loans.use: to buy household items to resell

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en:
Philomina is married and has five children. She has received schooling through secondary school. Philomina sells food stuffs in Effia Kumah near Takoradi and has done so for the past 25 years. Her husband is a tailor. Philomina uses her income to help her husband with the family's general expenses.

Philomina will use this loan to buy an increased variety and quantity of food stuffs to resell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to develop her food stuffs trade further.

loans.use: to buy an increased variety and quantity of food stuffs to resell.

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en:
Zenabu is married and has five children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Zenabu is a seamstress in Effia Kumah near Takoradi. She has worked as a seamstress in the area for the past 12 years. Her husband is a fisherman. Zenabu uses her income to support her husband and pay her children's school fees. 

Zenabu will use this loan to purchase more materials and supplies needed for her clothes-making business. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to expand her seamstress trade.

loans.use: to purchase more materials and supplies needed for her clothes-making business.

loans.name: G.s. Chavarria Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario Chavarría lo conforman Juana del Carmen y Paula Emilia ellas pertenecen al departamento de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país la cual es una zona muy comercial y existe gran demanda. .Juana tiene un negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos de consumos diarios como: arroz, aceite, fósforos, cebolla, pan, frijoles, golosinas entre otros negocio que tiene desde hace más de 18 años,  con dos hijos de 22 y 27 años de edad solo uno estudia,  Paula se dedica a la venta de refrescos, los cuales los elabora de frutas, naturales frescas, leche de vaca y por la calidad de refrescos que ella vende tiene clientes fijos y eventuales y su productos se vende con rapidez, tiene más de 19  años de dedicarse a este medio de vida con seis hijos de 27,29,30,31,33 y 35 años de edad todos son independientes, ambas casadas y han tenido el apoyo de sus esposos, una tiene ubicado su negocio en su casa de domicilio y la otra en la terminal de buses donde transitan gran cantidad de personas que buscan su viaje al trabajo, clases o negocios lo que le resulta muy favorable. Con  el paso del tiempo han logrado incrementar a la mayoría de sus clientes pues conocen muy bien los productos que ellas ofrecen. Ellas están muy agradecidas con el apoyo que les han brindado los inversionistas Kiva a personas de escasos recurso, El crédito es para la invertir en la compra materia prima como :azúcar, frutas leña unos termos para renovar algunos que ella tiene, también compra de granos básicos como :arroz, frijoles, aceite, golosinas, productos helados, café, sal, fósforos, pan, gaseosas entre otros productos.-
texts.en:
The solidarity group Chavarría is made up of Juana del Carmen and Paula Emilia, both of whom live in the Chinandega department, located in the west of the country in a well-known commercial area where there is a high demand for products. Juana has a convenience store where she sells good for daily consumption such as rice, oil, matches, onions, bread, beans, candy among other items, and she has been running the business for 18 years. She has two children who are 22 and 27, one of which is studying. Paula sells refreshments which she makes with fruits, fresh juices, and cow’s milk, and due to the quality of refreshments that she sells, she has regular and casual customers, and her products sell quickly. She has been doing this work for more than 19 years and has six children who are 27, 29, 30, 31, 33, and 35 years old, all of whom are independent. Both women are married and have the support of their husbands. 

One runs her business from home, and the other in the bus terminal where many people pass by when they are travelling to work, classes or to their businesses, which is advantageous to her. Over time she has managed to increase her number of customers because they know very well what she products she offers. They are very grateful for they support they Kiva lenders give to people on low incomes. The loan will be used to buy supplies such as sugar, fruits, a cooler to replace one that she already has, as well as staple goods such as rice, bean, oil, candy, iced goods, coffee, salt, boxes of matches, bread, soft drinks among other products.

loans.use: to buy staple goods such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, fruits, milk, and firewood.

loans.name: Jérôme

texts.fr:
Monsieur Jérôme est tailleur. Il est marié et âgé de 65 ans. Il a cinq enfants, le plus âgé a 42 ans et le moins âgé a 8 ans. Deux de ses enfants vont à l’école et aucune autre personne n’est en sa charge.
Il est né au Rwanda et son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de l’école secondaire.
Il a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd en 2006 et actuellement est au 18ème cycle de crédit. Il a bien remboursé les cycles antérieurs.
Avec le crédit contracté, il va améliorer son atelier de couture en achetant 100 mètres de tissu, un rouleau de popeline et six rouleaux de doublure.
Il n’attend aucune difficulté de non remboursement de ce prêt. Pour accroitre son activité, il a la stratégie de demander d’autres prêts.
L’ambition pour son activité est d’avoir un grand atelier de couture. Pour sa famille, il va assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jérôme is a tailor. He is married and is 65 years old. He has five children, the oldest of whom is 42 years old and the youngest of whom is eight. Two of his children attend school and he has no additional dependents. Jérôme was born in Rwanda and his level of schooling has been six years of secondary education.

Jérôme began working with ACB Ltd in 2006 and is currently on his 18th loan cycle. He repaid his previous loans in full. With his current loan, Jérôme plans to improve his sewing workshop by purchasing 100 meters of assorted fabric, one roll of poplin and six rolls of lining.

Jérôme does not expect to have any difficulty in repaying this loan. He also plans to request additional loans in order to help his business to grow. Jérôme's ambition for his business is to have a large sewing workshop. For his family, Jérôme plans to ensure a good education for his children.

loans.use: to purchase 100 meters of assorted fabric, one roll of poplin and six rolls of lining.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys  tiene  50 años de edad, esta casada y vive con el esposo y una hija actualmente. Ella con crédito pretende comprar  materiales de construcción como, cemento, arena, clavos, entre otros. Ella lo que quiere es poder hacer la cocina  a la casa para poder tener un poquito más de comodidad y haceos en su hogar, ya que la casa es pequeña y por ello solicita un préstamo para tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y  su familia es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Gladys is 50 years old and married.  She currently lives with her husband and one of her daughters.  With this loan, Gladys plans to buy building materials such as cement, sand, nails, and other items.  What Gladys wants is to do up the kitchen so that it is more comfortable and so that she can have a restroom, as the house is small.  So, she is applying for a loan to improve her and her family's quality of life. This is Gladys' first loan from FUDECOSUR.  She has not had other loans from state banks and FUDECOSUR has provided this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to do up the kitchen in the house.

loans.name: Makarimal Akhlakh Gpe 15 Group

texts.fr: Makarimal Akhlakh gpe  15 est un regroupement de 10 femmes qui  évoluent dans le meme secteur d’activité, elles  exercent toutes la vente de poissons. Elles adhèrent aussi dans le meme groupement d’intérêt  économique Makarimal  Akhlakh. Elles sont représentées par la dame Adama  qui est celle qui a levé la main  gauche sur la photo. Elle capitalise une expérience de 15 ans dans la vente de poissons.  Elle  est mariée et les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle démarre sa journée à 5 heures du matin pour la terminer à 00 heures la nuit.  Elle sollicite un crédit dans le but d’augmenter son fond de roulement. Son  financement  sera  prévu  pour l’achat  de poissons en vue d’augmenter la quantité  à commercialiser et développer son activité de vente de poissons. Elle souhaite élargir le nombre de personnes qu’elle emploie dans son activité, accroitre ses bénéfices de sorte a mieux  supporter les  frais scolaires de ses enfants et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Son projet futur est d’acquérir ses propres pirogues.
texts.en:
Makarimal Akhlakh Gpe 15 Group is made up of 10 women who work in the same sector, all of them selling fish. They also belong to the same economic interest group, Makarimal Akhlakh.

The group is represented by Adama, the lady with her left hand raised in the photo. Adama has built up 15 years of experience in the sale of fish. She is married and the income that her business provides allow her to see to her children's education. She begins her day at 5am, ending it at midnight.

Adama is seeking a loan with the intention of increasing her working capital. Her loan will be intended for the purchase of fish in order to increase the quantity, [as well as to] market and grow her business selling fish. She hopes to expand the number of people she employs in her business, increase her profits in order to better meet her children's school fees, and improve her family's food supply. Her future plan is to purchase her own pirogues [dugout canoes].

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Afzaliddin

texts.ru: Афзалиддину 27 лет. Он со своей семьей проживает в селе Чорбог города Истаравшан. У него трое детей. Жена его домохозяйка, и Афзалиддин сам обеспечивает семью. Он покупает и продает крупно-рогатый скот. Афзалиддин занимается животноводческой деятельностью с 1993 года. Он очень заинтересован в расширении своего дела и с этой целью обратился за кредитом. Он просит кредит в размере 2500 долларов для купли и перепродажи крупно-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Afzaliddin is 27 years old. He and his family live in the village of Chorbog in the city of Istaravshan.  He has three children.  His wife is a homemaker and Afzaliddin provides for his family alone.  He buys and sells cattle.  Afzaliddin has been raising livestock since 1993.  He is very interested in expanding his business and applied for a loan with this goal.  He is asking for a loan of 2,500 dollars to buy and resell cattle.

loans.use: to buy and resell cattle

loans.name: Dufatanye Gasiza Group

texts.fr:
Solange a 32 ans, elle a 5 enfants de 4 mois à 12 ans.Trois de ses enfants vont à l'école et 2 autres personnes sont en charge.
Elle est au deuxieme cycle de credit, le premier cycle est bien remboursé.
Avec ce crédit, elle va acheter 200 kilos des semances des pommes de terre, elle va acheter les engrais chimiques et paiera la main d'oeuvre.
La mauvaise récolte est la seule difficulté attendue par Solange qui peut faire que ce pret soit mal remboursée.
Elle a la strategie de moderniser son agriculture en respectant les recommandations de l'agronome.
Elle a l'ambition d'etre la grande distributrice des pommes de terre dans la region. Pour sa famille, elle a l'ambition d'assurer le bien etre de sa famille.
texts.en:
Solange is 32 years old and has five children between the ages of four months and 12 years. Three of her children attend school and she has two other dependents in her care.

Solange is on her second loan cycle, the first having been properly repaid. With this loan, she is going to purchase 200kg of potato seeds, chemical fertilizers, and will pay labor costs. A poor harvest is the only possible difficulty Solange foresees, which could mean she might have trouble repaying her loan. Her strategy is to modernize her farming in compliance with agriculturalist recommendations.

Solange's ambition is the be the largest potato distributor in the area. For her family, her goal is to ensure their well-being.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizers, and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.es: Anthony, un hombre emprendedor y muy humilde, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su familia actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones, para obtener un producto de buena calidad y factible a la hora de ser comercializado. Este  agricultor que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio a logrado encaminar su proyecto hasta el día de hoy, y este como tal, gracias a su dedicación ha respondido favorablemente, se encuentra en uno de los mejores de la zona y la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Anthony is an enterprising and humble young man who is 21 years of age. He is single and currently lives with his family. Anthony is requesting a loan in hopes of buying supplies, such as compost and fumigants. He wants to maintain his coffee crop so that it will stay in good condition and yield a high-quality product that he can sell.

This farmer has put forth much effort and sacrifice to get his project to where it is today. Thanks to his dedication, he has received a favorable endorsement for being one of the best farmers in the area. His only limitation is the lack of money, which his business depends on in order to move forward. For this reason, Anthony is requesting a loan, which is the first one he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not received any other loans from the state banks and FUDECOSUR is offering this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр житель города Истаравшан. Ему 33 года. Он женат, воспитывает троих детей. Бахтиёр работает сварщиком уже 11 лет. Он профессиональный работник. Однако его инструменты уже устарели и поэтому процесс его работы идет медленно. Чтобы улучшить условия своей деятельности, он обратился за кредитом. Он просит кредит в размере 1000 долларов для приобретения строгального станка.
texts.en: Bakhtiyor is a resident of the city of Istaravshan.  He is 33 years old.  He is married and is raising three children.  Bakhtiyor has been working as a welder for 11 years.  He is a professional worker.  His tools have aged and his work goes slowly.  In order to improve his business he applied for a loan.  He is asking for a loan of 1000 dollars to purchase a planer.

loans.use: to buy a planer

loans.name: Khanon

texts.ru: Ханон житель города Исфара. Ему 52 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Жена Ханона домохозяйка. Ханон вот уже 7 лет зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он берет кредит для закупа мелко - рогатого и крупнорогатого скота.
