texts.en: Khanon lives in the city of Isfara.  He is 52 years old.  He is married.  He has four children.  Khanon's wife is a homemaker.  Khanon has been earning money via raising large horned livestock for 7 years now.  He is taking out a loan to purchase small and large horned livestock.

loans.use: to purchase calves and sheep

loans.name: Rosa Delia

texts.es: Rosa Delia, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, vive en una colonia que pertenece al municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Rosa delia, siempre se ha dedicado al comercio anteriormente vendía verduras y hace dos años decidió por vender mercadería como ropa, zapatos, sandalias y cosméticos de productos AVON. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos para la manutención de su familia. Y lo ha mantenido estable con la inversión de varios prestamos, actualmente solicita el cuarto préstamo que es por 8,000.00 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar ropa y zapatos. Con este préstamo aprovecha a comprar de contado y consigue descuentos lo que le permite obtener más ganancias. Su meta es seguir creciendo con el negocio y que su hijo se gradúe.
texts.en:
Rosa Delia is a 46-year-old single mother with two children. She lives in a neighborhood in the town of Choloma, Cortes.

Rosa Delia has always been in the retail trade. She previously sold vegetables, but two years ago she decided to sell merchandise, such as clothes, sandals, and Avon cosmetics. This business serves as her source of income for supporting her family. She has kept her business stable by investing several loans.

Rosa Delia is currently requesting her fourth loan in the amount of 8,000 HNL. The money will be used to buy clothing and shoes. With this loan, she will be able to buy with cash and secure discounts that will enable her to gain more profit. Her goals are to continue growing her business and to see her son graduate.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Abduljovid

texts.ru:
Абдулчовид житель города Вахдат. Ему 31 год. Он женат. У него двое детей. Абдулчовид девять лет занимается торговлей. Сейчас у него собственный небольшой магазин. Абдулчовид занимается продажей автозапчасти. 
Абдулчовид берет кредит для покупки аккумулятора, фар и других необходимых запчастей.
texts.en:
Abduljovid live in the city of Vahdat.  He is 31 years old.  He is married.  He has two children.  Abduljovid has been trading for nine years.  Right now he owns a small store.  Abduljovid sells auto parts.

Abduljovid is taking out a loan to purchase a battery, lights and other necessary parts.

loans.use: to buy a battery, lights and other necessary parts

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара жительница города Вахдат. Ей 28 лет. Она замужем. Гулсара имеет средне - специальное образование, она портниха. Вот уже три года как Гулсара работает по специальности. Она предоставляет услугу у себя дома. Гулсара шьет национальные платья. Она берет кредит для приобретения новой швейной машинки.
texts.en: Gulsara is a resident of the city of Vahdat.  She is 28 years old.  She is married.  Gulsara has a specialize high school education, she is a seamstress.  For three years now Gulsara has been working in her profession.  She provides services from her home.  Gulsara sews traditional dresses.  She is taking out a loan for the purchase of a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora tiene cincuenta y siete años, casada, madre de diez hijos, de las edades de 16, 18, 20, 22, 23, 27, 30, 37, 40 y 42 años, de las cuales solo la menor de ellos cursa escuela secundaria; se dedica desde hace quince años a la venta de mariscos de manera ambulante en la ciudad de León, optó por iniciarlo para poder ayudar a su esposo con la manutención de su familia, él es vigilante y a su vez le dio su completo apoyo, para que así Teodora  pudiera empezar con el negocio de los mariscos, con el préstamo ella planea invertir en más productos como pescado, camarones, jaibas, etc.; y de esta forma tener la oportunidad de obtener mayores utilidades. Teodora  agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Videa is 56 years old and married. Her ten children are 16, 18, 20, 22, 23, 27, 30, 37, 40 and 42 years old. Only the youngest still attends secondary school. 

For the past fifteen years Videa has earned her living selling shellfish on the streets of León. She decided to start the business to help her husband support the family. He is a watchman and gave her his full support. In this way Videa was able to start her shellfish business.

With the loan she plans to buy more products such as fish, shrimp, crab etc. which will give her the opportunity to earn more money. Videa is grateful for the help that Kiva donors bring a poor person like her in a poor country like Nicaragua.

loans.use: para la compra de productos de mariscos como pescados, jaibas, camarones, conchas, entre otros mariscos mas debido a que su demanda ha incrementado

loans.name: Makarimal Akhlakh Gpe 23 Group

texts.fr: Makarimal Akhlakh gpe  23  est un regroupement de 10 femmes qui  évoluent dans le meme secteur d’activité, elles  exercent toutes la vente de poissons. Elles adhèrent aussi dans le meme groupement d’intérêt  économique Makarimal  Akhlakh. Elles sont représentées par Madame Ndeye Coumba c'est-à-dire la personne  qui  a levé la main  gauche sur la photo. Elle capitalise une expérience de 21 ans dans son activité. Elle achète directement le poisson a partir des pirogues qui reviennent de mer pour les revendre aux détaillants. Elle  est mariée et les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle démarre sa journée à 6 heures du matin pour la terminer à 21 heures la nuit.  Elle sollicite un crédit dans le but d’augmenter son fond de roulement. Son  financement  sera  prévu  pour accroitre la quantité de poissons qu’elle a l’habitude d’acquérir  et qui est destiné  à la vente. Elle veut développer son activité de vente de poissons. Elle souhaite  accroitre ses bénéfices  pour améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Son projet futur  consiste  à acquérir un véhicule frigorifique et une pirogue qui lui appartiennent.
texts.en:
Makarimal Akhlakh Gpe 23 Group is made up of 10 women who work in the same sector, all of them selling fish. They also belong to the same economic interest group, Makarimal Akhlakh.

The group is represented by Mrs. Ndeye Coumba, the woman with her left hand raised in the photo. Mrs. Ndeye Coumba has built up 21 years of experience in her business. She purchases fish directly from the pirogues [dugout canoes] returning from the sea, then sells them to retailers. She is married, and the income her business provides allows her to see to her children's education. Her day begins at 6am and ends at 9pm.

Mrs. Ndeye Coumba is seeking a loan with the goal of increasing her working capital. Her loan will be intended to increase the amount of fish she can usually purchase that is intended for resale. She wants to expand her business selling fish. She hopes to increase her profits in order to improve her family's nutrition. Her future plans consist of purchasing a refrigerated vehicle and a pirogue that will belong to her.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy necessary tools

loans.name: Idrissou

texts.fr: Revendeur de voitures d’occasion à Agoé, Idrissou est un homme dynamique qui vit à Lomé avec sa femme et leurs 03 enfants. Ils sont âgés de 11, 09 et 06ans et vont tous à l’école. Il exerce cette activité depuis 2005 et s’approvisionne au port Autonome de Lomé. Il est un ancien client de WAGES et fait son cinquième prêt pour acheter des voitures d’occasion, réaménager et revendre à ses clients. Avec le profit, qu’il va s’offrir, il veut assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille tout en rendant pérenne son activité.
texts.en:
A used car retailer in Agoé, Idrissou is an energetic man who lives in Lomé with his wife and their three children, who are 11, nine, and six years old and all attend school.

Idrissou has been running his business since 2005 and gets his supplies at the Autonomous Port of Lomé. He is a former WAGES borrower and is taking his fifth loan to purchase used cars, refurbish them, and sell them to his customers. With the profits he will receive, Idrissou wants to ensure the vital needs of his family, while making his business sustainable.

loans.use: To purchase used cars.

loans.name: Wendbenedo Group

texts.fr:
Mme POKO ANNE est responsable du groupe WENDBENEDO. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 03ans.01 va à l’école. Elle a 02 personnes en charge.

Mme vend des habits, chaussures et pagnes depuis 08ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont les habitants du secteur.

Elle veut s’acheter  05pièces de pagnes et  04 douzaines de jean pour enfants.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut  économiser afin de s’acheter une parcelle. Elle ambitionne maintenant ouvrir une boutique de vente de pagnes et prêt à porter et mieux scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Poko Anne is the head of the Wendbenedo group. She is a good person, is married, and has two children. The oldest of her children is 13, while the youngest is 3 years of age. One of her children goes to school, and she has two people under her care.

Poko Anne has worked for the past eight years selling clothing, shoes and pagnes [traditional wrap-around cloth]. She gets her supplies at a market in the part of town known as Sector 10, and all her customers live in this area. She wants to buy five lengths of pagne and four dozen pairs of children’s jeans. With her profits, she would like to save so that she can buy a plot of land. She plans to open a store to sell pagnes and ready-to-wear clothing, as well as to provide better schooling for her children.

loans.use: To buy five lengths of pagne [traditional wrap-around cloth] and four dozen pairs of children’s jeans.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 36-year-old married man. He is living with his wife and four children, who are all attending school. He is the main income provider for the family, and he works very hard to be able to handle the heavy life expenses. 

Youssef has been involved in the construction field for the past ten years. He specializes in floor covering. He is well known for his original designs and decorations. 

Today, Youssef is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase an electrical saw in order to be able to cut the pavers. He always seeks to present good-quality services to his clients. 

Youssef works on a freelance basis and hopes to become the owner of a pavers shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical saw in order to be able to cut the pavers.

loans.name: Amonté

texts.fr: Amonté vit avec sa femme revendeuse et leurs 02 enfants de 05 et 02ans à Lomé. Seul le premier est scolarisé. Âgé de 34ans, il est conducteur de taxi moto et a démarré cette activité depuis 2007. Pour acheter une nouvelle moto et satisfaire plus les clients,  il fait un second crédit à WAGES. Avec le profit qu’il va réaliser, il veut assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille tout en rendant pérenne son activité.
texts.en:
Amonté lives in Lomé with his wife, a retailer, and their two children, aged five and two, only the elder of whom attends school.

Amonté is a 34-year-old motorcycle taxi driver, a business he began in 2007. In order to purchase a new motorcycle and satisfy more customers, he is taking a second WAGES loan. With the profit he will see, he wants to ensure his family's vital needs, while making his business sustainable.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús, un hombre trabajador, tiene 79 años de edad, es casado y vive con la esposa y un hijo, el solicita el préstamo para  comprar insumos como fumigaciones y herbicidas, el quiere dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones. Este  agricultor que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio a logrado encaminar su proyecto y sacar adelante su familia hasta el día de hoy, y este como tal, gracias a su dedicación ha respondido favorablemente, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Jesús is a hardworking man. He is 79 years old and married, and he lives with his wife and son. He is applying for this loan to buy supplies, such as fumigation and weed-killers. This will help him to maintain his coffee crops in good condition.

This farmer has put in plenty of effort and sacrifice to get his project underway and provide for his family. Thanks to his dedication, he has received good feedback. His family depends on this business in order to move forward, which is why he is applying for this loan. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He does not have any other loans in state-run banks, but FUDECOSUR provided him with a loan with much better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en:
Gulsara is 30 years old, married and a mother of two children, aged 5 and 6. She works as a teacher of mathematics at the school. The scope of her business is animal sales. She sells livestock in markets. Gulsara has eight years of experience in this field.

This is her second loan from this institution, and she will use the funds to purchase cattle so she can then bring them to various markets to sell. With these improvements, she hopes to get more income, improve her family's living conditions and problems and to have greater personal improvement.

In the picture you can see Gulsara with her children.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Roy

texts.es: Roy  tiene la edad de 38 años, está casado y vive con su esposa. El quiere comprar almacigo para la resiembra de su propiedad. El cuenta con la experiencia y el terreno, pero el café ya está en unas condiciones regulares por lo cual él quiere es resembrar las partes más dañadas y seguir con el proyecto. El pretende con esto generar ganancias para el bienestar de su familia y también mejorar sus cosechas este próximo año. Es el primer  préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Roy, 38, is married living with his wife.  He wants to buy seedlings to replant his property.  He has the experience and the land but the coffee is now in regular condition and he wants to replant the parts that are most damaged and continue with his project.  He intends with this to earn profits for his family’s well-being as well as to improve next years’ harvest.

This is his first Fudecosur loan.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Eliecer

texts.es: Eliecer, un hombre emprendedor, tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y vive con la esposa y tres hijos, el solicita el préstamo para  comprar insumos como fumigaciones y herbicidas, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones, para obtener un producto factible a la hora de ser comercializado. Este  agricultor que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio a logrado encaminar su proyecto hasta el día de hoy, y este como tal, gracias a su dedicación ha respondido favorablemente , ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Eliecer is an enterprising gentleman who is 47 years old and married. He lives with his wife and three children.

Eliecer is requesting a loan so that he can buy supplies, such as fumigants and herbicides. He wants to maintain his coffee crops so that they will stay in good condition and yield a product that is suitable for sale. This farmer has put forth much effort and sacrifice to get his project to where it is today. Thanks to his dedication, he has achieved favorable results.

Eliecer is financially dependent on his business so that he can move forward. For this reason, he is requesting a loan, the first one he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not received any other loans from the state banks and FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: Fátima del Rosario es una mujer de cincuenta y dos años de edad, es madre de un niño de once años quien actualmente cursa la escuela primaria, ella se dedica al destace de cerdos, elabora diferentes productos derivados del cerdo, como frito, pepena, vende los diferentes cortes de carne del cerdo, a la vez frutas y verduras, las ventas las realiza en su casa y de manera ambulante con ayuda de un carretón, esa ocupación la aprendió de su mamá quien tenía el mismo tipo de negocio y así decidió iniciar el suyo, esto ya hace veintisiete años, su mayor sueño es brindarle una mejor condición de vida a su pequeño hijo y formarlo como un profesional, para ello tiene ideado invertir más en su negocio.
texts.en: Fátima del Rosario is a 52-year-old woman. She is the mother of an 11-year-old boy who is currently going to primary school. She butchers pigs to make different pig products such as fried pig and pepena. She sells different cuts of pork as well as fruits and vegetables. She makes these sales out of her home as well as by going door-to-door with a small cart. Her mother taught her this trade because she had the same type of business, so Fatima decided to start her own, which she has had for 27 years. Her biggest dream is to give her son a better quality of life and help him become a professional. To do this, she plans to invest more in her business.

loans.use: purchase live pigs for butchering

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is a hard-working, enterprising person who wants to move forward day by day, for the well-being of his two children and his wife. He and his family live in Kaloleni, in Coast province.

Harrison has a grocery store, selling various household items. The loan he has applied for, he will use to buy products for his store, such as flour, sugar, and rice, as well as soft drinks and snacks.

This is to give good service to the customer and so that his store will be well-known in the area. This investment will help Harrison get new customers and a good income, which will help him support his family's household expenses.

Harrison's dream is to be able to have a mini-mart and to look for new alternatives for generating a good income in order to pay for his children's schooling and support his wife.

loans.use: to buy products for his store, such as flour, sugar, and rice, as well as soft drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a 43-year-old single woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be a jovial woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located near a busy bus stop in a busy town, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy vegetables and fruits to sell. Her business goal is to be the area's main supplier of fruits and vegetables within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is single and has one child. She has received schooling through secondary school. Vida is a caterer in Effia Kumah, near Takoradi, and has done this work for the past two years. Vida uses her income to support herself and her child. 

Vida will use the loan to purchase more food stuffs and supplies to run her catering business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vida plans to grow her catering service further.

loans.use: to purchase more food stuffs and supplies to run her catering business.

loans.name: Winnifred

texts.en:
Winnifred is married and has five children. She has received schooling through a secondary education level. Winnifred sells rice and glassware in Effia Kumah, near Takoradi, which she has done for 15 years now. Her husband is a businessman in the area. Winnifred uses her income to support her husband and pay her children's school fees. 

Winnifred will use the loan to buy a greater quantity of rice and glassware to sell in the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Winnifred plans to grow her business further.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of rice and glassware to sell in the market.

loans.name: William

texts.es: William, tiene la edad de 39 años, está casado y vive con su esposa y los hijos actualmente. El quiere compra almacigo para la resiembra de su cafetal y también algunos insumos. El cuenta con el terreno y lo que quiere es resembrar las zonas más dañadas para así aumentar la cosecha próxima y crecer como un caficultor de la zona. El pretende con estas mejoras generar mayor producción de café y así también le genere ganancias para seguir adelante con su proyecto y mejorar su bienestar Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: William is 39 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children. He wants to purchase copperwood for replanting his coffee trees as well as some supplies. He relies on the land and he wants to replant the areas that are most damaged in order to expand the next harvest and grow as a coffee farmer in the region. He hopes that these improvements will generate better coffee production as well as better earnings so he can progress with his project and improve his well being. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He did not have any other loans through state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has given him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: purchase copperwood for replanting his coffee trees as well as some supplies

loans.name: Erkin

texts.ru:
Эркин житель Спитаменского района. Ему 50 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Эркин занимается животноводством. Он у себя дома разводит скот. Эркин в основном закупает крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 7 лет. 
Эркин берет кредит для закупа коров и теленка.
texts.en:
Erkin lives in the Spitamen region.  He is 50 years old.  He is married and has two children.  Erkin raises livestock.  He raises the livestock at his home.  Erkin mostly purchases cattle to resell in the future.  He has been in this business for 7 years.

Erkin is taking out a loan to buy cows and a calf.

loans.use: to buy cows and a calf

loans.name: Jaloliddin

texts.ru:
Чалолиддин житель города Исфара. Ему 49 лет. Он женат. Чалолиддин является отцом четверых детей. Его жена домохозяйка. 
Чалолиддин занимается животноводством. Он на протяжении десяти лет занимается купле - продажей крупнорогатого скота. На сегодняшний день у него имеются несколько голов телят. Чалолиддин берет кредит для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Jaloliddin lives in the city of Isfara.  He is 49 years old.  He is married.  Jaloliddin is the father of four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Jaloliddin raises livestock.  He has been buying and selling livestock for ten years.  Today, he owns several calves.  Jaloliddin is taking out a loan to purchase bulls.

loans.use: to buy bulls

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana sells cassava in Effia Kumah, near Takoradi. Juliana has received schooling through primary school. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. Juliana has been selling cassava for the past five years. She is responsible for paying to support her husband and paying her children's school fees. 

Her loan will be used to purchase a greater quantity of cassava to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her cassava-selling trade.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava to sell.

loans.name: Rahmatjon

texts.ru:
Рахматчон житель города Худжанд. Ему 59 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Жена Рахматчона домохозяйка. Двое его сыновей работают на мельнице. 
Рахматчон зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В этой области у него богатый опыт. Скотоводством Рахматчон занимается более двадцати пяти лет. Он разводит скот у себя дома. 
Рахматчон берет кредит для закупа телят.
texts.en:
Rahmatjon is a resident of the city of Khujand.  He is 59 years old.  He is married.  He has three children.  Rahmatjon's wife is a homemaker.  Two of his sons work at the mill.  Rahmatjon earns money by raising cattle.  He has rich experience in this area.  Rahmatjon has been raising livestock for over twenty five years.  He raises livestock at his home.

Rahmatjon is taking out a loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima, 41, is married and has three children. She lives in the town of Kaloleni, in the Coast province of Kenya. She has established a business in her house, raising, fattening, and selling chickens. She started this activity a year ago, and she already has customers. She raises the chickens and later sells them from her home to hoteliers.

Salima wants to increase the quantity of chickens she has, so that she can increase her sales and income. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of KES 50,000, so that she can buy more chicks and chicken feed (concentrate). Her goal is to grow her business and increase her income, so that she can give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and chicken feed (concentrate).

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be a courageous man. He operates a mechanic repair shop where he provides motor vehicle repair services. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive business area and his primary customers are motor vehicle owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Joseph will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy motor vehicle spare parts. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy motor vehicle spare parts for his repair shop.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a married woman. She has four children, whose ages range from 10 to 16 years. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. She operates a carpentry workshop, where she makes and sells furniture. Her products include, e.g., couches, wall units, chairs, tables and beds. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located at a business area with potential, and her primary customers are local residents.

She says her biggest business challenge is inadequate finances for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy timber for making furniture to sell. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy timber for making more furniture to sell.

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en:
Zenabu sells charcoal in Effia Kumah, near Takoradi. Zenabu has received no formal education. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. Zenabu has been selling charcoal for five years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband with their family's expenses. 

Her loan will be used to buy more wood necessary to produce charcoal. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further develop her charcoal-selling business.

loans.use: to buy more wood necessary to produce charcoal.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose sells clothing material and other necessary supplies to make clothes in Effia Kumah, near Takoradi. Rose has received schooling through secondary school.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a carpenter. Rose has been selling material for ten years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's expenses. 

Her loan will be used to buy more material and sewing supplies. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to increase her capital base and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more material and sewing supplies for her business.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa sells beverages in Effia Kumah, near Takoradi. She has received schooling through the secondary school level. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver. Yaa is responsible for earning money to support her husband, in paying the electric bills and their children's school fees.

Yaa has been selling beverages for the past eight years. Her loan will be used to purchase an increased variety and quantity of beverages for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business, to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an increased variety and quantity of beverages for resale.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is married and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Leticia sells corn dough and raw maize in Effia Kumah, near Takoradi, which she has done for seven years. Her husband is a mechanic in the area. Leticia uses her income to support her husband with their family's expenses. 

Leticia will use the loan to purchase an increased quantity of maize to prepare and sell in the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Leticia plans to grow her food-selling trade.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of maize to prepare and sell in the market.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa sells cassava, maize and tomatoes in Effia Kumah, near Takoradi. She has received a secondary-level education.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a painter. Theresa is responsible for paying to support her husband, and paying her children's school fees.

Theresa has been selling cassava, maize and tomatoes for 15 years. Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity of vegetables to resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her vegetable trade.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity of vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, 26 years old, is married and has 2 children, 1 and 5 years old. He describes himself as determined and jovial. Stephen has been involved in a business providing motorcycle transportation services for 6 years. His business is located in a potential business area and his primary customers are local residents. Stephen describes his biggest business challenge to be the competitive business area.

Stephen will use this KES 100,000 loan to buy another motorcycle to meet his customer demand for his transportation services. Stephen's business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM, having previously taken out and successfully repaid a loan of KES 80,000. Stephen also runs a butcher shop, which increases his business income.

loans.use: to buy another motorcyle

loans.name: Mahmood

texts.en: Mahmood is a 29-year-old single man from a small village called Deir Al-Ghson near Tulkarem. Mahmood has been planting some seasonal plants on his own farm for four years. He would like to buy more seedlings and agricultural supplies for his greenhouses in order to get more and better crops. Mahmood is requesting a 2,000 USD Youth loan from FATEN for this purpose as these improvements will increase both his sales and his income, which will create better living conditions for him. The photo above shows Mahmood at his farm.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: Cadenas, anillos y aretes de plata, fue lo que compró Tomasa con su credikiva pasado; Su animo está muy alto para continuar trabajando y esto es lo que la mueve porque ve los resultados y quiere ayudar a sus hijos y nietos, las joyas de  plata que Tomasa vende tiene  buena aceptación en su mercado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual comprará  artículos de plata y agregará nuevos productos elaborados en  acero, que están muy a la  moda. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Gracias por su apoyo”, esto es  porque le han dado la comodidad de obtener un capital para ampliar su negocio. “ Su inversión tendrá  éxito porque en la plaza no tiene otra competencia y esto la ayuda mucho a aumentar su capital y a pagar sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Tomasa bought silver chains, rings, and earrings with her last Kiva loan.  Her spirit to continue working is very high.  This motivates her because she sees the results and she wants to help her children and grandchildren.  The silver jewelry that Tomasa sells is well recognized in her market.

Currently she's applying for a Kiva loan to buy articles of silver.  She'll add new products made of steel, which are very much in style.

Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following: "Thanks for your support."  This is because they've given her the convenience of getting capital to expand her business.  Her investment will be successful because there's no other competition in the plaza, which helps her a lot to increase her capital and make her payments.

loans.use: to buy articles of silver and steel

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret sells a variety of fruits, including bananas, pineapples, and oranges, in Effia Kumah, near Takoradi. Margaret has received no formal education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a mason. Margaret is responsible for supporting her husband and paying her children's school fees.

Margaret has been selling various fruits in the market for three years. Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity and variety of fruit to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her fruit stall.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity and variety of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Joseph I.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. These teachers have come to SMT to request a loan of 19,400,000 Leones for the entire group. They will use the loan funds to meet their immediate financial challenges, and at the end of each month they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries.
 
Joseph is the featured leader of this group. The 51-year-old is a native of Makeni city. He is married to a teacher, and the couple has eight children, who are attending schools. Joseph has been a school teacher for 26 years. He has requested this loan in order to pay school and college fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school and college fees for his children.

loans.name: Elias De Jesus

texts.es: Don Elías, tiene 52 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos mayores de edad, vive en una colonia que pertenece al municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Don Elías tiene su propio taller de sastrería, desde hace 25 años confecciona ropa para hombres y mujeres, trajes y uniformes. El dedica todo el dia a su negocio. el préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de materia prima como telas, hilos, zippers, broches, y otros para la elaboración de uniformes para esta temporada. El decidió tomar este préstamo para comprar materiales al por mayor ya que así le sale mas barato y se ahorra mas. Su meta es sacar adelante su taller ya que ha sido la fuente de ingresos de la familia.
texts.en:
Don Elías is 52 years old, married, and has two grown children. He lives in a neighborhood in the town of Choloma, Cortes.

Don Elías has his own tailoring shop where he has been producing men’s and women’s clothes, suits, and uniforms for 25 years. He works all day at his business. The loan he is requesting is in the amount of 10,000 HNL and will be invested in the purchase of materials such as fabrics, thread, zippers, clasps, and other items for making uniforms this season.

Don Elías decided to take this loan so that he could buy materials in bulk, thus enabling him to get a lower price and save more. His goal is to operate a successful workshop since it is the only source of income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, zippers, clasps, and other items for making school uniforms.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is married and has 3 children. He describes himself as a patient man. For the past 3 years, James has operated a retail shop where he sells items such as tires, bulbs, brakes, etc. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are local residents. James describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient finances for business improvement. He will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy tires for resale. James' business goal is to run a new business selling vehicles within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Nathaniel Tamba's Group

texts.en:
These hardworking and dedicated teachers are from the town of Waterloo, about 26 miles from Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to request a loan of 5,300,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, their school’s bursar will deduct their repayments out of their salaries and repay SMT on their behalf.

Nathaniel is the featured leader of this team. The 59-year-old is a native of Bumbia. He is married to a teacher and the couple has 2 children. Nathaniel has served in the teaching profession for 30 years. Nathaniel has requested this loan in order to complete the house building processes he began in 2012. Previous SMT loans have helped Nathaniel to pay college fees for his children and now, he is using these loans to build his family a house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is an 18-year-old single man from Qalqilia. His father is a worker with a very low wage and also owns a workshop for repairing electrical home appliances such as refrigerators and washing machines. Most times, Mohammad helps his father in his small workshop. The family's house needs some maintenance to improve their living conditions.

Mohammad took a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to share some of his family's costs of repairing the house, such as painting and installing new windows. This loan will help Mohammad to improve the conditions of his family's home, so they can enjoy living in a suitable home. Mohammad is pictured in the family's house.

loans.use: To paint the house and install new windows

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man. He has three children, whose ages range from four to seven years. He describes himself as a courageous man. He operates a retail business, where he sells furniture. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located at a competitive business area, and his primary customers are the general public.

He says his biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy furniture to resell. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy furniture for resale

loans.name: Sheku O.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva, based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. These teachers have come to SMT to request a loan of 6,000,000 Leones for the entire group in order to meet their immediate financial challenges.  At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. 
Sheku is the featured leader of this group. The 49 year old is a native of a place call Pangure. He is married to a teacher and the couple has three children. Sheku has been a professional teacher for 24 years now. He has requested this loan in order to purchase building materials for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is 51 years old and lives in Agarak town of Meghri region. She is involved in cattle breeding and keeps three cows. She is a grazier and her main income comes from agriculture.  Svetlana lives with her husband and son, who is 31 years old. 

As agriculture is the only source of income for this family, Svetlana would like to expand it. She has requested this loan to pay for two cows. She plans to use the milk in cheese production and sales. This will enable Svetlana to increase her income and sustain her family.

loans.use: to pay for two cows

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald, 30 years old, resides in Mahukye trading centre with his wife and 3 children. He has acquired a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy land on which he will construct a house for his family. He will be paying the loan using funds from his motorcycle transport (boda boda) business and his banana plantation. Ronald is hardworking and honest. In the photograph, Ronald is with his wife in her retail shop.

loans.use: To buy land

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man, and he has four children. He describes himself as a hard-working man. He operates a retail business, where he sells items such as steering wheels, fire extinguishers, etc. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located at a potential business area, and his primary customers are local residents.

He says his biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to to buy steering wheels, fire extinguishers, etc., to resell. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy steering wheels, fire extinguishers, etc., to sell

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, solicita un préstamo porque necesita realizar la compra de una vaca y comprar tambien abono para realizar la siembra, este préstamo le dará los recursos necesarios para continuar trabajando la agricultura y ganadería. 
Con el préstamo anterior, José tuvo un efecto positivo, pudo hacer la siembra, para subsistir y crear ingresos a través de la venta de granos básicos, su condición económica es estable.
texts.en:
José is requesting a loan because he needs to buy a cow.  He also needs to buy manure for the crops.  This loan will give him the resources needed to continue working in agriculture and with livestock.

José’s previous loan had a positive effect.  He was able to sow his crops in order to survive and create income through the sale of basic grains.  His financial condition is stable.

loans.use: to buy a cow and to buy manure for his crops.

loans.name: Yanely De La Paz

texts.es:
Yanely, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de mejorar las ventas y aumentar la mercadería en el negocio, ella comprará ropa, lociones, lápices labiales, maquillaje, entre otra mercadería necesaria para hacer crecer el negocio.

Ella manifiesta que trabajar con los préstamos ha mejorado el negocio, las ventas, sus ingresos, manteniendo un trabajo estable para poder proveer a su familia lo más necesario, considera que sus circunstancias familiares han cambiado pues ahora cuenta con mayor estabilidad y su calidad de vida es mejor.
texts.en:
Yanely is requesting another loan because she needs to improve her sales and increase the merchandise in her business.  She'll buy clothing, lotions, lipstick, make-up, and other merchandise necessary to make her business grow.

She says that working with the loans has improved her business, sales, and income, maintaining a stable job to be able to give her family what they need most.  She considers her family circumstances to have changed because she has greater stability now and her quality of life is better.

loans.use: to buy clothing, lotions, lipstick, and make-up

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una mujer y madre de familia luchadora y con muchos deseos de superación junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos se dedican a la actividad de cultivo y producción de hortalizas como ser papa, coliflor y lechuga en pequeña escala, ella se dedica a la agricultura hace más de 25 años siendo sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar el cultivo de hortalizas, sus cultivos están  a una distancia de 500 metros de su casa de habitación, lo que le facilita el monitoreo constante del mismo ya que es un cultivo que necesita bastante asistencia técnica.

María tiene un grado de escolaridad primario cursado hasta el tercer grado pero con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha logrado que 1 de sus hijos esté preparándose en la rama de la educación como maestro de primaria, todos trabajan en su tiempo libre o vacacional la tierra ya que es su única fuente de ingresos. María  actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de semilla de papa y para poder hacer la preparación de la tierra como también poder comprar 2 bombas para fumigar el cultivo. 

Sus sueños son poder seguirles dando a sus hijos una mejor educación para que ellos tengan una mejor calidad de vida, mejores oportunidades de empleo, mejores ingresos siendo esta la única  recompensa que ella espera mediante el esfuerzo que diariamente hace junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Maria is a tenacious woman and mother who has a strong desire to make progress along with her husband and their 4 children.  The family works in agriculture, cultivating vegetables on a small scale such as potatoes, cauliflower, and lettuce.  Maria has been farming for more than 25 years. Her parents taught her how to cultivate vegetables.  Maria's fields are located 500 meters from her home, making it easy for her to constantly monitor them, as these are crops that require quite a bit of care.

Maria has a third grade education, but with a lot of hard work and sacrifice she has been able to help one of her children, who is now preparing to become an elementary school teacher.  The family all works the land in their free time or during vacations, because it is their only source of income.  

At this time, Maria is requesting a loan to buy potato seeds and prepare the land, and also to buy 2 pumps to spray the crops.

Maria dreams of being able to continue to provide her children with a better education so that they can have a better quality of life, better job opportunities, and more income, as this is the only reward that she hopes to get through the daily efforts she makes along with her husband.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, prepare the land, and buy pumps for spraying the crops

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as a God-fearing and ambitious woman. She operates a retail store where she sells household items. She has been involved in this business for nine years. 

Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices of products and competition within the area. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy household items to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy household items.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 31-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from two to nine. She describes herself as determined and devoted to her work. She operates a restaurant where she sells food, snacks, tea etc. She has been involved in this business for four years. 

Her business is located in a conducive business environment and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient water for use in her restaurant business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy food ingredients. Her business goal is to run a bigger restaurant within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients to make meals to sell.

loans.name: Vahagn

texts.en:
Vahagn is 25 years old and is involved in agriculture. He keeps one mother pig, as well as growing apricot and cherry trees. He is a very hardworking and proactive young man who does his best to earn a high income and sustain his family. Vahagn is married with a child. He lives with his parents, brother, wife and 4-year-old son in Armavir town. 

As agriculture is the only source of income for Vahagn, he would like to expand it. Vahagn has applied for this loan to purchase tomato seeds, 10 piglets, and renovate the barn. The loan is very important for Vahagn as the barn is too old and he isn't able to keep the livestock there. 

Vahagn hopes that the loan will give him an opportunity to earn more income and ensure a better future for his beloved son and family.

loans.use: to pay for tomato seeds, 10 piglets, and renovation of the barn

loans.name: Ochuari

texts.en:
Ochuari  is a 42-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 5 years to 17 years. He describes himself to be a hard-working man. He operates a retail store  where he sells general merchandise. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located at a viable business area and his primary customers are local residents.

Ochuari describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital to improve the business. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy general merchandise items. His business goal is to run another retail store within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He managed to repay Kes 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy household-use items

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be a jovial and determined woman. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located at a competitive business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices of clothes. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy clothes to sell. Her business goal is to run a new boutique within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.  She succesfully repaid a loan of Kes 20,000.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.en:
Leocadia is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past 2 years, Leocadia has been working hard to manage her food produce store. 

To help expand her business, Leocadia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more dry maize and beans to increase the business.  It will help Leocadia to generate greater profits in order to take good care of herself and her parents. Leocadia hopes that in the future she will be able to create a big wholesale store. 

Leocadia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy more dry maize and beans to increase the business

loans.name: Vazir

texts.en:
Vazir is 62 years old. He is from Yervandashat village of Armavir region. 

Vazir has been involved in agriculture for 25 years already and his livestock currently includes 320 lambs and 30 chickens. 

Vazir lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Agriculture is the only source of income for Vazir and he works hard to sustain his family. Vazir has applied for this loan to purchase two lambs and forage to feed them. This loan is very important for him to feed his livestock and gather more income.

loans.use: to pay for two lambs and forage to feed the livestock.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be a determined and jovial man. He operates a livestock sale business where he sells sheep and goats. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

His business is located in a viable business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy goats and sheep to sell. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats to sell.

loans.name: Mayda Lizeth

texts.es:
Mayda tiene 22 años de edad, es casada, su esposo trabaja en un supermercado y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, vive con ellos en una colonia que pertenece al municipio de Puerto Cortes.
Mayda, tiene su propio negocio de venta de mercadería en general, vende sabanas, cremas para el cuerpo y cabello, perfumes de mujer y ropa de segunda mano para caballeros, damas y niños. Su mercadería la vende de manera ambulante en las comunidades vecinas y por pedidos. Ella dedica todo el dia a su negocio. Esta solicitando otro préstamo a ODEF y a Kiva por 10,000 Lempiras para invertirlo en la compra de ropa de niño ya que viene la época escolar y va aprovechar a incrementar las ventas. Su meta es seguir trabajando en el negocio para ayudar a su esposo a salir adelante con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mayda, age 22, is married.  Her husband works in a supermarket, and they have a two year old child.  She lives with them in a neighborhood in the Puerto Cortes municipality.

Mayda has her own business of selling general merchandise.  She sells sheets, body cream, hair cream, women’s perfume, and second hand clothes for men, women, and children.  She sells her merchandise in an itinerant manner in neighboring communities and by order.  She spends all day on her business.

She is requesting another loan from ODEF and Kiva for 10,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy children’s clothes because the school season is coming, and she will take advantage of this to increase her sales.  Her goal is to continue working in the business in order to help her husband get ahead with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is an old client at UGAFODE Microfinance Limited - Rukungiri branch ("UGAFODE"). He is engaged in agricultural production, both livestock and crops. He is also a hard-working individual, who depends solely on farming to earn a living and maintain a stable and effective household. His household includes two wives and grandchildren.

Before John joined UGAFODE, his business of cow fattening and trading, which he has literally done his whole life, was on a small scale. He used to have from two to five animals at a time, for fattening. He then joined UGAFODE in 2009, with a view toward getting a financial push for his business. He succeeded and began putting funds into his business, and it got him more and more returns.

With help in the form of borrowed funds from UGAFODE, John managed to improve on his livestock, by buying modern spraying medicine and food supplements, plus getting the necessary technical help from veterinary doctors. He also managed to improve on the crop business, through the provision of local manure by the animals, for fertilizer. This has made it possible for him to maintain and ably support his family, in a manner that uplifts the household together with the community as a whole.

John, therefore, gives credit to all those who are making it possible for him, especially the Credit Officers with whom he associates most. To the entire institutions that help, he says, “Keep up the good work."

loans.use: to buy more cows, for fattening and later sale.

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is a 30-year-old married woman. She has a child. She describes herself as a determined woman. She operates a retail store where she sells plastic goods. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be the changing design of plastic-ware. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy plastic-ware. Her business goal is to run a big retail store within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy plastic items to sell.

loans.name: Margarita Anthanuet

texts.es:
Margarita, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para invertir en el negocio, se comprara sandalias de diferentes estilos,  calzado para ambos sexos, tambien prendas enchapadas en oro, ropa americana, entre otra mercadería.

Con el préstamo anterior logro mejorar su negocio, aumentar la mercadería y mejorar las ventas, ha pagado sus deudas, y cubrió gastos del hogar, se considera que mantenido estabilidad en su economía para el sostén del hogar.
texts.en:
Margarita decided on a new loan in order to invest in her business.  She will buy different styles of sandals and shoes for both sexes.  She will also buy gold-plated jewelry, American clothes, and other merchandise.

With her previous loan she managed to improve her business, to increase her merchandise, and to improve sales.  She has paid her debts and covered her household expenses.  She believes she has maintained financial stability in order to support her household.

loans.use: to buy sandals, shoes, gold-plated jewelry, and American clothes.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli is 49 years old, comes from Pokr Vedi village of Ararat region, and is involved in agriculture. She cultivates corn and grows apricots, cherries, and apple trees. Together with her husband, Maqsim, Nelli works hard to gather a good harvest and sell it in the local market. Nelli's husband works as a constructor, but agriculture helps them to have stable income during the whole month. 

Nelli has applied for this loan to purchase tomato and corn seeds and cover cultivation costs. This will enable her to gather more harvest, which will increase her agricultural income.

Nelli lives with her husband and two daughters. The loan is very important in helping Nelli and her family get a higher income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for tomato and corn seeds and cover cultivation costs

loans.name: Nabaleka Group

texts.en:
Isha is a member of Nabaleka Group in Bungoma South District. She is pictured with 10 One Acre Fund farmers, 8 women and 2 men. Isha is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Isha is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited about the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.


Isha described her harvest last year as good. She hopes as a One Acre Fund farmer she is able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and invest in another business. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Isha‘s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly is a widow aged 44, residing in Muhunga Isingiro District. She lost her husband four years ago and was left with six children who are all in school. She has struggled a lot to ensure her children survive by doing various activities like a pig farm, cattle farming and banana farming. These businesses have enabled her pay tuition for her two daughters who are in secondary school. 

She wants a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to add manure to her banana plantation to boost its productivity.

loans.use: To buy organic manure for the banana plantation.

loans.name: Mose

texts.en: Mose is 43 years old and lives in her own house with her family. For some years, she has worked in the food vending business in the area where she lives. With a lot of experience selling various dishes and beverages, she has been able to achieve success. She is a hard-working and enterprising woman, with a dream of bringing home an income to her family in order to improve their living conditions. Her husband's income is not enough to cover household costs. Mose needs to invest in buying more ingredients, like wheat flour, sugar, baking powder, etc. so as to increase her productivity and, eventually, her income. It is for this reason that she has come to Yehu. She is applying for a loan that will help her to buy these materials and to move ever closer to achieving her goals.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients like wheat flour, sugar, baking powder, etc

loans.name: Kham

texts.en:
Kham is involved in trading agricultural products in the form of cash crops like beans and maize in Rukungiri town. He also has another side business, a retail shop, which has phone charging facilities for the general public. He joined UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) – Rukungiri branch in 2012 for financial serves in order to improve his business practices.

The institution has helped his transform his life and that of his family with the loan advances which he has injected into his businesses and which have enabled him to increase his income. He has also managed to pay tuition fees for his children since his businesses are not disrupted by withdrawing some money from them. 

He has taken this particular loan to buy coffee to trade especially given that now it is the coffee harvesting season.

The customer thanks UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for the financial services it renders to the people in Rukungiri and the country as a whole but emphasizes the importance of interest rate reduction for some loan products.

loans.use: To buy coffee to trade.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor  is a 41-year-old married man. He has two children, 5 years and 10 years old. He describes himself to be an optimistic man. He operates a retail business where he sells electrical goods. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located at a potential business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital to improve the business. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy electrical goods. His business goal is to improve his business within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 36-year-old man, married with two children: a 6-year-old and a 3-year-old. Robert is a hardworking man. He wakes up very early  every day to begin his routine of taking care of the pigs, doing other farm work,  and later on going to teach. He is a teacher and farming helps him supplement his income.

For this loan, he would like to buy corn bran as feed for the pigs.

loans.use: To buy feed

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a widow.  She has four children, all of whom are at school.  She is a coffee farmer and works eight hours a day for six days a week. She also teaches in a nearby primary(elementary) school.  She started her business in 2010 in a village called Ndaragi and her clients are people who buy on a small scale. 
The loan purpose is to buy coffee husks and other crop residues for mulching her plantation. She hopes to become a model farmer for coffee growing for all the other farmers in the area.
Her challenge is an insufficient labour force for the farm. She is hardworking and honest. She hopes to expand the project.

loans.use: To buy coffee husks and mulches for mulching the plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Carnes y viceras, fue lo que compró Javier y con ello obtuvo mayores ganancias,Javier está muy contento porque su experiencia de 38 años en esta actividad le aha permitido salir adelante y sostener su hogar. Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es : "Gracias por esa ayuda que llegó  en el mejor momento de su vida, por le  permitió avanzar en su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicado a un credikiva, con el cual comprará nuevamente carne a mayoristas, porque logrará precios competitivos en una época de festividades carnavaleras, donde el consumo de carne y viceras en superior a cual quier otra época del año y esto hace que el gane un poco mas de dinero.
texts.en:
Javier bought meat and viceras with his previous loan, which allowed him to have increased profits. Javier is very happy because his 38 years of experience in this line of work has allowed him to get ahead and to sustain his household. The message he would like to give to the Kiva lenders is "Thank you for the support that you have given during the prime of my life, allowing me to move forward in my business." 

Javier is currently requesting a loan, which he will use once again to buy meat at wholesale price, so that he will be able to maintain competitive prices during a season of Carnival festivities. During this season the consumption of beef and viceras increases significantly compared to other times. This loan will make it so that he will be able to earn a little more money.

loans.use: to buy meat at wholesale price.

loans.name: Varos

texts.en:
Varos is a young farmer from Dalarik village. He is 23 years old and lives with his parents.

He is involved in agriculture. His farm currently includes a cow, a pig, 25 chickens and two turkeys. With the help of his mother, Varos gets cheese and milk products and sells them in the local market. He is the only breadwinner in the family and his income comes from agriculture. 

So, in order to expand his agricultural business, Varos has applied for this loan. With the help of the loan, Varos will purchase two pigs and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan is very important for Varos to get more income and be able to ensure a better life for his beloved parents.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Baker

texts.en:
Baker is a 34-year-old married man with two children, who both go to school. He also takes care of two dependents by providing them with shelter and all their basic needs including paying their school fees.

Baker has a shop dealing in cosmetics, mainly ladies cosmetics and perfumes. He started this business in 2007 as a source of income for his family in a bid to improve their standard of living. With this business, he has been able to provide for his family's needs, pay school fees for his children and also those of the dependents.

He however has a dream of expanding his business by opening up new cosmetic stores. In addition, he has a dream of educating his children and dependents to a higher level of education so that they will be able to contribute to the nation. His major challenge is limited capital which hampers his business operations. 

Baker is very hard working and focused in his business dealings and always wants to succeed in all he does.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to increase his stock.

loans.name: Sonia Esther

texts.es: Sonia de 62 años de edad, tiene un local en el centro de la ciudad, donde vende ropa usada y también comercializa telas para elaborar disfraces. Su negocio inició hace 2 años, cuando inició vendiendo  la ropa usada en Rio Frio, un corregimiento del Magdalena, balneario de agua de mucho movimiento turístico por su hermoso Rio helado, donde las familias se reúnen para compartir y recrearse.    Poco a poco Sonia se dio a conocer y empezó a relacionarse con clientes de la ciudad de Barranquilla, lugar ubicado a 3 horas, donde con frecuencia viajaba;  así fue como encontró la oportunidad de ubicar un puesto en el mercado, y desde allí empezó a surgir. Ella vende toda clase de ropa jeans, blusas, camisas, faldas, pantalones usados femeninos, las exhibe en cuerdas que tiene en su propio local y esto llama mucho la atención de su clientela porque lo asocian con un buen precio.  Sus ventas las realiza de contado y trabaja de lunes a domingo. Sus compras las realiza a una amiga que se encarga de recoger estas prendas en toda la ciudad y la frecuencia con que Sonia le compra es de tres veces por semana. Así mismo vende telas para confeccionar disfraces y este negocio es muy bueno en la época previa al carnaval, porque las fiestas atraen toda clase de compradores, que quieren elaborar con sus propias manos el suyo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprará telas para disfraces, ropa usada lo cual aumentará el potencial de ventas y con ello garantiza que su inversión tenga mucho éxito.
texts.en:
Sonia is 62 years old. She has a store in the city center, where she sells used clothing and fabrics to make costumes. 

She opened her business two years ago, when she began to sell used clothing in Rio Frio, a small town in the department of Magdalena. Rio Frio is a spa town which welcomes many tourists visiting its beautiful cool river, where families meet to spend time together and enjoy themselves. 

Little by little, Sonia began to make a name for herself and meet customers in the city of Barranquilla, located three hours away. She often traveled there, and this is how she came across the opportunity to set up a stall in the market. Everything grew from there. 

She sells all kinds of used women's clothing, including jeans, blouses, vests, skirts and pants. She displays them on cords that hang in her store, and this attracts customers' attention because they associate them with a good price. She accepts cash for her goods and works from Mondays to Sundays. A friend of hers chooses and buys clothes from all over the city for her to sell in her store, and Sonia buys fresh stock three times a week. She also sells fabrics to make costumes. This is a successful business in the season leading up to Carnival, because the celebrations attract all types of buyers who want to make their own costumes.  

It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan from Kiva, to buy fabrics for costumes and used clothing, which will increase her selling potential and guarantee that her investment is successful.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for costumes, and used clothing

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio de la agricultura, pues se dispone a realizar una nueva siembra para la cual necesita comprar semilla, abono, arrendamiento del terreno y también limpiar la zona donde realizar este préstamo le dara la posibilidad de realizar su trabajo en el campo.

Con el préstamo anterior logró tener un efecto positivo, ya que le ayudó a producir una manzana de maíz obteniendo una buena cosecha para poder almacenar para la alimentación de su familia y también vender una parte, su condición en la familia se mantiene.
texts.en:
José has decided on a new loan because of the need to invest more in his agricultural business.  He is ready to plant again, and to do so he needs to buy seeds and manure, rent the land, and clear the area where he plants.  This loan will make it possible to do his work in the field.

He managed to have a positive effect with the previous loan.  It helped him produce a ‘manzana’ [a land measurement unit equivalent to 7000 square meters] of corn.  He got a good harvest, which he was able to store to feed his family.  He also sold part of the harvest, and his family situation is stable.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure and to rent the land.

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en:
Feryal is a 35-year-old married woman. Feryal and her husband have a grocery store selling different types of groceries.  It has been a profitable project and the only source of income for them, but also it needs more support to cover the costs.

Feryal is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request such as rice, sugar and  milk, and to purchase a new refrigerator for keeping soft drinks. This will increase sales and increase the family's income.

Feryal and her husband are photographed in their grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase needed stock of basic groceries and a new refrigerator for soft drinks

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 16 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past two years, Judith has been working hard to manage her knitting business, selling hand-made clothes such as sweaters. 

To help expand her business, Judith has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more yarn that will be used for making sweaters, and will help Judith to generate greater profits and take good care of herself and her family members. Judith hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business and own a big shop in town that sells sweaters. 

Judith is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more yarn that will be used for making sweaters

loans.name: Ematola Group

texts.en:
Ematola is a group of 10 farmers in Bungoma South District represented by Hassan. The group has 5 women and 5 men. Hassan is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Hassan’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and use increased profits to send his children to school.


Hassan managed to harvest 7 bags of maize on 1 acre of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, he hopes to harvest even more! He plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and to repair his home. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Hassan’s group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Cathy's Group

texts.en:
Cathy's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Cathy is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo, in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past two years, Cathy has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells scrap. 

To help expand her business, Cathy has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more scrap, which she will resell to manufacturing factories. The buyers will use the scrap to make new saucepans and plates. This loan will help Cathy to generate greater profits and take care of her family members by providing for all their basic needs. Cathy hopes that, in the future, she will be able to own a wholesale shop that sells food commodities. 

Cathy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more scrap, which she will resell for use in making new saucepans and plates

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy household items to resell in his store

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para poder aumentar la producción y mejorar los ingresos a su hogar, en esta ocasión se dispone a sembrar algunas hortalizas para las cuales comprara lo necesario como semillas de pipian, de tomate, de cebolla, que serán los que estará trabajando en la nueva temporada.

El considera que su producción ha mejorado, con esto ha logrado vender un mayor margen, para poder proveer a su familia otro tipo de alimento con los ingresos que recibe, su calidad de vida junto a la de su hogar ha mejorado y ha logrado adquirir unos electrodomésticos necesarios.
texts.en:
José has decided to request a new loan in order to increase production and his earnings. On this occasion, he wants to grow some vegetables for which he needs to buy necessary items such as pipian squash, tomato and onion seeds, which he will cultivate in the new season.

He believes that his yield has increased, and as a result he has managed to sell produce for a greater profit and provide his family with other foods with his earnings. His and his family's quality of life has improved and he has been able to buy some necessary household appliances.

loans.use: to buy pipian squash, tomato and onion seeds to sew.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Assai

texts.fr: Âgée de 51ans, Assai est mère de 04 enfants dont 02 à l’école. Pour prendre soin de ses derniers, elle fait depuis 2002 le commerce de céréales à domicile. Son approvisionnement se fait à Lomé et dans les villes lointaines du pays. Afin d’accroitre son activité et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille, elle fait un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises(céréales), pour revendre et pouvoir atteindre son objectif.
texts.en: Assai is a 51-year-old mother of four children, two of whom attend school. In order to care for her younger children, Assai has been selling grain from her home since 2002. She purchases her supplies in Lomé and from cities far away from where Assai lives in the country. In order to help her business to grow and ensure her family's vitality, Assai has sought her first loan from WAGES. Assai plans to use her loan to purchase a stock of grains, which she will sell to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of grains

loans.name: Wairimu

texts.en:
Wairimu is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 5 years to 9 years. She describes herself to be an optimistic woman. She operates a grocery stall  where she sells vegetables such as kale, etc. She has been involved in this business for nine years. Her business is located at a busy market area and her primary customers are local residents.
