Wairimu describes her biggest business challenge to be quick perishability of vegetables. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more vegetables. Her business goal is to run a fully stocked grocery store within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Pedro Fernando

texts.es:
Pedro, tiene 23 años de edad, vive con su esposa  tienen un hijo de un año de edad, además vive con su suegra, realiza la labor de siembra de frijol y maíz, aprendió con sus padres y lo realiza desde hace tres años como un medio de subsistencia.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de 3 sacos de abono, con este material realizara la siembra, gracias a los créditos tendrá el recurso económico para realizar la compra y tener buena producción.
Su aspiración es mejorar económicamente y tener una condición más favorable con su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro, who is 23 years old, lives with his wife. They have one child who is a year old. He also lives with his mother-in-law. He sows beans and maize, which he learned from his parents. He has been doing this job for the last three years as a way to survive.

He is requesting a loan to buy 3 bags of fertiliser, which he will use for sowing. Thanks to the loans he will have the economic resources to make this purchase and have a good crop.

His aspiration is to improve his economic circumstances, and for himself and his family to be in a better situation.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of fertiliser

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, age 22, is involved in an agricultural business. He keeps two cows and uses their milk for cheese production, selling the cheese at local markets. He lives with his parents in the town of Jermuk.
  
As the family's income comes from agriculture, Robert would like to expand his livestock. He has applied for this loan in order to purchase five heifers and four pigs. 

He considers this loan to be very important because it will allow him to earn more income and thereby improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase five heifers and four pigs

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter, age 21 and unmarried, runs a butcher shop where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a viable business area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds for improving the business. He describes himself as a loving and caring man. 

Walter has applied for a loan in the amount of Kes 10,000. He will use his loan funds to buy more meat to offer for sale. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. His business goal is to buy a freezer within five years. 

He hopes that in the future he will have a family and be able to cater for their financial needs.

loans.use: to buy meat to offer for sale in his butcher shop

loans.name: Misael Antonio

texts.es: Misael de 36 años es el  propietario de un restaurante y puesto de comidas rápidas en el municipio de Soledad, donde habita con su familia. Desde hace 8 años, cuando notó que en su vecindario hacia falta un punto de ventas de comidas, empezó a estructurar su posibilidad de emprender el suyo;  y hoy es la actividad con la que genera ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Sus principales productos son las comidas y almuerzos, arepas rellenas y en general comidas rápidas, que ofrece desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 12 de la noche. Sus compras las realiza en distribuidoras y salsamentarías en mayor volumen, con lo cual gana frecuentes descuentos. Esta es la primera vez que recibe un crédito de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, y planea sea todo un éxito, porque será un credikiva, con el que comprará un enfriador, una estufa industrial, y menaje de cocina, además insumos para la preparación de sus comidas, como salsas, verduras, víveres y refrescos, porque planea actualizar su infraestructura, brindarle mayor comodidad al clientes y  estar mas organizada, para disminuir los tiempos productivos y mejorar sus descansos, así mismo disminuirá los costos productivos que le facilitaran otorgarle mejores precios a sus clientes para ser mas competitivo.
texts.en:
Misael is 36 years old and is the owner of a restaurant and fast food stall in the town of Soledad, where he lives with his family. Eight years ago, he noticed that there was no place to purchase prepared food in his neighborhood; so he started to entertain the possibility of starting his own food business. And today, this is the activity that is his and his family's main source of income. He offers lunch and dinner, stuffed arepas (corn loaves) and other fast food, which he sells from 8 am to midnight.
He buys in bulk from wholesalers and delis, which allows him to get frequent discounts. This will be the first time he will receive a loan from the Fundacion Maria Santo Domingo and he plans to make it a success, as this will be a Kiva loan. With the loan, he will purchase a refrigerator, an industrial stove and kitchen help, as well as supplies to prepare his dishes - such as salsas, vegetables, food and refreshments. He is planning on modernizing his amenities, so he can be more organized and offer his clients more convenience. He hopes this will allow him to decrease work time and give him a little more free time. He hopes he can decrease expenses, which should enable him to give his clients better prices and thus allow him to become more competitive.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator, an industrial stove and kitchen help

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is asking for a new loan to expand her clothes-selling business. Thanks to the previous loan, which was of great help, it enabled her to start a food-vending business which she says is doing very well. 

With this new loan, Mwanasha will buy bundles of clothes for sale and a bale of wheat flour for her food-vending business. In the future, she wishes to expand her food-vending to a more permanent hotel.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes for sale and a bale of wheat flour for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Makarimal Akhlakh Gpe 17 Group

texts.fr: Makarimal Akhlakh gpe  17 est un regroupement de 10 femmes qui  évoluent dans le meme secteur d’activité, elles habitent le meme quartier et exercent l’achat et la vente de poissons. Elles adhèrent aussi dans le meme groupement d’intérêt  économique Makarimal  Akhlakh. Elles sont représentées par Madame  Ndeye Mour (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo). Elle capitalise une expérience de 30 ans dans son activité. Elle  sollicite un crédit dans le but d’augmenter son fond de roulement. Le financement servira  à  l’achat de poissons qu’elle achète directement des pirogues pour les vendre aux revendeurs.  Elle  est mariée et les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants et de soutenir son mari dans la gestion des dépenses du foyer. Elle démarre sa journée à 7 heures du matin pour la terminer à 15 heures.  Elle souhaite  accroitre ses bénéfices  pour  mieux  prendre en charge les frais de scolarité de ses enfants, parvenir a épargner de l’argent et participer a l’amélioration des conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Elle souhaite aussi acheter quelques biens mobiliers. Son projet futur  consiste  à acquérir une pirogue et  un véhicule frigorifique pour les besoins de son activité.
texts.en:
Makarimal Akhlakh Gpe 17 is a group of ten women who work in the same sector. They live in the same neighborhood and are all merchants who both buy and sell fish. They also affiliated with the to the same economic interest group of Makarimal Akhlakh. They are represented by Ndeye Mour (shown with her hand raised in the photo).

Ndeye Mour has over 30 years of experience in her business. She is requesting a loan in order to increase her working capital. This loan will be used to purchase fish that she buys directly from canoes and sells to retailers. Ndeye Mour is married, and the income she earns will enable her to pay for the education of her children and support her husband in managing their household expenses.

Ndeye Mour begins working at 7:00 in the morning and finishes at 3:00 in the evening. She wants to increase her earnings so that she can better manage the responsibility of her children's tuition. Ndeye Mour also wants to save money and improve the nutrition of her family. She hopes to also purchase some articles of furniture. Ndeye Mour would like to someday purchase a canoe and a refrigerated vehicle in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is married and has no children. She has received no formal education. Charity sells cloth and other sewing materials in Effia Kumah, near Takoradi, which she has done for ten years now. Her husband is a hospital assistant. Charity uses her income to help support her husband with the family's expenses. 

Charity will use the loan to purchase more cloth and materials to make clothing. With the new profits from her expanded business, Charity plans to further develop her seamstress trade.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth and materials to make clothing.

loans.name: Jose Heriberto

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo préstamo porque realizará una nueva siembra de granos básicos para la cual comprará abono, herbicidas, otros insumos agropecuarios que sea necesario para realizar el trabajo y continuar proveyendo a su familia el alimento.

El considera que a través de los préstamos su producción ha aumentado, ya que ha invertido en los materiales necesarios para que esta producción sea mejor, de ella se ha alimentado su familia y también ha logrado vender una parte, gracias a los créditos KIVA ha mejorado su situación económica.
texts.en:
José has decided to apply for a new loan because he will carry out a new sowing of bulk grains for which he will buy manure, weed-killers, and other farming supplies that are necessary to carry out his work and continue providing food for his family. 

José believes that through the loans his production has increased, considering that he has invested in the materials necessary to improve his production. With this he has fed his family, and he has also managed to sell some. Thanks to the KIVA lenders his economic situation has improved.

loans.use: to buy manure and weed-killers.

loans.name: Simeona

texts.en:
This is Simeona, 62, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Simeona operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, and dahlias also variety of hanging plants and others alike. Her regular customers are local tourist, neighbors and the nearby community.  She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php30, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Simeona hopes to have a good life and dreams to expands her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and garden inputs for her business.

loans.name: Jovans

texts.en:
Jovans is a tea farmer who lives in the village of Rwekitooma in Ruhumuro. She is widowed and has 12 children, eight of whom are enrolled in school. She also cares for four dependents whose parents are unknown. She works on her tea plantation for six hours a day, six days per week. She also trades in green tea leaves. She sells her produce directly to factories.

Jovans started her business in 1994 and initiated the endeavor purposely to help her support her family. She reports that the business has very little capital and that this loan will allow her the chance to expand and improve her business. She faces the challenges of hail storms, persistent drought, and a poor transport network.
 
She will use her expected profits from this loan to pay the school fees for a few of her children.

Jovans is a hard-working woman and hopes to expand the business so as to earn as much as possible to support her family.

loans.use: to obtain capital to invest in her tea-farming business

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

He is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle transport business.

Michelle has been in this business for 3 years. Michelle earns more income from a general store.

Michelle has been sustaining his business activities through his own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. He dreams to build and expand his business to secure the financial stability of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle business.

loans.name: Jorge Fausto

texts.es: Jorge Fausto tiene 58 años de edad, soltero, es originario del municipio de Posoltega , ciudad en la cual reside actualmente, es vendedor ambulante poseedor de una línea de cortero de venta al crédito, comercializa ropa, calzado y todo tipo de productos solicitados por sus clientes. El negocio lo empezó cuando su hermano le cedió la línea para que este pudiera trabajar por cuenta propia, este lo empezó hace quince años, el propósito del crédito será invertir capital de trabajo para ofrecer a su clientela, más y variados productos, para expandir un poco más su negocio. Jorge esta muy agradecido con la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno
texts.en:
Jorge Fausto is 58 years old and is single. He is from the municipality of Posoltega and lives in the town at the moment. He is a street vendor with his own route. He sells to his customers on credit. He sells clothes, footwear and any other type of product that his customers request. 

He started the business when his brother gave him this route so that he could work it himself. That was fifteen years ago. The purpose of the loan is to invest it in working capital in order to be able to offer his customers more and more varied products, to expand his business a bit. 

Jorge is very grateful for the help given by Kiva investors to people with scarce resources and from poor countries like Nicaragua which gives them the means to have an honest job.

loans.use: purchase of merchandise, such as clothes, footwear, ladies underwear, etc.

loans.name: Makarimal Akhlakh Gpe 18 Group

texts.fr: Makarimal Akhlakh gpe  18 est un regroupement de 10 femmes qui  évoluent dans le meme secteur d’activité, elles  pratiquent l’achat et  la vente de poissons. Elles adhèrent aussi dans le meme groupement d’intérêt  économique Makarimal  Akhlakh. Elles sont représentées par Madame Dieynaba (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo). Elle capitalise une expérience de 30 ans dans son activité. Elle  sollicite un crédit dans le but d’augmenter son fond de roulement. Le financement servira  a  l’achat de poissons  qu’elle va revendre. Elle  est mariée et les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants de meme que les paiements de facture au sein de son foyer. Elle démarre sa journée à 5 heures du matin pour la terminer à 14 heures.  Elle souhaite  accroitre ses bénéfices  pour  mieux  participer dans les charges du foyer. Son projet futur  consiste  à acquérir une pirogue et voyager pour les besoins de son commerce.
texts.en:
Makarimal Akhlakh Gpe 18 is a group of ten women who work in the same sector. They are all merchants who both buy and sell fish. They are also affiliated with the same economic interest group of Makarimal Akhlakh. They are represented by Dieynaba (shown with her hand raised in the photo).

Dieynaba has over 30 years of experience in her sector. She is requesting a loan in order to increase her working capital. This loan will be used to purchase fish that she will then resell. Dieynaba is married, and the income she earns will enable her to pay for the education of her children and to pay for various household bills. Dieynaba begins working at 5:00 in the morning and finishes at 2:00 in the afternoon. She wants to increase her earnings in order to better manage the household expenses. Dieynaba would like to someday purchase a canoe in order to travel for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale

loans.name: Anderson

texts.es: Anderson incrementó su inventario con su credikiva y vendió rapidamente su calzado. Con esta inversión logró ofrecer mayor diversidad de diseños en sus productos y ahora puede ofrecer créditos a su clientela y esto hace que su rotación sea alta y requiera caa vez mas capital para atender nueva demanda. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará calzado colegial para dar respuesta a la temporada educativa del primer trimestre del año, que llega con una gran demanda de calzados colegiales, por parte de los padres de familia, que necesitan responder a esta necesidad que tienen sus hijos y esto es lo que hace que la inversión de credikiva en esta temporada, tenga  un gran potencial de éxito.
texts.en:
Anderson increased his inventory with his Kiva loan and quickly sold his footwear.  With this investment he managed to offer a greater variety of product designs and now he can offer his customers loans, which makes his turnover high and requires more capital all the time to respond to demand.

This is why he's applying for another Kiva loan to buy school shoes to respond to school season in the first trimester.  This comes with high demand for school shoes on the part of parents, who need to respond to their children's needs.  This is what gives the potential for success to the investment of a Kiva loan in this season.

loans.use: to buy footwear for school

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther sells secondhand clothes in Effia Kumah near Takoradi. She has received schooling through a junior high school level.  She is single and has two children. 

Esther has been selling secondhand clothes for ten years now. She is responsible for paying to support herself and her children. 

Esther’s loan will be used to purchase an increased quantity and variety of secondhand clothing to sell in the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her clothing shop.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity and variety of secondhand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Muyassara

texts.ru:
Муяссара жительница города Куляб. Ей 64 года. Она вдова. У нее двое детей. Ее старший сын находится на заработках за рубежом. 
Муяссара занимается животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. У нее имеются необходимые условия для разведения скота. В этой области она три года. Муяссара берет кредит для закупа телят и быков с целью увеличения поголовья крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en:
Muyassara is a resident of the town of Kulyab. She is 64 years old and has two children. She is a widow. Her elder son is working abroad.
 
Muyassara is involved in raising animals. She breeds livestock near her home. She has the necessary conditions for raising animals. She has three years experience in this work. 

Muyassara is taking a loan to buy calves and steer for the purpose of increasing the number of her cattle.

loans.use: to buy calves and steer to increase her number of cattle

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is from Vayk town. She is 51 years old and lives with her two sons. 

Karine has been involved in beekeeping for many years. She keeps 55 colonies of bees and gets high quality honey. As honey is a must-have item for each household in the Vayots Dzor region, there are always plenty of buyers of quality honey. 

Karine also keeps livestock, which currently includes 15 chickens and 3 cows. Karine's sons help her to sell honey and milk products in the market and get income. Agriculture helps this family to sustain their living and cover their basic costs. 

As Karine hasn't sufficient funds to purchase an ox, she has applied for this loan. With the help of the loan, she will purchase an ox, which will help her to increase her agricultural income. 

Karine hopes that with the help of the loan, she will be able to secure the future of the family.

loans.use: to purchase an ox.

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.ru:
Фаррух житель города Исфара. Ему 30 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Жена Фарруха работает визажистом и парикмахершей в собственном салоне. 
Фаррух творческая личность, он певец и композитор. Фаррух арендует студию звукозаписи. На сегодняшний день ему необходимо купить музыкальный инструмент. Фаррух берет кредит на сумму 1000 долларов США, чтобы приобрести арган.
texts.en:
Farrukh is a resident of the town of Isfara. He is 30 years old, married, and has two children. Farrukh's wife does make-up and hairdressing in her own salon. 

Farrukh has a creative personality; he is a singer and songwriter. Farrukh rents a recording studio. At the moment, he needs to buy a musical instrument. Farrukh is taking a loan of $1,000 to purchase an organ.

loans.use: to purchase a musical instrument

loans.name: Linmay

texts.es: Linmay, tiene 34 años de edad, tiene un hijo, vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara junto a su pareja y su hijo. Ella tiene su propio negocio de venta de mercadería como camisas, blusas, pantalones, lociones, cremas y calzado. El negocio lo tiene desde hace 4 años. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y en su casa. Linmay Ha decidido por solicitar otro préstamo para surtir el negocio, el cual es por 26,000 lempiras y es el segundo ciclo en ODEF. Ella piensa comprar ropa, cosmeticos y calzado para incrementar el inventario y las ventas. Tiene como meta llegar a ofrecer el producto a otras aldeas, y con las ganancias poder ayudar a su hijo con el estudio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Linmay, 34, has a son; she lives in Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara with her spouse and son.  She has her own business selling merchandise like shirts, blouses, pants, lotions, creams and footwear.  She’s had the business for four years.  She sells at home and also from place to place.  Linmay has decided to ask for another loan to stock her business.  It’s for 26,000 Lempiras and it’s her second ODEF cycle.  She will buy clothes, cosmetics and footwear to increase inventory and sales.  Her goal is to eventually sell her goods in other villages and be able to help with her son’s schooling and to improve his quality of life with the profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Bozorali

texts.ru: Бозорали проживает в районе Восеъ. Ему 47 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Бозорали вместе с женой занимается торговлей на рынке. Он занимается продажей тканей. Этим видом бизнеса Бозорали занимается восемь лет. Он берет кредит для покупки тканей с целью увеличения оборота.
texts.en:
Bozorali lives in the Vose region. He is 47 years old, married, and has five children. Bozorali and his wife are engaged in trade in the market together. He sells fabrics. Bozorali has been involved in this work for eight years. 

He is taking a loan to buy fabrics to increase his inventory.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics to increase his inventory

loans.name: Didas

texts.en:
Didas is married with five children, three of whom are in school. He trades in coffee, whenever it is in-season. Didas works seven hours, seven days per week. His other source of income is that of motorcycle-riding and repairing motorcycles in a nearby trading center. He started the business in 2008, in Karama-Burungira Kyabugimbi sub-county. The business was purposely started to make money, to earn a living. 

The purpose of the loan is to buy more coffee for sale. Didas sells his coffee after removing the husks, which he sells to farmers for mulching, as well. He hopes to start up a factory when he gets enough money out of his businesses. The challenges to his business are price fluctuations during bumper harvest and bad weather. He is a committed and hard-working man. He requests that lenders reduce interest.

loans.use: to buy coffee for sale.

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es:
El señor José Ramón es habitante del Municipio de Condega un pueblo que esta a unos 35 km al norte de la ciudad de Estelí. Reside ahí desde hace mas de cuarenta años y esta felizmente casado y tiene 3 hijo de los cuales 2 de ellos son independiente y el otro esta en el colegio.

El señor José Ramón se desempeña en la actualidad como albañil y labora a diario en la construcción de viviendas y construcción de techos en el municipio de Condega, este señor es muy conocido en este pueblo ya que sus trabajos son de buena calidad

 Este cliente se presento a las oficinas de Ceprodel con el objetivo de solicitar un nuevo financiamiento para la compra  de de un compresor, una herramienta que le felicitara su trabajo y le ayudara a mejorar sus servicio y que anteriormente lo alquila de esta manera se ahorrara los gastos de alquiler y por ende tendrá mejores ingresos

Este cliente ya ha tenido crédito en Ceprodel en 10 ciclos crediticios en total en un periodo de 8 años y se muestra agradecido por el apoyo que la institución, le ha ayudado a mejorar su nivel de vida poco a poco ya que sus ingresos no son lo suficiente para lograr financiarse su propio capital la compra total de sus herramientas de trabajo.
texts.en:
Jose Ramon lives in Condega, a town located 35 kms north of the city of Esteli. He has been residing there for over forty years and is happily married; he has 3 children, 2 of whom are independent - the third is in school. Jose Ramon is a mason and works building houses and roofs in Condega. He is well known in town as he performs high quality work. 
This client came to Ceprodel in order to solicit a new loan to purchase a compressor - a tool that will help him on the job and allow him to deliver better services. Until now, he has been renting this equipment; having a compressor will mean he will not have to incur the expense of renting it : in the end, this means he will have a better income. This client has obtained and paid back 10 loans from Ceprodel over a period of 8 years. He is very grateful for the help he has received from Ceprodel, which has slowly helped him to improve his living conditions. He does not have sufficient income to get financing that would enable him to purchase work tools.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.ru:
Музафар 58 - летний мужчина проживающий в городе Куляб. Он женат. У него трое детей. Жена Музафара домохозяйка. Его сын занимается торговлей. Музафар имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Он более десяти лет проработал в школе. 
Сейчас Музафар занимается торговлей. Он арендует торговую точку на рынке. Музафар в основном занимается продажей мужской одежды. В этой области он два года. Музафар берет кредит для приобретения весенней одежды с целью увеличения оборота.
texts.en:
Muzafar is a 58-year-old man, living in the town of Kolyab. He is married and has three children. Muzafar's wife is a homemaker. His son is a trader. Muzafar has a degree in teaching. He worked at the school for more than ten years. 

Now, Muzafar is engaged in trade. He rents a stall in the market. Muzafar is mainly engaged in the sale of men's clothing. He has two years experience in this area. 

Muzafar is taking a loan for the purchase of spring clothing in order to increase his inventory.

loans.use: to purchase spring clothing

loans.name: Sulaymon

texts.ru: Сулаймон проживает в городе Худжанд. Ему 52 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Сулаймон занимается животноводством. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом бизнеса Сулаймон занимается тринадцать лет. Он берет кредит для закупа телят.
texts.en:
Sulaymon resides in the city of Khujand. He is 52 years old, married, and has two children. 

Sulaymon is involved in raising livestock. He makes a living by breeding cattle. Sulaymon has been involved in this kind of work for 13 years. 

He is taking a loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven is a married man from Kaberebere, a village in Isingiro, near Mbarara town. He has four children and all go to school. He grew up as an orphan, after losing his parents at the early age of three. Due to lack of parental care, he resorted to the banana trade, a business that has transformed his life and family. He has started constructing a new, permanent house for his family from the income he gets. 

Steven now wants a loan of UGX 2,000,000/= to support the completion of his house. His desire is to improve the standard of living for the family.

loans.use: to complete construction of his house.

loans.name: Wendyalgdo Group

texts.fr:
Mr  SALIFOU représente le  groupe WENDYALGDO. Il se porte bien ainsi que tout le groupe. Marié, Il est père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 03ans et le moins âgé a 01an. Personne ne  va  à l’école et il a 03 personnes  en charge.
Mr  vend des plats et seaux  depuis 03 ans.  Il s’approvisionne au marché de Sankaryaré et Larlé. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Il veut s’acheter  04 douzaines de seaux, 05 douzaines de bouillards et 01 douzaine de bassines.
Il  veut épargner  ses bénéfices afin de renforcer son activité  et avoir un moyen de déplacement. Mr ambitionne améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et voyager pour acheter en grande quantité ses marchandises.
texts.en:
Salifou is the representative of the Wendyalgdo Group. He is doing well, as is the whole group. Salifou is married and the father of two children. The oldest is three and the youngest is one year old. Salifou has one additional dependent in his care, and none of his children currently attend school.

Salifou has been selling dishes and buckets for the past three years. He purchases his merchandise at the markets of Sankaryaré and Larlé. His clientele is made up of both men and women.

Salifou wants to use this loan to buy four dozen buckets, five dozen kettles, and a dozen basins. He wants to save his income in order to reinvest in his business and purchase a means of transportation. Salifou's goals are to improve the living conditions of his family and to travel so that he can purchase his merchandise in larger quantities.

loans.use: to purchase four dozen buckets, five dozen kettles, and a dozen basins

loans.name: Elvio Alejandro

texts.es:
Elvio es un joven de 29 años su estado civil es soltero su profesión es Lic. Administración de empresa. Es originario del la bella ciudad de Estelí, este joven se caracteriza por ser una personas responsable, honesta, trabajadora.
Actualmente labora para una empresa procesadora de tabaco desempeñándose como asistente de bodega el cual consiste llevar registrado todo el inventario.

Con el financiamiento otorgado que se le otorgo lo destinara para gasto de trámite de titulo de la carrera de Lic., en administración de empresa. Elvio se muestra agradecido con ceprodel y kiva ya que a través del financiamiento es una manera de apoyar a todos aquellos jóvenes que tienen el buen deseo de superación y que a la vez se vuelve un poco difícil por la situación económica del país.
texts.en:
Elvio, 29, is single.  His profession is business administration.  He's from the beautiful city of Estelí and is a responsible, honest, and hardworking young man.  Currently he works for a tobacco-processing company as a warehouse assistant, which consists of checking all the inventory.

With the loan granted he'll pay the costs of the paperwork for his advanced degree in business administration.

Elvio is grateful to CEPRODEL and Kiva because the loan is a way of supporting all those young people who want to improve themselves but for whom the country's economic situation is a bit difficult.

loans.use: to pay the costs of the paperwork for his advanced degree

loans.name: Nurila

texts.ru: Нуриле 58 лет, вдов. Дети Нурилы уже взрослые и проживают отдельно. По хозяйству активно помогает старший сын. Нурила на протяжении 37 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5,00 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Нурилы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы, 12 овец, 10 коз и 4 кобылы. Доходы от бизнес – деятельности Нурилы позволяют покрывать повседневные затраты семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурила обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 нетелей и 1 кобылы. Доходы от кредита Нурила планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины. В следующем году планирует открыть цех по обработке шерсти и создать рабочие места для сельских женщин.
texts.en:
Nurila is 58 years old and a widow. Nurila's children are already grown-ups and live by themselves. The eldest son actively helps her in her business. Nurila has been working with livestock breeding for a period of 37 years, after having started this business with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nurila's hard work, her farm has three cows, 12 sheep, 10 goats and four mares. The income from the business activities allows Nurila to cover the daily expenses of the family. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Nurila turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of two heifers and one mare. Nurila plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals. Next year she plans to open a store for processing wool and create jobs for rural women.

loans.use: To purchase 2 heifers and 1  horse

loans.name: Hotamkul

texts.ru: Хотамкул житель города Худжанд. Ему 31 год. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Хотамкул занимается растениеводством. Он в основном выращивает овощи для торговли. Таким образом Хотамкул зарабатывает на жизнь. Он берет кредит для посева картошки.
texts.en:
Hotamkul is a resident of the city of Khujand. He is 31 years old, and married. He has one child. Hotamkul works with crop production. He mainly grows vegetables for selling. This way Hotamkul earns money for living. 

Hotamkul takes a loan for the sowing of potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es:
Leonidas es un hombre de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con es su esposa e hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos  económicos, Leonidas no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones su esposa cocina un riquísimo Seco de Res para engreírlo, ya que es su comida favorita.
Por iniciativa propia con mucho empeño y dedicación, Leonidas se dedica a la agricultura, él tiene una pequeña parcela en donde siembra tuna , Leonidas trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 6 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su experiencia.
Leonidas se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de infestación de su cultivo con cochinilla, de esta manera Leonidas espera tener una buena cosecha y aumentar su producción de cochinilla para su futura venta, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de ampliar su terreno.
texts.en:
Leónidas, 48, lives in the city of Nazca with his wife and children who he loves and are his main reason for living.  He’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic man who focuses all his efforts into moving his family forward.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources, Leónidas was unable to study a professional career but he would have liked to do so very much.  He likes listening to music in his free time and on occasion his wife cooks a delicious “Seco de Res” to pamper him since it’s his favorite dish.

On his own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Leónidas works in agriculture.  He has a small parcel where he grows cactus apples.  He works every day starting very early in the morning and works for six hours.  He feels good doing his work and thinks he does well because of his experience.

Leónidas is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve provided he will be able to pay the costs of infesting his crops with cochineal.  Leónidas expects to have a good harvest and increase the cochineal production for future sale.  He will thus continue working and striving to get ahead and reach his dream of enlarging his land.

loans.use: to introduce cochineal into his crops.

loans.name: Bedeykan

texts.ru: Бедейкан 50 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей школьного возраста, почти все дети взрослые и обустроены,только 2 из сыновей живут с ней и учатся в школе лицеи. Бедейкан в качестве основного дохода с 1996 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 15,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бедейкан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коров, 8 голов лошадей. Помимо этого они с семьёй обрабатывают 5,99 га земли.  Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет 5,000 KGS от полеводства и животноводства. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бедейкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Купленный скот поможет увеличить доходы, что позволить оплатить кредит.По планам Бедейкан, после погашения кредита ей останется корова как чистый доход.  Доходы от кредита Бедейкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, чтобы накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Bedeykan is 50 years old, she is married and is raising 2 school-aged children; almost all her children are adults and provided for, only 2 sons live with her and go to a lyceum school.  Bedeykan as a main source of income has been raising livestock since 1966, having started this business with 15,000 KGS.  Thanks to Bedeykan's hard work on her farm, today she has 3 cows and 8 horses.  In addition, she and her family work 5.99 hectares of land.  Her monthly income from the business is 5,000 KGS from farming and livestock.  In order to further grow her business Bedeykan turned to "Bai-Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock.  The newly acquired livestock will help Bedeykan increase her profits, and after paying off her loan she will keep a cow as a net profit.  Bedeykan plans to invest the profits from the loan into further increasing her domestic livestock count in order to save money to remodel her home.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Kanybek

texts.ru: Каныбеку 43 года, женат, имеет 3 детей. Супруга Каныбека работает библиотекарем в местной библиотеке . В 1993 году, в поисках дохода для своей семьи, Каныбек начал свой бизнес в животноводстве. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Каныбека, начатое с суммы 10,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство, на сегодняшний день приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов и насчитывает две головы коровы, 16 голов коз, 6 голов рвец и одного жеребца. Доходы от бизнес – деятельности позволили Каныбеку оплатить обучение для троих старших детей. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Каныбек обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 68,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. В планах - вложить доходы в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а в будущем – накопить сумму для оплаты обучения на следующий год.
texts.en:
Kanybek is 43 years old, married, and has three children. Kanybek's wife works as a librarian at the local library. In 1993, in search of an income for the family, Kanybek started his business of livestock breeding. Thanks to Kanybek's persistence and perseverance, having started the business with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS), the farm currently brings in around 10,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk and meat products, and now counts two cows, 16 heads of goats, 6 heads of sheep and one stallion. The income from the business helped Kanybek to pay for the education of his eldest children. 

With an aim to further increase the number of cattle, Kanybek turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 68,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of cattle. He plans to save up the income from further increasing the number of household animals.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Akbermet

texts.ru: Акбермет это полное имя заемщика, Бермет короткое имя.Бермет 56 лет, вдова,дети Бермет уже взрослые и самостоятельные. Бермет с 1979 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 5,00 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день у Бермет имеется очень развитое и хорошее хозяйство. Доходы от бизнеса позволили ей оплачивать все расходы семьи.  Доходы позволили Бермет создать необходимую базу для детей для создания их собственных семей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бермет обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения прибыли от продажи молока. Доходы Бермет планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Akbermet is the borrower's full name, but she goes by Bermet. Bermet is a 56-year-old widow with grown and independent children. Since 1979 Bermet has been working in animal husbandry. She started this business with 5,000 KGS. Now, Bermet has a developed and very well managed farm. Her earnings allowed her to pay all the family's expenses. This profit allowed Bermet create the necessary framework for her children to start their own families. In order to further expand her business, she turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy cows, and to increase her profit from the sale of milk. Bermet plans to invest her earnings into expanding her farm.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Nerwaya Group

texts.fr:
Mme DJENEBOU est responsable du groupe  NERWAYA. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgés à 09 ans. 02 vont  à l’école et elle a 02 personnes  en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes et chaussures depuis 05ans.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Sankansé. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 15 pièces de pagnes et 03 douzaines de chaussures.
Elle  veut  utiliser  ses bénéfices pour s’acheter une moto. Mme  ambitionne agrandir son  champ d’activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. DJENEBOU is the leader of the group NERWAYA. She is a married mother of two children aged 9 and 13 who both go to school. She is supporting two people. 

Mrs. Djenebou has been selling pagnes (colorful West-African cloth) and shoes for five years. She buys her merchandise at the market of Sankansé. Her customers are men and women. 

She plans to buy 15 pagnes and three dozen shoes. She will use her profits to buy a motorcycle. Her goal is to broaden her field of activity and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 15 pagnes and 3 dozen shoes for resale.

loans.name: Turdububu

texts.ru: Турдубубу 46 лет, замужем, воспитала шесть детей. Старший сын Турдубубу женат и у него двое детей.старшая дочка учится в университете, остальные дети маленькие двое учатся в школе и двое еще дошкольного возраста. Турдубубу на протяжении 10 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Турдубубу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы,12 голов овец, 4 козы и 2 лошади. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Турдубубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота, что позволит ей увеличить доходы от перепродажи. На полученные доходы от кредита Турдубубу планирует оплатить учебу дочки.
texts.en: Turdububu is 46 years old, married, and is raising six children. Turdububu's eldest son is married and has two children. Her oldest daughter goes to the university.  She has two school-aged children, and two more of pre-school age. Turdububu has been breeding livestock for more than ten years. She started this business with 10,000 KGS. Through Turdububu's hard work, her farm now has two cows, twelve sheep, four goats and two horses. In order to further expand her business, Turdububu turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase additional cattle. This will allow her to increase her revenue from reselling them. She plans to use the money she makes from her loan to pay for her daughter's studies.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mahmadnosir

texts.ru:
Махмадносир проживает в городе Худжанд. Ему 38 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Махмадносир вместе со всей семьей занимается животноводством. Он у себя дома разводит крупнорогатый скот. Этим видом бизнеса он занимается 14 лет. 
Махмадносир берет кредит для закупа коров.
texts.en: Mahmadnosir lives in the city of Khujand. He is 38 years old, married, and has two children. Mahmadnosir and his entire fmaily work in animal husbandry. He breeds cattle at home. He has been doing this for fourteen years. Mahmadnosir is taking out a loan to purchase cows.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Flor de María, tiene 34 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Su actividad de negocio es la venta de mercadería, desde hace 3 años vende ropa como blusas, camisas, lociones, sandalias etc. las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante, ofrece en su comunidad y a su alrededor. Ella quiere comprar mas mercadería para surtir y cumplir con los pedidos de los clientes, para eso ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 20,000 lempiras. Va comprar más ropa como blusas, camisas, y zapatos. Su sueño es administrar bien el negocio para obtener ganancias y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Flor de María, 34, is married and has two children; she lives in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.  Her business activity is selling merchandise.  For the last three years she’s been selling clothes like blouses, shirts, lotions, sandals, etc.  She sells from place to place in her community and surrounding areas.  She wants to buy more merchandise to stock up and fill customer orders which is why she’s decided to ask for a 20,000 Lempira loan.  She is going to buy more clothes like blouses, shirts and shoes.  Her dream is to manage the business well to earn profits and provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Louyei

texts.en:
Over the past two years, Louyei has still been selling mats and brooms in Kitale and the business is doing great in that her monthly income has increased to KES. 8,000, which she uses to support her family.

Louyei paid her her previous loan well and in good time and she is borrowing a school fees loan with which she wants to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 45-year-old baker in Shanzu Mombasa. He is a married father who supports four, with his wife providing additional income through fish farming. He has been in this business for the past five years and has done great.

Benjamin will use the requested loan to purchase more baking trays and expand his business. He will use the anticipated profit to open up a new branch of his bakery. 

This being his second loan, the previous one was paid successfully. Benjamin hopes to own a full-fledged bakery which can produce different products.

loans.use: to purchase baking trays and expand his baking business.

loans.name: Erkin

texts.ru:
Эркин житель города Худжанд. Ему 27 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Эркин живет с родителями. Его жена домохозяйка. Мать Эркина вместе с его сестрой работаю на рынке. Его отец работает в средней школе, электриком. Эркин имеет средне - специальное образование, он шафер. 
Эркин вот уже девять лет работает по специальности. Он предоставляет услугу по маршруту №113. Также он зарабатывает электриком по найму. Эркин берет кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля.
texts.en:
Erkin is a resident of the city of Khujand. He is 27 years old, and married. He has a child. Erkin lives with his parents. His wife is a housewife. 

Erkin's mother and sister work at the market. His father works as an electrician at a high school Erkin has secondary specialized education, he is a driver. Erkin has worked as this for 10 years already. He provides a service on route 113. Further he earns money as an electrician for hire. 

Erkin takes a loan for the repair of his ca.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Turdihol

texts.ru:
Турдихол трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 52лет.  Она замужем и имеет 4 детей.  Турдихол  живет в  деревне со своей семьей. У нее также имеются 6 внуков.   У них очень дружная и трудолюбивая семья.  Они все вместе занимаются откормом скота. Это их семейный бизнес и единственный доход в семье.  
 Ее сын занимается куплей продажей скота, а Турдихол с невесткой доят корову и продают молоко и молочные продукты  соседям и знакомым. У них имеются две дойные коровы.  Этот вид деятельности им очень нравиться и они с удовольствием этим занимаются. 
 На полученный кредит Турдихол хочет приобрести еще одну дойную корову, так как от продажи молочных продуктов у нее хороший доход и очень большой спрос. Она очень благодарит организацию Кива за финансовую помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Turdihol is a hardworking woman of the age of 52. She is married and has four children. Turdihol lives in a village with her family. She has 6 grandchildren as well. They are a very friendly and hardworking family. They all work with fattening cattle together. This is their family business and the only income for the family. Her son works with purchasing and selling livestock, and Turdihol milks the cows together with her sister in law and sells milk and dairy products to neighbors and contacts. They have two dairy cows. This type of business they like very much and they gladly work with this. 

For the loan received, Turdihol wants to purchase an additional dairy cow, as there is a good income and high demand for the sales of dairy products. She is very thankful to the Kiva organization for the financial help and support.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi, 54, lives in her own house. She works selling coconuts from her home. She’s been in business several years and has gained much experience in sales. Thanks to this, she earns better profits. She is a very hard-working woman, despite her advanced age.

Chizi is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work and who has many goals she wants to reach. She wants to earn a more profitable future for herself and to work hard to reach the success she so desires.

Chizi is asking for this loan to purchase more stock of coconuts for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a hairdresser in Effia Kumah, near Takoradi. She has received schooling through a senior high school level. She is single and has two children. Esther has been a hairdresser for eight years. She is responsible for supporting herself and her children. 

Her loan will be used to purchase hair extensions, creams, and lotions that her clients demand. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her hair salon.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, creams, and lotions that her clients demand.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort sells food stuffs in Effia Kumah, near Takoradi. Comfort has received a trade school education. She is married and has four children. Comfort has been selling food stuffs for eight years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's general expenses. 

Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity and variety of food stuffs to sell in the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her food-selling trade.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity and variety of food stuffs to sell in the market.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur, who is from the town of Yeghegnadzor, lives with his wife and two small children. In addition to working as a driver for a local company, Artur is involved in agriculture. He currently has livestock consisting of 10 cows and 16 chickens, and, with the help of his wife, also maintains an orchard comprised of peach, apricot, cherry, nut, apple and pear trees. Artur sells the gathered harvest to local market traders, which helps him to cover the family's basic costs.

In order to feed the livestock, Artur has requested this loan to purchase forage. This will enable him to ensure his family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy forage for his livestock.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia, a married mother of two, has been selling provisions in Effia Kumah near Takoradi for the past 20 years. Emelia's husband is retired and receives a pension that contributes to the family’s income, but she is responsible for supporting him in paying the family's general expenses.

Emelia's loan will be used to buy an increased quantity and variety of provisions to sell. She hopes to use the resulting new profits to further expand her shop.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity and variety of provisions to sell.

loans.name: Makarimal Akhlakh Gpe 16 Group

texts.fr: Makarimal Akhlakh gpe  16 est un regroupement de 10 femmes qui  évoluent dans le meme secteur d’activité,  et pratiquent  l’achat et la vente de poissons. Elles adhèrent aussi dans le meme groupement d’intérêt  économique Makarimal  Akhlakh. Elles sont représentées par Madame  Oulimata (personne qui est en position assise sur la photo et qui a la main droite  levée sur la photo). Elle capitalise une expérience de 25 ans dans son activité. Elle  sollicite un crédit dans le but d’augmenter son fond de roulement et renforcer davantage son activité de commerce. Son  financement  lui ^permettra  d’acheter du  poisson qu’elle va revendre. Son activité commence chaque jour a 05 heures du matin pour se terminer a 00 heure. C’est une femme mariée et les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de payer les scolarités de ses enfants et de contribuer a l’amélioration des conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Avec l’augmentation de ses bénéfices elle souhaite diversifier son activité de commerce et démarrer la vente de chaussures, tissus et miel. Son projet futur  consiste  à acquérir  un véhicule frigorifique pour les besoins de son activité.
texts.en: Makarimal Akhlakh gpe 16 is a group of 10 women who are all in the same line of business: buying and selling fish.  They all belong to the same group: Makarimal Akhlakh.  Their representative is Oulimata (the lady who is sitting with her hand raised in the photo).  Oulimata has 25 years experience in her business and is requesting a loan so that she can increase her working capital and further strengthen her business.  Her loan will enable her to buy fish to re-sell.  Oulimata starts work every day at 5 o'clock in the morning.  She is a married woman and uses the money she makes from her business to pay for her children's education and to improve her family's nutrition.  With an increase in her profits, she hopes to diversify her business activity and start selling shoes, fabric and honey.  In the future, she plans to acquire a refrigerated vehicle to meet her business needs.

loans.use: to buy fish to re-sell

loans.name: Zippy

texts.en:
Zippy lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is the training ground for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has 3 children and has been farming for 15 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming is keeping poultry and dairy cows!  Her biggest challenge is being able to feed the birds due to high costs of feed.   Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'mrembo nand maua".  She will use the loan to buy poultry birds. 
Zipporah was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied that she learned of Juhudi from a friend.  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session and she replied that she has leared how to boost working capital through micro finance.

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Zippy replied that it will bring increased income from poultry sales.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Zipporah owns the following: 'cow, poultry, and automobile' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, or motorcycle'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, running water, and tv, but does not have 'electricity, sewing machine, or DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is 44 years old.  She is married and has two children, aged 22 and 20. Many years ago, she established  her vegetable farming  business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers for her business. 

 In the future, Sani plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

 Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is from Gndevaz village of Vayots Dzor region. She lives with her husband and is involved in agriculture. Together with her husband, Susanna keeps livestock which currently includes a cow and 15 chickens. She gets milk, uses it in cheese production and sells it to local market traders. As agriculture helps Susanna to get stable monthly income, she would like to expand it. 

Susanna has applied for this loan to purchase a heifer and 20 chickens. This will help her to earn more income and ensure her and her husband's livelihood.

loans.use: to pay for a heifer and 20 chickens

location.town: Gndevaz village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit has been involved in beekeeping for more than ten years. She keeps 19 colonies of bees and gets high-quality honey. She also keeps an orchard where peach, apricot, cherry, apple and pear trees are grown. She works hard to gather a good harvest and sell it to local market traders. 

The agricultural business is the sole financial income for Lilit and her family, so she would like to expand it. Lilit has applied for this loan to purchase a cow and colonies of bees. This will enable her to gather more income and cover the family's basic needs.

Lilit lives with her son, Hovhannes (32 years old), and daughter, Hasmik (30 years old. Lilit hopes that the loan will help her to secure a better future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and colonies of bees.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is married and has four children. She has received schooling through primary school level. Ekua sells plantain chips in Effia Kumah near Takoradi, which she has done for the last 10 years. Her husband is a driver in the area. 

Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in paying the family's general expenses. Ekua will use the loan to purchase more plantains, oil and other supplies necessary to make plantain chips. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to grow her plantain chip trade.

loans.use: to purchase more plantains, oil and other supplies necessary to make plantain chips.

loans.name: Alma Clementina

texts.es: Alma tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos uno de ellos vive con ella en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Doña Alma tiene 3 años de tener el negocio de venta de comida, almuerzos y cenas, vende sopas, carne asada, pollo horneado y pollo frito con tajadas. Ha obtenido muy buenos resultados con este negocio al cual le ha invertido varios préstamos.  El que solicita actualmente es por 10,000 lempiras y es el cuarto ciclo con ODEF, este lo utilizara para comprar insumos como carnes, vegetales, harina, manteca, refrescos, condimentos, granos básicos etc.  Ella quiere mantener más productos en inventario para hacer variedad de comidas y aumentar las ventas. Su sueño es ver su negocio en crecimiento para lograr  mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alma is 46 years old, a single mother, and has two children; one of whom lives with her, in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. For three years, Alma has had a business selling food: lunches and dinners. She sells soups, grilled meat, baked chicken, and fried chicken with plantain.

She is getting good results with this business, in which she has invested several loans. The one she is currently requesting is for 10,000 lempiras, and is her fourth with ODEF. She will use this to buy ingredients such as meats, vegetables, flour, lard, soft drink, condiments, staple grains, etc. 

She wants to keep more products in inventory so that she can make a variety of meals and increase her sales. Her dream is to see her business grow, so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as basic staples, meats, soft drinks, flour, condiments and vegetables for making meals.

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati is married and has four children. She has received schooling through senior high school. 

Fati sells herbal medicine in Effia Kumah near Takoradi and has done so for the past 30 years. Her husband is a driver. Fati uses her income to support her husband in paying the family's general expenses. 

Fati will use the loan to purchase an increased quantity and variety of herbs and natural products to prepare her medicines. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fati plans to develop her herbal medicine shop further.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity and variety of herbs and natural products to prepare her medicines.

loans.name: Nakali

texts.en:
Nakali is 45 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 24 and 20.  In 2000, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 8 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business.  

In the future, Nakali plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

 In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called  'pasal', are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical 'pasal' might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Fenita

texts.en:
Fenita is a seamstress in Effia Kumah near Takoradi. Fenita has received school through senior high school.  She is married and has one child. Her husband is on the cocoa board and works to regulate cocoa in Ghana.

Fenita has been a seamstress for eight years now. She is responsible for helping to support her husband in paying the family's general expenses. Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity and variety of material and sewing supplies. 

Fenita hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her seamstress shop.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity and variety of material and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Dus Maya

texts.en:
Dus Maya is 34 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 14 and 11.  

In 2002, Dus Maya established her brass religious statues-making business. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her business.  

In the future, Dus Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone.  

With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a hairdresser in Effia Kumah near Takoradi. She has attended school through senior high school. She is single and has no children. 

Florence has been a hairdresser for four years. She is responsible for paying to support herself and paying all her own bills. Her loan will be used to buy hair extensions, creams and lotions that her clients demand. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her hair salon.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, creams and lotions that her clients demand.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is married with two children and both go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  

Janet has a business of a clinic and has been in this business for eight years. She generates additional income from a restaurant. 

Janet has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of tablets, syrups and syringes. She works from a shop that she rents seven days out of every week, and she sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. 

Janet aspires to turn her clinic into a fully stocked health centre and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of syrups, tablets and syringes.

loans.name: Jaloliddin

texts.ru: Чалолиддин житель района Рудаки. Ему 38 лет. Он женат, отец четверых детей. Чалолиддин единственный кормилец семьи. У него есть собственный магазин, где он продает аудио диски, устройства для телефонов. Кроме торговли он еще занимается животноводством. Чалолиддин очень целеустремленный человек. По его словам, он раньше был крупным бизнесменом, в его обороте было большое количество товаров, однако его бизнес сгорел. Но несмотря на крах, он начал все с нуля. Сейчас Чалолиддин хочет расширить свой бизнес и еще раз добиться успеха. Он берет кредит для приобретения мобильных телефонов с целью увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Jaloliddin is a resident of the Rudaki region.  He is 38 years old.  He is married and is the father of four children.  Jaloliddin is the sole provider in his family.  He has his own store where he sells CDs and mobile phone accessories.  In addition to sales he also raises livestock.  Jaloliddin is a very goal oriented person.  According to him, he was previously a big businessman and had a large inventory, but his business burned down.  But despite the crash he started again with nothing.  Right now Jaloliddin would like to expand his business and again achieve success.  He is taking out a loan to acquire mobile phones in order to increase his product assortment.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones in ordre to increase his product assortment

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is married with seven children and all her children go to school. She has a business selling used shoes and has applied for a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy more used shoes. She has been in this business for 5 years and works seven days a week. She works at the market and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Noelina

texts.en: Noelina is married with three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling used shoes. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes. She has been in this business for eight years and works at the market seven days a week but on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат проживает со своей семьей в городе Истаравшан. Ей 44 года. Она совместно с мужем занимается животноводством уже 12 лет. Малохат энергичная женщина и трудится наравне с мужем. Она хочет расширить свою деятельность и просит кредит на сумму 3000 долларов для купли-продажи крупно-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Malohat lives with her family in the city of Istaravshan.  She is 44 years old.  She has been raising livestock with her husband for 12 years.  Malohat is an energetic woman and works alongside her husband.  She would like to expand her business and is asking for a loan of 3000 dollars for the buying and selling of cattle.

loans.use: to buy and sell livestock

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses' business is doing quite well in its second year. He bought retail stock form the first loan and realized high sales which enabled him to complete the repayments on time.

His dream of opening a wholesale business is on course and he testifies that the decision to quit casual employment and start a business from his accumulated savings is now paying off. 

Moses is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenyan Shillings to purchase more wholesale retail stock of products such as sugar, cooking fat, tea leaves and soap. He now desires to open another retail outlet and looks forward to earning more income to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more wholesale retail stock of products such as sugar, cooking fat, tea leaves and soap.

loans.name: Mueni

texts.en:
Mueni is quite happy about the progress her business is making. The small business she began through the sale of farm produce is now providing a means to educate her children.

Mueni is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy fruits and vegetables in wholesale. The extra income these products will provide will go towards paying for school fees and repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in wholesale.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses lives in the Likoni area of Central Province, Kenya. He is a married farmer. He started the business through his own savings two years ago. Moses has been a farmer planting tomatoes and mangoes. He is also formally employed.

Moses learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group, and he joined the group with an aim of accessing credit to better his business operations. The main challenge he faces is seasonal weather and a harsh climate.

Moses is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenya shillings to buy seedlings, fertilizers and beehives. His extra income from the loan will be added to the savings to expand the business. His future plan in five years time is to have increased the area under cultivation up to four acres.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizers and beehives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another water tank

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in the Kongowea area of Central province, Kenya. He is a married businessman, running a hardware store which has been in operation for two years. Peter also runs a print shop.

Peter learnt about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to better his business operations. The main challenges he faces are price fluctuations and the high cost of transport.

Peter is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock like battery water, acids, block cylinders etc. His extra income from the loan will be added to the savings to expand the business. His future plan in five years time is to open another hardware store in the area.

loans.use: To buy retail stock like battery water, acids, block cylinders etc.

loans.name: Las Florecitas De San Cristobal Group

texts.en:
Seven hard-working women make up the "Little Flowers Trust Bank of San Cristobal" (Las Florecitas de San Cristobal). Together they have collaborated on two previous loans from Friendship Bridge and have bolstered their small businesses. This group represents a variety of industries: a knitting business, a local clothing store, a convenience store, and a local sewing business. With their previous loans, one member was able to double her sewing capacity by purchasing two more sewing machines and by hiring another employee. 

With this new loan Doña Teresa (in the back row, second from the right), will be able to purchase necessary yarn and needles for her hand-knit sweater business. Having learned to knit as a child, Dona Teresa now has a life-time of experience and is able to help support her seven children. With school fees and the pressures of daily life in Guatemala, Teresa says that she has finally been able to “catch her breath” after receiving her first two loans. She feels that “there is a peace that comes from knowing where your money is going to come from.”

Along with Teresa, Las Florecitas de San Cristobal are excited to support their families, help pay for their children’s education, and even help one member finish building her house. As neighbors they will meet each month for repayments and financial education training with a Friendship Bridge facilitator.

loans.use: to buy necessary yarn and needles for her hand-knit sweater business

loans.name: Javier

texts.en: Javier has a pig farm in an urban zone. Naturally, that doesn't make him popular with his neighbors. In his search for a more effective solution for managing his pig waste, he learned about biodigesters. Using his 16 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, he will reduce the odors and flies emanating from his farm while concurrently reducing his gas and fertilizer costs. He hopes to use the renewable biogas generated by his system to displace the non-renewable and expensive LP gas his family currently uses to cook and heat bath water. This loan represents 63% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 16 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cigarettes, provisions, soap, padlocks, and candles for his business.

loans.name: Mujeres Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.en:
From the rural village of Tecpan, Guatemala, “Las Mujeres Nuevo Amenecer” (the Women of a New Morning) is a group composed of nine remarkable entrepreneurs. Six of the nine women are directly involved in agriculture or the pasturing of animals. From strawberries to artichokes, corn to pigs, the women have generations of experience working with the tough soil of the Western highlands of Guatemala to produce enough for their families.

After receiving four previous group loans from the MFI Friendship Bridge, these women have been able to expand their production to now sell a consistent surplus in the local market. Moreover, Friendship Bridge organized a workshop on organic fertilization and crop rotation for the women this past fall to counteract "slash and burn" erosion and nutrient depletion. 

As the leader of the women, Feliza (in the back row, second from the right), is especially proud of her strawberry crop. She has been able to double her production with the previous assistance of Friendship Bridge. Feliza hopes to expand her farm’s production to include lettuce and cabbage as more durable crops. With nine children, Feliza and her husband are excited to provide more consistently for their family with the hopes that their children can spend more time at school than in the fields.

loans.use: to expand her strawberry production to include lettuce and cabbage as more durable crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials for constructing a dairy unit

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. He has five children and has been farming for 10 years. His primary income sources are milk, tea, crops, job salary, personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "To rear animals like cows." His biggest challenge is "Lack of finance." 

Evans  was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied:"'wanted to buy a cow."  He says, 
"I will name it Juhudi, since I got it through this loan."

This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "How to manage a loan in making repayments in time.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family? Evans replied, "It enables me to enhance my business in terms of being a dairy farmer."
