Elizabeth is applying for a loan of 53,800 Kenyan shillings to buy retail stock (eg. rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc.). The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standards of her family and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of items like rice, sugar, flour, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en: Abdu is a 25-year-old, single man, who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is very hard-working and doing his best to improve his living. He studied and earned a diploma. He never depends on anyone, always doing as much he can to earn money for his daily expenses. However, he is unable to buy some furniture, because what he earns is hardly enough to pay the rent of the small house. He decided to apply for a Youth Loan of 130,000 YER to buy some furniture. He hopes that his living conditions will improve, because he wants to get married.

loans.use: to buy some furniture to use in his house.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is doing well in his cereal business. He has successfully finished repaying his first loan. Now he has borrowed a second loan of KES 21,000, which he intends to use to purchase more cereals and fruits, to add to the stock he has for sale in his business. 

His plans for the additional income are to use part to educate his children and to plow back the rest into the business.

loans.use: to buy more cereals and fruits, to add to the stock he has for sale.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has been in a Buy and Sell business for five years now. She also engages in a sari-sari (variety store), as her second business. She earns 6,000PHP per month. These are the sources of her income.

Josefina is requesting a loan for additional capital in her business. She would like to purchase more items, like canned goods, rice, candies, cookies, shampoos, soaps and toothpaste, to resell.
 
Josefina hopes to expand her business and to be successful, in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items for inventory, like canned goods, rice and cookies.

loans.name: Leonardo José

texts.es: Leonardo de 37 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Soledad con su cónyuge y su hija de 11 años. Allí tiene una tienda mediante la cual vende ranchos víveres, refrescos, aprovechando la clientela que compra al detalle día a día, porque sus ingresos así se lo requieren. Desde hace 3 años inició su experiencia de negocio, tomando como referencia a los trabajadores de una importante empresa que necesitaba los productos de la canasta familiar, y no era fácil su desplazamiento a la plaza del mercado. En ese momento contó con una oferta de un local de una empresa, donde se instaló y hasta la presente allí es muy reconocida en su barrio y en los sectores aledaños, quienes conocen que se encuentra en las instalaciones de esta organización. Ella inicia su día laboral desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. Sus ventas las hace de contado y mediante libranzas, un sistema de descuento que aplica una empresa  a los salarios de sus trabajadores, por autorización de los mismos. Su meta es lograr un surtido diversificado para actualizar su inventario e impactar siempre a su clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará arroz, azúcar, aceite y en general productos de la canasta familiar además de útiles de aseo personal y escolares. Su inversión tendrá éxito, porque aprovecha la época para ajustar su mercancía a la demanda del mercado, todo esto lo hace con el fin de generar cada vez mas bienestar su familia.
texts.en:
Leonardo, age 37, lives in the town of Soledad with his wife and their 11-year-old daughter. There he has a store where he sells snack foods and soft drinks, so he is able to take advantage of the flow of customers who make purchases each day. He relies on this income. Leonardo’s business experience started three years ago. He was recommended by workers at a major company that was in need of everyday household products. However, it was not easy to transport products from the market plaza. At that moment, Leonardo was offered a location where he could set up his shop. Now he is well-known in his neighborhood and in the surrounding areas. His customers know that he keeps his store organized.

Leonardo begins his work at 5 A.M. and continues until 5 P.M. His sales are conducted with cash or through a payment system in which he offers a company discount based on the worker’s salary. The customer must agree to the arrangement. Leonardo’s goal is to update his inventory so that he will have a diversified assortment of products by which he can always influence his customers. For this reason, he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Leonardo will use the money to buy rice, sugar, oil, and general household products. He will also buy personal hygiene products and school supplies.

His investment will be successful because he will take advantage of this time to make adjustments to his inventory in response to market demand. Everything he does is with the purpose of generating more income for the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, general household products, personal hygiene products, and school supplies.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 41 years old, and she is married. She has five children, some of whom are in the school. She is taking a loan of $600 US from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She will use this amount to buy wood, nails, a hammer and a machine, to use for carpentry.

She also raises chickens and pigs. She has been very happy with TRM's program.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, a hammer and a machine, to use in her carpentry work.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is a 46-year-old, married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has 11 children. The oldest is 22, while the youngest is 6 years old. Her husband is a fisherman. Virgilia engages in fishing and, in addition, she is farming seaweed. She has been in the fishing business for 20 years. She sells fish and seaweed to customers in the community.

Due to lack of financial capacity, Virgilia requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fishing nets and seaweed seedlings. Virgilia would like to expand her business in the future, to support her family and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and seaweed seedlings.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene una hija y vive en una aldea del municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua.
Maribel estableció su propio negocio hace 5 años de venta de productos de artesanía, como jarrones, adornos de pared, masetas, todo de barro, también vende canastas de caña, y sillas de madera típicas. El negocio lo tiene a orilla de la calle enfrente a su casa. Ella ha solicitado dos préstamos anteriores y este actual es el tercer préstamo que es por 12,000 Lempiras, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de artesanías de barro y canastas de caña. Ella quiere mantener producto en inventario para incrementar sus ingresos. En un futuro quiere arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Maribel, age 33, is single because she is a widow. She has a daughter and lives in a neighborhood in the town of Taulabe, Comayagua.

Maribel established her own business five years ago. She sells handmade products such as vases, wall decorations, and pots, all made from clay. Maribel also sells wicker baskets and traditional wooden chairs. Her business is located on the edge of the street across from her house.

She has requested two previous loans and her current loan (which is her third) is in the amount of 12,000 HNL. Maribel will invest in the purchase of handmade clay products and wicker baskets. She wants to maintain her inventory of products so that she can increase her earnings. In the future, she wants to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy handmade clay products (vases and wall decorations) and wicker baskets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add retail stock, e.g., rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil and cereals

loans.name: Kaviti

texts.en:
Kaviti is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of four children. She runs a clothes shop, which has been operating for ten years.  She started the shop with the profits from selling farm produce. Kaviti calls her shop "The Village Boutique." She currently lacks a permanent storefront. 

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined to access credit. She is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya Shillings to purchase new clothes to sell and construct a permanent storefront.
 
Kaviti believes the income from this loan will help her educate her children. She is focused on owning a wholesale shop despite the challenge of unpaid debts.

loans.use: To buy new clothes to sell and construct a permanent storefront

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new clothes for sale and sewing materials, like thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is a 27-year-old man from Bien Unido, Bohol. He has two children, who are one and three years old. He has been engaged in a fishing business for three years. This is the source of his income. His monthly income is 2,000 PHP.

Renato is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets, fish hooks, and floaters. Through this loan, he will be able to have a good catch of fish and sell it to his community.

Renato hopes to expand his business, and to send his children to school, in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, fish hooks, and floaters.

loans.name: Raheli

texts.en: Raheli is taking out another loan to start a new business operating a retail shop, thanks to the previous loan that helped her improve her sewing business, and now her shop is doing very well. With this new investment, she will be able to buy foodstuffs, basic grains and instant goods. In future, she wishes to own several businesses.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, basic grains and instant goods.

loans.name: Juan Feliz

texts.es: Juan de 67 años de edad, vive en la hermosa e histórica ciudad de Cartagena, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 18 y 22 años. Allí mismo tienen un taller, en el cual ofrece servicios electrónicos, como mantenimiento y reparación de televisores, radio, D.V.D, que promociona a través de una valla publicitaria. Su negocio abre las puertas desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, a una clientela que ha concentrado entre vecinos de su barrio, de los alrededores y amigos que conocen su oferta y la calidad de su trabajo,  y concurren a solicitarlo. En la actualidad Juan ha recibido 5 financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los cuales ha logrado, mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ganancias. Hoy está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual comprará repuestos para televisores, radios, equipos de sonido, y algunas herramientas que le ayudará a mejorar su tarea laboral. Su meta es lograr mucha mas clientela, para aumentar sus ingresos y cumplir el sueño de brindar a sus hijos una educación de calidad, mientras su gran desafío es a su vez mantenerse actualizado en materia tecnológica, pues cada día los cambios son incontrolables y debe adaptarse a ellos, para poder sostenerse en el mercado.
texts.en:
Juan, 67, lives in the beautiful, historic city of Cartagena with his wife and two children, ages 18 and 22. He has a workshop here, where he services, sells, and repairs electronics such as televisions, radios, and DVDs, and which he promotes on local billboards. His business is open from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. His customers are mostly neighbors and friends, who come to him because they know what he offers and the quality of his service.  

Juan has received five loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he has managed to improve his business and increase his profits. He is applying for a Kiva loan to buy replacement parts for televisions, radios, sound equipment, and tools that will help him in his daily work. His goal is to have more customers so that he can increase his income and achieve his dream to offer his children a quality education. His great challenge is to remain current with technology, since he can't control the ongoing changes and must adapt to stay in business.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for televisions, radios, sound equipment, and tools.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in a retail business. She sells coconut wine and soft drinks to customers in the community. 

Aside from this buy and sell business, Alma is also engaged in fishing. She has been in the fishing business for 5 years. Alma requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like fish nets, fish hooks and fuel for the motorboat which is very helpful in their daily fishing activity. In the future, Alma would like to expand her business to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fish nets, fish hooks and fuel for the motorboat.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Парвина жительница района Рудаки. Ей 34 года. Она замужем. У нее шестеро маленьких детей. Образование у Парвины среднее. Она ответственная и коммуникабельная женщина. Парвина обеспечивает семью занимаясь пошивом национальной женской одежды. Она известная швея в своей махалле. Парвина занимается шитьем более шести лет. Она обратилась за кредитом для приобретения новой швейной машинки. За счет полученной прибыли Парвина хочет купить компьютер своему старшему сыну.
texts.en:
Parvina is a resident of the Rudaki region. She is 34 years old. She is married and has six young children. Parvina has a high school education. She is a responsible and sociable woman. 

Parvina provides for her family by engaging in sewing national women's clothing. She is a well-known seamstress in her quarter. Parvina has been involved in sewing for more than six years. 

She applied for a loan in order to purchase a new sewing machine. With the profits received, Parvina wants to buy a computer for her eldest son.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Qiyomiddin

texts.ru: Киёмиддину 39 лет.Он с женой и 3 детьми проживает в районе Рудаки. У него среднее техническое образование. Киёмиддин работает сварщиком. Он трудолюбивый и опытный работник. Он занимается производством железных ворот и дверей уже 10 лет. Киёмиддин запрашивает кредит. Он хочет закупить сырьё для увеличения объёма производственного товара. За счет полученной прибыли он намерен улучшить финансовое положение в семье, Киёмиддин планирует отправить сына на курсы английского языка.
texts.en:
Qiyomiddin is 39 years old. He lives in the Rudaki region with his wife and three children. He has a secondary technical education. Qiyomiddin works as a welder. He is a hard-working and experienced worker. He has been producing iron gates and doors for ten years. 

Qiyomiddin is requesting a loan. He wants to buy raw materials to increase the production of goods. With his profits, he intends to improve the financial situation of the family. Qiyomiddin plans to send his son to take English courses.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to increase production

loans.name: Ruth Elena

texts.es: Ruth invirtió su credikiva en la compra de alimentos no perecederos y bebidas, con las cuales surtió  su tienda; Con su inversión pudo ahorrar, obtener mas utilidades, ya que cuando se compra en mayor cantidad ayuda a aumentar la rentabilidad. Ruth envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva Trabajar con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con su fondo Kiva, vale la pena, se ahorra en intereses y se lleva una vida mas tranquila. “ En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen víveres al por mayor y alimentos no perecederos, con los cuales obtendrá descuentos y logrará abastecer su negocio, impactando la percepción del cliente, para que siempre regrese y le compre. Pues justamente esto, es lo que hace que los negocios progresen
texts.en:
Ruth invested her Kiva loan in non-perishable food products and beverages so that she could restock her store. With this investment, she was able to save and generate more revenue. By purchasing in large quantities, she was able to increase her profitability.

Ruth sends the following to the Kiva lenders: “By working with the Kiva funds from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, I have been able to save on interest and live a much more peaceful life.” At the moment, she is applying for another Kiva loan so that she can make a large bulk purchase of groceries and non-perishable food items. As a result, Ruth will be able to obtain discounts and restock her business. This will make an impact on her customers’ perception so that they will always want to return and make purchases. This is exactly how businesses make progress.

loans.use: to buy groceries and non-perishable food items in bulk.

loans.name: Murere Ole

texts.en:
Murere has successfully managed to repay his previous loan, though with some difficulties due to a group project that did not succeed as anticipated. 

This time, the client opted to borrow a smaller amount of money from KADET LTD and use it to diversify into animal trading, as well as continuing to cultivate maize. He will use the loan to purchase cows and goats, for resale at a profit. He will use the anticipated profit to pay college fees for his second-born daughter.

He hopes to grow his business to large-scale farming.

loans.use: to diversify his activity into animal trading, as well as maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy jewels for decorating clothing

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty cooks kenkey for sale. She serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce at Ankyenyim near Takoradi. She is married and has 3 children. Betty has done this business for 7 years.  She uses her income to support her husband in feeding the family and paying their accommodation bills. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a stall for the sale of her kenkey and fish.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Mukesio

texts.en:
Mukesio is 58 years old. She is a widowed mother of eight children between the ages of twelve and twenty-six. Mukesio is a livestock farmer, currently involved in a group project through which they acquire funds as a group, and purchase livestock for fattening.

She learned about KADET LTD from women who are already registered members of KADET LTD. This will be her second group loan after paying back the previous loan successfully. She plans to buy more and quality grade cows for selling.

Mukesio hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand the livestock farming project from small-scale to commercial farming. Mukesio's  dream is to do large-scale farming and have her own farm machinery.  She is a painstaking lady who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: to buy more and quality grade cows for selling.

loans.name: Jose Abdubar

texts.es:
Jose, se ha decidido por invertir en los granos básicos, por eso solicita un nuevo préstamo que le permita pagar el alquiler del terreno, que será tres manzanas la cual pagará por dos años, así también comprará insumos agrícolas para aplicarlos al cultivo.

José, comenta que su producción está incrementando, que la agricultura para él la está desarrollando de una mejor manera, las utilidades que ha recibido le han servido para poder ayudar a su familia y juntos mejorar las condiciones económicas.
texts.en: José has decided to invest in staple crop production. He is applying for a new loan to rent three manzanas of land for two years and to buy agriculture supplies for his crops. José has increased his production and has developed his farming skills. His earnings have helped his family, and together they have improved their financial situation.

loans.use: to rent land and buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru:
Насиба жительница города Душанбе. Ей 41 год. Она живет с мужем. У нее двое детей. Насиба добродушная и честная женщина. Она вместе с мужем работает и обеспечивает семью. Образование у Насибы среднее. 
Насиба на протяжении трех лет торгует свежие мучные изделия: пирожки, чебуреки, беляши. Она рядом с домом открыла закусочную. Насиба берет кредит с целью расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en:
Nasiba is a resident of the city of Dushanbe. She is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and has two children. 

Nasiba is a goodnatured and honest woman. She and her husband work and provide for the family. Nasiba has a high schedule education. 

For three years, Nasiba has been selling fresh pastries: pies, pasties, and belyashis (filled pastries). She opened a snack shop next to her home. Nasiba is taking a loan with the goal of expanding her activities.

loans.use: to repair her premises where production is carried out, and also to purchase products

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is 43 years old, married, and has 2 children who are both in school. Editha is in an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Editha would like to build and expand her business to support financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add retail stock; e.g. rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is 59 years old and supports a family of six. His spouse helps in producing some additional income. He runs a farming business and has been in business for the last ten years. His monthly income from the business is KES. 5,000.

Musa has borrowed his fourth loan of KES. 40,000 for a period of one year. He intends to use the loan to purchase farm inputs. He plans to use the additional income to re-invest back into the business and save some for future use.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion, 48, is married, has five children and is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran. 

To make a living, Concepcion runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community. She has been in business for ten years and earns 12,000 PHP a month from her store. 

Concepcion is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to buy more items such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. 

In 2008, Concepcion joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy more items such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste.

loans.name: Mereu

texts.en:
Mereu has joined a group with a project involving purchasing cows for fattening and resale. Besides income from farming, this project has earned a profit for Mereu.  

Mereu is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase livestock for fattening and resale. She hopes to use the proceeds to educate her children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is 30 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children. She lives in San Carlos, where she has earned a living for the last 7 years by selling home goods and home use products. She makes about PHP 7,000 a month and is applying for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. Arlyn joined GDMPC in 2012 as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells maize at Ankyeryim near Takoradi. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a secretary. Comfort has been selling maize for 12 years. She is responsible for helping her husband educate their children. Her loan will be used to buy sacks of maize to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: buy sacks of maize to sell.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia, 34, is a married mother; she has four children and lives in a suburban neighborhood in Samburu. Her economic activity is distributing water to her neighbors. She has been in this business for the last seven years. Sofia wants to grow her business which is why she is requesting this loan to buy two water tanks.

In future, she plans to open a kiosk in her home.

loans.use: to buy two water tanks.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael está  dedicado a la  venta de mercancía y confecciona de prendas a igual tiempo, por eso cuando obtuvo su credikiva compró artículos variados para el hogar y también elaboró camisas y pantalones que vendió muy pronto, pues estaban encargadas. Su negocio ha crédito y su nivel de vida se ha incrementado; él dice a sus financiadores de Kiva lo siguiente: “gracias por el apoyo que dan con los créditos, porque ayudan bastante. Su nuevo crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercancías y algunos insumos para la confección y tendrá éxito, pues su inversión está planificada y garantizada.
texts.en: Rafael sells merchandise and makes clothing at the same time.  When he received his previous Credikiva loan, he bought various home appliances. He also made shirts and pants that he sold very quickly because they were commissioned. Rafael’s business has earned a good reputation, and his quality of life has improved. He would like to say the following to his Kiva financers: “Thank you for the support that you give through loans because they help a lot.”  Rafael’s new loan will be used to buy merchandise and some supplies for making clothing.  He will be successful, since his investment is planned and guaranteed.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and some supplies for making clothing

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is a 47-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has two children. The older is 21 years old and the younger is 17 years old. He has a 'sari sari' or variety store business. He has been in this business for 10 years now. This is the source of his income.

Francisco is requesting a loan for additional capital. Through this loan, he will be able to finance the needs of his business and to purchase more items to sell.

In the future, Francisco hopes to expand his business and to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in his little store

loans.name: Nubis

texts.es: Vitrinas mercancía como perfumes, suéteres, productos capilares con los que la surtió, fue lo que compró Nubis cuando obtuvo su credikiva. Sus ventas aumentaron, prque la exhibición atrajo muchos clientes que compraron, ahora su negocio tienen un mayor tamaño que cuando inició y su vida gira completamente alrededor de sus hijos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva nuevamente con el cual comprará articulos escolares, aprovechando que se acerca la época de ingreso al colegio y en ella venderá mucho mas. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Gracias por apoyarme y hacer que mi negocio creciera y ante todo por creer en mi ¡Gracias!…
texts.en:
Nubis used her previous Kiva loan to buy merchandise such as perfumes, sweaters, and hair care products to stock her displays. Her sales increased because the displays attracted many customers who bought items, and her business has grown. Her life revolves around her children.

She is applying for a new Kiva loan to buy school supplies to take advantage of the new high school year to sell much more merchandise. Her message to Kiva lenders is, "Thank you for supporting me, making my business grow, and most of all, believing in me!"

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Jamalbubu

texts.ru: Жамалбубу получает второй кредит через фонд КИВА.Первый проект протекает хорошо, она планирует получить хороший доход. В этот раз она обратилась к фонду КИВА на финансирование нового проекта. Жамалбубу требуется 50,000 KGS на приобретение семян перца, удобрений,клиентки и на оставшиеся средства она планирует приобрести овец. По ей планам данные проект принесет хорошие средства в летний период.Доходы она будет копить на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Jamalbubu is receiving her second loan from Kiva. The first project proceeds well and she plans to earn a good income. This time, she turned to Kiva to finance a new project. Jamalbubu requires 50,000 KGS to purchase pepper seeds and fertilizers, and the client plans to use the remaining funds to buy sheep. 

According to her plans, this project will bring good money in the summer period. She will save profits for the wedding of her son.

loans.use: to purchase pepper seeds, fertilizers and sheep

loans.name: Sharipa

texts.ru: Шарипе 42 года, мать 4 детей. Шарипа в качестве основного дохода с 1995 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 10,000 сом, потраченной на покупку телки. Благодаря упорному труду Шарипы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется развивающиеся хозяйство. По мимо бизнеса в качестве дополнительного источника дохода Шарипа работает поваром в кафе. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Шарипа обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, так как цены на скот снизились. Доходы от кредита Шарипа планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а в ближайшем будущем планирует обучать детей.
texts.en:
Sharipa is 42 years old and the mother of four children. As the main source of income, Sharipa began to engage in raising animals in 1995, starting with a sum of 10,000 som spent on the purchase of heifers. Through hard work, Sharipa today has a developing homestead. 

Beside the business, as an additional source of income Sharipa works as a cook in a cafe. 

In order to further develop her business, Sharipa appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase cattle, as livestock prices have declined.  

Sharipa plans to invest income from the loan to further increase the number of livestock, and in the near future plans to educate the children.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Meilkan

texts.ru: Меилкан 39 лет, замужем, воспитала четверых детей.  В поисках дополнительного источника финансирования для своей семьи, Меилкан начала свой бизнес в разведении скота и продажи молока, использовав стартовую сумму в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости, Меилкан смогла развить хозяйство, насчитывающее на сегодняшний день 4 коровы и 35 овец приносящее около 8,000 сом ( KGS) от продажи молочных продуктов и перепродажи скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Меилкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров, для увеличения доходов от продажи молока. В ближайшем будущем, Меилкан планирует вложить доходы в увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Meilkan is 39 years old, married, and has raised four children. Looking for a source of additional income for her family, Meilkan launched her own business of raising livestock and selling milk with a starting capital of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work and persistence, she was able to expand her business, so that it currently includes 4 cows and 35 sheep and earns roughly 8,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of dairy products and resale of livestock.

In order to continue developing her business, Meilkan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to purchase 2 cows, with the aim of increasing her income from milk sales. In the near future, she plans to invest her profits into further expansion of her herd.

loans.use: to purchase 2 dairy cows

loans.name: Ekaterina

texts.en:
Ekaterina is from the small town of Ozurgeti. She is 22 years old, married, and lives with her husband, an infant child and her mother-in-law. Ekaterina’s husband works as a distributor, and her mother-in-law is an actress. Both of those family members get small monthly salaries. The income is hardly enough to cover even food and everyday expenses for the family. 

Ekaterina requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for starting a trading business, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of her low income and the lack of experience in her job, which is usually demanded by the local credit providers. 

Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With a family-owned car, Ekaterina will purchase kitchen utensils and different kinds of household items in Turkey for wholesale prices and resell them in her town and nearby villages for a profit. It will be hard work for Ekaterina, but according to estimations, her business will be profitable and increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in the trading business to increase her stock and sales volume. The family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to start up a trading business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married mother of six children and runs a grocery stall, a business which she has been running for three years. She obtained the start-up capital from the casual labour she performed on other people's farms. Mariam also sells fish.

 She learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is bad debts. Mariam is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy grocery stock, e.g., tomatoes, onions, potatoes, kale, fish etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy grocery stock, e.g., tomatoes, onions, potatoes, kale, fish etc.

loans.name: Erdie

texts.en:
Erdie is a 26-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has two young children ages 3 and 1 year old. He is a fisherman. He sells fish, sea shells and sea weed to customers in the community. He has been in the fishing business for three years. 

Due to lack of financial capability to support his family, Erdie requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like floaters, fish net and fuel for the motorboat. In the future, Erdie would like to invest in other ventures to support his family.

loans.use: to buy  fishing materials like floaters, fish net and fuel for the motorboat

loans.name: Jose Laune

texts.en:
Jose Laune is a 32-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has two children. He is engaged in the fishing business. This is the source of his income.

Jose Laune is requesting a loan to buy fish nets, fish hooks, and floaters. Through this loan, he will be able to catch many fish and will be able to sell them to his community.

In the future, Jose Laune hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, fish hooks, and floaters.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is asking for a new loan to pay school fees for her children. She is grateful for the support she is getting through loans which have transformed her living standards. 

Riziki says that she is still in her clothes-selling business and that it is doing well. Also, she is grateful that she is receiving good income from her rental house. 

Her dream is to see her children become professionals, so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mangoes, yams, watermelon, and melons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery stock like tomatoes, onions, potatoes, kale, etc.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: La venta de plátano, yuca, ñame  y gallinas, se ha convertido para Carmen en una forma importante y saludable de ganarse la vida desde que llegó desplazada con su familia, conformada por 7 hijos pequeños y su cónyuge y con pocas posibilidades de ingresos. Inicialmente se dio cuenta que en el barrió donde habita resultaba muy difícil conseguir tubérculos, y gallina, por eso acudió  las fincas mas cercanas, para comprar y vender a estos clientes que requerían satisfacer mas fácilmente,  la necesidad de consumo de estos artículos de la canasta familiar. Ella ha recibido 1 crédito de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual ha logrado invertir y genera utilidades con lo que ha comprado todo lo necesario para vivir un poco mejor y para llevar a sus hijos una educación con la que a futuro puedan salir adelante. Su meta mas adelante es tener una tienda donde vender ranchos, víveres, cárnicos y todo lo que la clientela necesita para el consumo diario en sus hogares y que pueden comprar solo en pequeñas cantidades. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará plátanos en mayor volumen, y gallinas, productos en los que adquiere precios muy competitivos e igualmente traslada a sus consumidores, por eso a ella la prefieren y esto es justamente lo que hace que su credikiva sea exitoso, pues su experiencia en el mercado convoca muchos compradores, que   traen a su negocio utilidades, con los que continua apoyando el bienestar de su familia y esto la hace muy feliz..
texts.en: Selling plantains, yucca, yams and hens has become an important and healthy way for Carmen to make her living ever since she arrived displaced with her family, made up of seven small children and her partner, with few income possibilities. Initially, she realized that in the neighborhood where she lived it was difficult to get tubers and hens. That is why she went to buy them at the nearest farms and sell them to clients that needed an easier way to meet their consumption of these basic family staples. She has received a loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she has managed to invest and generate profits. With them, she has bought everything necessary to live a little bit better and to provide her children with an education with which they will be able to get ahead in the future. Her goal in the future is to have a store where she sells snacks, basic provisions and meat products and everything that customers need for everyday consumption in their homes and that they can only buy in small quantities. Currently, she is applying for a Kivaloan, with which she will buy plantains in greater volume and hens, products that she acquires at very competitive prices that she passes on to her consumers, which is why they prefer her, and is exactly what makes her Kivaloan successful. Her experience in the market brings her a lot of buyers that make her business profitable and with which she continues supporting the wellbeing of her family. This makes her very happy.

loans.use: to buy plantains in greater volumn, and hens

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. He is a carpenter. Samson began the trade after completing his studies in the craft course. He obtained the start-up capital from a microfinance institution. 

Samson was introduced to Milango by his friends and joined to access credit. He is applying for a loan of 5,650 Kenya shillings to purchase a planing machine. 

Samson believes this will help him educate his child, despite the slight challenges of bad debts and inflation. His ambition is to set up a school from where he can train other young people in the same skills.

loans.use: to purchase a planing machine.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis tiene sesenta y tres años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo de 28 años de edad, completamente independiente,  tiene una pulpería en las instalaciones de su casa desde hace 28 años, donde comercializa granos básicos y productos para el consumo del hogar, y que es administrado por su esposa, ya que él trabaja como docente en dos colegios, el pequeño negocio lo inicio con ahorros propios, siendo ahora un negocio con mucha estabilidad, el objetivo del préstamo es invertir en más mercadería para surtir la pulpería como: y así dar un mejor servicio a su clientela ofreciéndole productos variados y a precios accesibles, una de sus metas es extender y capitalizar su negocio.
texts.en: Luis is 63, married, and has an independent 28-year-old son. Luis has a small grocery store in his home, where he sells staple items and household goods. His wife manages the store because he teaches at two high schools. He started the business with his savings, and it is stable. He will use the loan to buy more inventory for his store so that he can offer customers better service and a variety of items at affordable prices. One of his goals is to expand and finance his business.

loans.use: to have working capital to stock his business with groceries such as rice, beans, bread, milk, salt, matches, cigarettes, juices, sodas, and more.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, se ha decidido por comprar más insumos para la venta de comida y surtir más el rubro en la venta de ropa nueva, se comprará aceite, condimentos, vegetales, carnes, así como en la ropa invertirá en Blusas, pantalones, camisas, y otro tipo de variedad que le permitirá seguir en el comercio y ganar nuevos clientes.

El considera que el efecto en su negocio es positivo, cuando utiliza estos préstamos de una forma ordenada, pues ha surtido de mercadería y ha creado un nuevo rubro que es la venta de ropa, esto significa un crecimiento económico para él y para su familia, manteniendo las condiciones adecuadas y creciendo en el mercado.
texts.en: Julio has decided to buy more supplies to prepare food and more clothing to sell. He will buy oil, condiments, vegetables, and meats, as well as blouses, pants, shirts, and other clothing to stay in business and attract new customers. He believes that using these loans in a strategic manner helps his business, as he has purchased inventory and opened his new clothing business. Finances have improved for both him and his family, and he has maintained his facilities and increased his market share.

loans.use: to buy oil, condiments, vegetables, and meats.

loans.name: Fernando Antonio

texts.es:
Fernando, se ha decidido por mantenerse trabajando en la producción de pollos de engorde, para esto acude a solicitar un nuevo préstamo que será utilizado en la compra de concentrado por mayoreo para la alimentación de los pollos.

Con el préstamo anterior logro tener una experiencia positiva, sus ingresos han aumentado con las ventas de los pollos, con esto ha logrado subsistir con su familia cubriendo las necesidades más importantes, como lo es la alimentación y el estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fernando continues working at his business of fattening chickens.  This is why he comes to request a new loan.  He will use the new loan to buy concentrated feed wholesale in order to feed the chickens.

He managed to have a positive experience with the previous loan.  His income has increased with the sale of the chickens.  With this he has managed to support his family and cover the most important necessities like food and education for his children.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed in order to feed the chickens.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy has been running a beauty salon business for one year. She is a married woman with only one child. Her main priority is to increase her sales and profit. To make her dreams possible, she is seeking additional capital of PHP 10,000. She will be using this loan amount to buy hair color and other chemicals needed in her beauty salon business.

Joy is assisted daily by her mother because her husband works at her aunt's shop. She and her husband work together to have a better way of living and a viable source of income. As a beginner, she is in need of more capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000, which will be used to buy hair color and other chemicals needed in her beauty salon. She believes that completeness of materials for her business will enable her to encourage more customers to go to her business place and will give her the assurance to earn a better income. So, she is hoping for approval of her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy hair color and other chamicals needed in her beauty salon business

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda offers a variety of merchandise and livestock supplies for fish and hogs. She has operated her aqua shop and retail store for more than three years. She is 37 years old and married. She and her spouse have been blessed with three children.

Glenda aims to increase her sales and profit so she can provide her family with comfortable living conditions and meet all of their daily needs. In order to attain her goal in life, she is seeking another loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP. The loan will allow her to buy a variety of merchandise and additional sacks of aqua feed and hog feed. She hopes that her requested loan is approved so that she can satisfy all of her customer demand and become a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, aqua feed, and hog feed to sell

loans.name: Felyn

texts.en:
Felyn is 32, a very hardworking mother of three. She is searching for a good life with her family, so she is doing her best to help her husband’s source of income to become more profitable. She operates a motorcycle transport business, and her husband is her driver.

In this matter, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase new tires and to pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She hopes to obtain the desired loan to make an improvement to their source of income. She also operates a piggery business at home as additional earnings.

Hopefully, her family’s living will soon be upgraded.

loans.use: to purchase new tires and to pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Silvino

texts.en:
Silvino is 42 years old, married and had three children who peacefully lived at Carilucud. He is a farmer who plants and harvests rice to sell. His wife is a vendor and a hog raiser, too. Together, they generate income for their family's sustenance. He is asking for a loan of 32,000 PHP to buy urea (fertilizer), insecticides and pesticides to use in farming. This will help maintain healthy crop growth leading to a good harvest for his farming business. 

In the future, Silvino would like to maintain his farming business for his children's education and for the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy urea ( fertilizer), insecticides and pesticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel is a rice grower in Solana. He had been planting and harvesting rice to sell for over 10 years now. He is 40 years old and had two children who attend school. Education is the only legacy he could pass on that is why he strives hard to give the best education to them. He had insufficient funds to maintain his farming business, which is his only source of income. From this, he is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy inputs to enhance crop production. He will buy fertilizers and pesticides to use in farming.

With a plentiful harvest, Rodel will save more funds for his children's education and keep growing as a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Edlyn

texts.en:
Edlyn, 19, married, and they have no child yet. She has been managing a  mini-restaurant for almost one year. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional ingredients to cook more dishes to sell to be able to satisfy her customers demands. 

She is hoping that her profits will helps her a lot to improve and expand her business through the help of KIVA and ASKI.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients to cook more dishes to sell.

loans.name: Ludivico

texts.en:
Ludivico is from the village of Paddad and a member of the third gender community. He is 25 years old and still single. Ludivico is a hog raiser. 

Right now, he is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders for PHP 30,000 for the maintenance and growth of his livestock business. 

Ludivico is grateful that Kiva, through ASKI, will give him a chance to improve his business.

loans.use: for the maintenance and growth of his livestock business

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is 40 years old, married, and the mother of two children. For the last 21 years, she has earned a living by operating a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells items such as canned goods, noodles, candies, and beverages. She earns about PHP 15,000 a month and is requesting a loan for PHP 50,000 to buy items to sell in her store. She will use the additional income made possible by this loan to pay for her daily expenditures and the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en: Over the years, Angeles has earned a living by working in many different fields, including direct selling and selling frozen foods. Today she earns a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells items such as snacks, drinks and spices. She is the 55-year-old mother of two children, and this store is how she supports her family and pays her household expenses. Her goal for the future is to expand her business, and she is requesting this loan for PHP 25,000 to buy dried fish, eggs and canned goods to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, eggs and canned goods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard selling plastic wares to the people in her village in order to sustain her family's needs. She is 41 years old, married, and has three children. Her spouse is her partner in the business. They offer plastic products on a house-to-house basis. She usually earns approximately 8,000 PHP each month, which goes to the family's meals and school expenses. She would like to sell more products to increase her income. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy basins, hangers, and pails to sell.

Elsa would like to keep the business profitable to save funds for emergency purposes. It will also help sustain her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy basins, hangers, and pails for sale.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites engages in the selling of bottled drinks, curls and candies. At night she sells “balut” for additional income. Marites' husband is a farmer. They are blessed with three children who are studying.

Marites wishes to sell street food, but she doesn’t have enough capital to start. Marites decided to take a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy balut and drinks to sell. She believes she will earn higher income and fulfill her wish.

loans.use: to buy balut and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 38 years old and separated with four children. As a single parent, she has many obligations to her children. For the past year, Susan has managed a shop where she sells meat. She is thankful that her business runs smoothly through her hard work and determination.

Susan is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy stocks of frozen meat to increase her stock and meet customer need. She hopes her loan will be approved as her household expenses have increased. In the future, Susan plans to give her children a quality education and provide a better way of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of frozen meat to increase her stock

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en: Dominga is 32 years old, married, and the mother of two children, both of whom are still in school. She earns a living by raising hogs and selling them after she has had them for 3 1/2 months. She is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy additional hogs to raise and to buy hog feed. She earns a profit of PHP 1,500 from every hog she sells, and uses most of her income to cover the cost of sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs to raise and feed for them to eat.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 52 years old, married and has six children. Nida sews curtains, school and office uniforms to sell. Her spouse is a farmer. Together, they generate income for the family's sustenance. She usually earns about P8,000 each month in her business. She would like to increase her income to keep funding her children's school needs. 

Nida is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy thread, fabric, and tailoring chalk use in sewing. This will help improve her services.

Nida would like to keep improving services to her customers. Good sales from her small business will help her to achieve financial stability someday.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, and tailoring chalk used in sewing

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en: Ronnie is 22 years old, single and newly graduated from college. He aims to earn and save more income in order to purchase a piece of land and build his own house before he settles down. Due to a lack of job opportunities, he decided to engage in hog-raising to generate income. He planned to raise more piglets for sale but he does not have enough capital. Therefore, he is requesting an additional P35, 000.00 to buy the needed feed, vitamins and vaccines for his piglets. He believes that having patience and sacrifices will enable him to improve the business and hopes that he will become successful and financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed for his piglets.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma, 42 years of age, is married. She is blessed with 4 children. She has been operating a retail store for almost 15 years. She earns Php 2,000 each month. She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 to purchase additional commodities to sell. Her profits will go to her daily expenditures and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional commodities for her retail store

loans.name: Tirso

texts.en: Tirso's business is a barber shop. He has been in this business for four years. He usually earns about a minimum of PHP 500 each day. Tirso is 38 years old and still single. At this moment, Tirso wants to have additional capital so he is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy materials for his barber shop such as scissors, combs, curlers and powder. Tirso hopes that he can get the amount he requested to further develop his business.

loans.use: to buy materials for his barber shop such as scissors, combs, curlers and powder

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.en:
Dionicia is married and has eight children. Her husband is a vegetable vendor in the market. Both are working hard just to feed their children and meet their necessities. The couple is preparing for the education of their children. They want them to have a higher education to find a better job someday. They don’t them want to be like they are, hardly able to find a better job because they did not have an opportunity to pursue a higher level of education.
With her determination to help her husband carry out their family in poverty, Dionicia engaged herself in selling snack foods, drinks and other daily household consumables. Dionicia wishes for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy vinegar, soy sauce, powdered juice and beverages. She hopes to earn income for the preparation of her children education. She believes that her loan will make a big contribution towards her success..

loans.use: to buy vinegar, soy sauce, powdered juice and beverages.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is a hardworking father who is a tricycle (motorcycle) driver at Enrile. He has three children and his spouse works abroad. Francisco's transportation business allows him to earn approximately 200 PHP each day. Francisco would like to maintain good transportation services, which is why he is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy gasoline and crude oil for his motorcycle. 

Francisco would like to earn more income and save for his children's education. This will lead to financial stability someday.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and crude oil for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine has operated her footwear business for two years and four months. She is happily married and has only one child. Catherine aims to have a better way of living and improve her business.

Catherine would like to add in-demand shoes and slippers to her inventory so she can encourage more customers to buy her products. However, due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP. She hopes that the lenders will approve her loan so she could improve her profits to serve her family's basic needs and save for her future security and the education of her only child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of shoes and slippers for her business.

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
“Every successful person in life began by pursuing a passion, usually against all odds” is a guiding principle of Christian. He is 28 years old, married and has two children. He is managing a dry goods business which sells an assortment of ready to wear clothes. He has been in this business six years, since he finished his college education.
Christian inherited the business from his parents. Christian wishes for the growth of the business and to maintain it especially since he has to family to feed. Christian is requesting a loan of P30,000 to buy dresses, short pants and shirts. He hopes to maintain the business, increase his income and give his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy dresses, short pants and shirts.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 34 years old, married, and has five children. To generate income, Elizabeth has been running a "sari-sari" store, or variety retail business, for two years. She earns a minimum of about 300 PHP a day, and her income is just enough for her children's allowances and meals. Therefore, Elizabeth is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, vegetable oil, and condiments to sell. Elizabeth believes that due to her patience in managing her business her income will increase.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a business oriented and hard working woman. She is married and blessed with three children. Her youngest child is still studying while the other two are out of school.

Grace's spouse is a tricycle driver. The couple desires to have a comfortable lifestyle and have a stable source of income so she can supply all their daily household needs and educate her youngest child. Grace is happy to see that her direct selling and networking business is improving. She is glad because her networking business which sells herbal products has increased her income. She started this networking business in September which makes it about four months old. In order for her to obtain her goal in life, she is asking for additional capital of PHP30, 000, allowing her to stock herbal products such as food supplements, coffee, juice drinks and other products. She knows that through adaptation of new marketing strategies and increasing the products she offers to her local community she will be able to attain her goals in life. Grace hopes that the lenders will continue to support her financially so she can have continuous growth of her direct selling and networking business.

loans.use: to buy herbal products such as food supplements, coffee, juice drinks and other products for her networking business.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en: Sharon, 24 years old, is married with one child. She's into the fish selling business in their village. She used to buy some fish at the public market in Cauayan City and sell it in their village. She's been in business for almost two years. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional fish to sell. Her profits will be used for their daily expenditures.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en:
Flordelisa is 40 years old, married and has three children. She raises hogs to sell as income. She usually gains approximately P2, 000 with each hog sold. She has been in this business for almost three years now. Flordelisa is now asking for additional capital to invest in her hog-selling business. She will buy feed, vaccines and medicines for sustainability. This will help the hogs to be healthier. 

In the future, Flordelisa would like to make her business more profitable to earn income that can be reserved for her family's emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a registered veterinary physician who owns a pet shop and, at the same place, her clinic. Her pet shop has been in operation for one year and six months. Mary Ann is married and has two children. Her spouse is an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW).

Mary Ann isn't yet satisfied with the improvement of her business and she aspires to continually grow her business. With regards to this matter, she is seeking additional capital of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to buy some veterinary supplies such as dog food and vaccines.  Some of the amount will be used to buy stocks of cosmetic products for her direct selling business.

Mary Ann hopes to get this loan amount so she could further earn greater income, which will be used in expanding her pet shop and direct selling business. She knows that she can make her business progressive because of her determination and wise management of her pet shop business. Mary Ann believes that her pet shop will become popular someday because of her quality costumer service and new strategies in advertising her products.

loans.use: to buy some veterinary supplies such as dog food and vaccines, and some to buy cosmetic products for her direct selling business.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita is 43 years old and married with four children. To earn a living, Emelita is engaged in a transportation business using her motorcycle. She has been in this business for two years and usually earns about PHP 300 a day. Right now, Emelita is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy new wheels, a sprocket and gasoline for the maintenance of her transport motorcycle. She hopes that she can obtain her desired loan to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy new wheels, a sprocket and gasoline for the maintenance of her transport motorcycle.

loans.name: Honorlita

texts.en:
Honorlita is 41 years old, married and has four school-age children. Having no other job opportunities, she set-up her own catering business and put her gown and bridal costume up for rent. This is her way of helping her husband in generating income to support the education of their children. Being a kind and friendly mother, she was able to win more customers. 

Therefore, she decided to acquire all the needed materials for a catering service so she can provide a better service. To work out her plan, she is asking for an additional sum of PHP 15,000 to buy new sets of wedding gowns, curtains, plates, glasses, plates and chairs needed for the catering service. She believes that his loan will help her to make an improvement in the business. Through hard work, she believes that she will make the business viable and profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy new sets of wedding gowns, curtains, plates, glasses, plates and chairs needed for her catering service.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a hard-working mother who is engaged in buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the market to supplement her husband's income. She is 54 years old and blessed with seven children. Three of them are still studying and they want them to earn a degree so that they will be employed some day. 

Due to the high cost of school fees and transportation, Estelita aims to improve her business to increase her income. Due to inadequate capital, she is requesting an additional PHP 12,000 to buy more stocks of onions, garlic, calamansis, ginger, squash, egg plants, oranges and cabbages to sell. She mentioned that this loan will be a great help for her in her effort to improve the business and she is hoping that she will make the business grow and become more profitable. In the future,she hopes that all her children will become professionals and have an stable job.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of onions, garlic, calamansis, ginger, squash, egg plants, oranges and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 55 years old, married and has three grown-up children. She has been engaged in selling footwear in the market to generate income. She aims to improve and strengthen the business to make it more viable and profitable. She has been in the business for almost four years and usually earns a profit of 8,000.00 PHP a month that she utilizes for her family's daily consumption and allowances for her children in school. To improve the business, she is asking for additional capital of 50,000.00 PHP to buy additional stocks of footwear like shoes, sandals and slippers to sell. Through her patience and hard work, she believes that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy additional shoes, sandals and slippers to sell.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn engages herself in transportation and livestock businesses. She has been running her transportation business for nine years. Rubelyn is glad because her husband is supportive in improving their businesses.

Rubelyn would like to take out for a loan of PHP20,000 which will be used in the repair and maintenance of her side car and some of the amount will be used to purchase two piglets as an additional source of income. She hopes to get this loan amount so she can provide her passengers with a quality service, which will enable her to earn larger profits. This will serve to provide her family’s basic necessities and the education of her eldest child and some will be to save for their emergency purposes.

loans.use: to be used in the repair and maintenance of her sidecar and in buying two piglets.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana is a small business entrepreneur living in Libag with her family. She is 38-years-old and has been running her business selling livestock feed for about three years. She would like to make her business more profitable but has insufficient funds to buy more products to sell. To meet her goal, Viviana is borrowing PHP 30,000 to buy sacks of livestock feed, vaccines and medicines to sell in her store. 

Viviana hopes to keep extending friendly and affordable services to all her customers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of livestock feed, vaccines and medicines to sell in her store

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is a tricycle driver who patiently provides motorcycle transport services to the people in his village. He is 48 years old, and has two children. He aims for a better living conditions, that is why he keeps on generating income for the sustenance of his family. His income goes for their meals and the children's allowance.  

Francisco availed himself of a loan to maintain his business. He is asking for PHP 8,000 to buy gasoline and crude oil used in the motorcycle. He will also use it to repair the existing trouble with the vehicle. From this, he will continuously provide a better service to all his passengers.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and crude oil to use in the motorcycle.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 41 years old, and is married with three children. To raise her family, Elizabeth is engaged in a hog-raising business. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns about PHP 7,500 per hog after four months.
Elizabeth wants to have more hogs to raise but she lacks the necessary capital. In this regard, Elizabeth is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy additional hogs to raise and the feed for them. Elizabeth hopes to grow her business and increase her income, so that she will secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs to raise and the feed for them.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is an entrepreneur who lives in Enrile with her spouse and children. Judith's business is selling and raising hogs to get an income. She has been doing it for three years now and earns approximately PHP 2,000 for each hog she sells. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to increase her sales. She will buy feeds, and vaccines to make the hogs sustainable. She hopes to sell them at a higher cost and earn more money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vaccines to make the hogs sustainable.

loans.name: Neddie

texts.en:
Neddie is 39 years old, married and has three school-age children. She and her husband aim to upgrade their status of living in order to educate their children and give them a better life. In this regard, they help each other in generating income to support the education of their children. As a way of gaining income, she is engaged in buying and selling agricultural inputs while her husband manages their rice-farming business. 

Due to the high cost of school fees and commodities, she aims to improve the business in order to generate a higher income. She plans to acquire more agricultural inputs to sell but she has not enough capital, therefore, she is asking for an additional PHP 10,000 to buy more stocks of fertilizers, insecticides, feeds and other agricultural supplies for sale. She believes that this loan will be a great help and allow her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fertilizers, insecticides, feeds and other agricultural supplies to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is married and has four children. She plans to put her children through school and give them a better life. Despite the hardships of her life, she is striving hard to meet her necessities and support the education of her children. To earn additional income, Marilyn is in the hog-raising business. She plans to raise more pigs to sell but due to insufficient capital she has not been able to pursue her plan. Therefore, she is requesting additional capital of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. She believes that through this loan she will be able to make her plan work and hopes that she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs, and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a vendor from Liwan. She is 52 years old, married, and had five children. She is selling vegetables as a source of income, while her spouse is a farmer. She gains about Php 5,000 each month in this kind of business. She would like to increase her income; that is why she is asking for additional capital to invest in buying more vegetables to sell. From the loan of Php 6,000 she will buy cabbages, tomatoes, and eggplant. 

Though she generates only minimal income from her business, Amalia hopes that she will achieve financial stability someday.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, and eggplant to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 46 years old and has two school-age children. She lives in a rural community and runs a small variety store to generate income. Due to unavoidable circumstances, she was separated from her husband. Despite this, she has the determination to support her family and uplift their standard of living. She aims to improve her variety store in order to increase her income and support the education of her children. Due to insufficient capital, she is requesting an additional P15, 000.00 to buy additional stocks of junk foods, canned goods, noodles, candies, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to sell. She believes that this financial assistance will be a great help to improve the business and hopes that someday she will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of junk foods, canned goods, noodles, candies, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a proud mother who lives in Amulung with her spouse and children. She is operating a small business in the front of her house and sells grocery items to the people in their village. She earns approximately P5, 000 each month. It is used for meals and allowance of her children who are in high school. She is asking for a loan of P21, 000 to buy more goods to sell. She will buy canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, and bottles of vinegar and cooking oil. This will help increase sales and income as well. 

She hopes to keep giving good service to her costumers and that she will grow as a successful retail store owner.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, and bottles of vinegar and cooking oil to sell in her store.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en: Pedro is a responsible father who runs a small restaurant in his community to generate income. He is 28 years old, married, and has two infant children. To lessen the hardship of his life, he plans to improve his restaurant and increase his income. He hopes to improve his family's standard of living and give them a better life. Since he does not have sufficient capital, he is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fresh meat, fish, vegetables and seasonings to be cooked and sold in the restaurant. As he is a hard-working father, he believes that he will be able to improve his business with this financial assistance. In the future, he is hoping that he will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy fresh meat, fish, vegetables and seasonings to be cooked and sold in his restaurant.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia, 48 years of age, is married and has four children. She has operated her retail store in their village for almost two years, and she earns approximately PHP 300 a day. She wants to request a loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders to purchase noodles, condiments, assorted breads and curls (chips) to sell in her retail store. She is patient and determined to improve her business to supplement the needs of her family. Her profits will be used as additional working capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, condiments, assorted breads and curls (chips) to sell in her retail store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 33 years old, married, and has six children. She provides sustenance to her family through income derived from selling the hogs she raises. She has been managing her hog-raising business for over five years now. She hopes to make it profitable and she need additional capital of PHP 12,000 to buy necessary feed and medicines for her hogs. Virgina hopes to keep raising healthy hogs and sell them profitably. This will help her achieve financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for hogs

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina is from the small village of Bagnos. She has had a retail store based in her home for one year. The daily net profit of 300 PHP is just enough to cover the cost of her family's daily meals. To improve her income from the store, Carolina is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional stock of items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients to resell. She is patient and determined to improve her business to supplement the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients to resell.

loans.name: Jovalyn

texts.en:
Jovalyn is 31 years old, married, and thankful for having one child. Her family is her motivational guide, and she works hard to give them a better quality of life by doing something that brings additional income and that will allow her to support her child's needs. She has had a retail store based in their home for two years. The daily net profit of 300 PHP is just enough to cover the cost of the family's daily meals. 

Thus, she is thankful for having other sources of income aside from retailing: she has also raised pigs for three years. To improve her income in the store, Jovalyn is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional stock of items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients. She will also buy feed and vaccine for her pigs. Jovalyn says the loan will be very helpful in the success of her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.en:
Leopoldo is 51 years of age and has seven children. He is a farmer in their community, and this has been his main source of income. As head of the family, he always wanted to see his family in a good way of living.  For this reason he’s in need of additional working capital to purchase the necessary supplies for his farming to achieve a good income. 

He is asking for a loan amount of P15,000 to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers. Hopefully, this time his crop will yield more so that he can at least lessen the poor living they have.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Marvie

texts.en:
Marvie is 43 years old, married and has four children. They live at Amulung where she put up a small buying station for rice and corn. Her spouse is her partner in managing the business. Marvie also works as a teacher.

Marvie is now asking for a loan to invest in expanding their business. She hopes to keep increasing income for the education of their children. She is asking for a loan of 50,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy additional farm supplies (fertilizers) to sell. She will also use her loan as additional revolving capital in buying corn and rice to re-sell.

Someday, with good profits, she will achieve financial stability and give the best education to her children.

loans.use: to buy additional farm supplies (fertilizers) to sell

loans.name: Rosalen

texts.en: Rosalen, from the village of Bagnos, is 34 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She works hard through her retailing business, which she has had for almost one year. To improve it, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, eggs, noodles, soft drinks and assorted breads to sell. Rosalen says that the loan will be very helpful in contributing to the success of her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, noodles, soft drinks and assorted breads to sell.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en:
Raising hogs for future sale is one of the businesses of Ceferina, who lives in Enrile. She is 32 years old and has six children. She has been in the hog-raising business for about three years now. She earns 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) for each hog sold. Aside from raising hogs, she also manages a store. Her income is just enough for their sustenance for meals and the allowance of her children.

Ceferina hopes to increase her profits, so she would like a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs. This will ensure good nutrition of the hogs and someday they will sell for a higher price.
